It is said: The **One Dipper** (*Yīdǒu*) completion is the **Kui Star**’s envoy. First, walk the **Earthly Measure** (*Dìjì*) and the **Celestial Dipper’s Ropes** (*Tiāngāng*), until the sequence reaches the **Three Generals’ Ropes**. When the **Three Ropes** are complete, then store the **Dipper’s Envoys** to strike and subdue. The scripture states: *"First walk, then summon the North Dipper’s Seven Stars to seize and kill"*—this is the **First Completion**.

Then turn the fingers to point at objects, but do not yet rely on the mouth. One must practice diligently and grow thoroughly familiar through prolonged study.

When the two methods yield results, the North Dipper follows, and whatever the mouth desires in intent, the fingers shall verify.

The **One Dipper** has its own diagram; store and visualize it for completion.

When visualization is complete, recite the invocation:

> *"One Dipper complete, Three Five united,*
> *Heaven reversed, Earth overturned,*
> *Follow my commands as envoys.*
> *As it is, so it shall be done—just as the law decrees."*

The **Two Dippers** completion is the envoy of the **□ Star**. Also, store the **One Dipper** completion, then proceed to the **Two Dippers** completion.

When the envoys are stored within the body, the practice succeeds and one attains communion with spirits. The body can then awe and subdue objects, safeguard life, rescue and gather the lost, and achieve anything desired—this is called the **Two Stars’ Envoys’ Awe**.

The **Two Dippers** also have their own diagram; store and visualize it for completion, and it shall manifest.

Recite the invocation:

> *"Two Dippers complete, Three Five enlightened,*
> *Gather and subdue malevolent spirits,*
> *Wickedness and evil shall submit in fear.*
> *As it is, so it shall be done—just as the law decrees."*

The **Three Dippers** completion is the envoy of the **□ Star**. Also, store the **Two Dippers** completion, then proceed to the **Three Dippers** completion.

When the envoys are stored within the body, its spiritual power gradually grows awe-inspiring. The **Three Manifestations** (*Sānyào*) radiate like light, and the form of the Dipper blazes upon the body. The **Three Dippers** also have their own diagram; store and visualize it for completion, and the envoys shall manifest in effect.

Recite the invocation:

> *"Three Dippers complete,*
> *Heaven and Earth purified,*
> *The Dipper follows my body,*
> *Those who see it shall flee in terror.*
> *As it is, so it shall be done—just as the law decrees."*

The **Four Dippers** completion is the envoy of the **□ Star**. Also, store the **Three Dippers** completion, then proceed to the **Four Dippers** completion.

When the envoys are summoned, the practitioner blazes with fire encircling the **Four Dippers**, assuming the Dipper’s form. Malevolent spirits and wickedness shall tremble, their hearts crushed and subjugated.

The **Four Dippers** also have their own diagram; store and visualize it for completion, and the envoys shall manifest in effect.

Recite the invocation:

> *"Four Dippers complete,*
> *Three Five full,*
> *Traverse ten thousand miles,*
> *Wind and fire shall not cease,*
> *Slay and annihilate malevolent spirits,*
> *Wickedness and evil dare not act.*
> *As it is, so it shall be done—just as the law decrees."*

The **Five Dippers** completion is the envoy of the **□ Star**. Also, store the **Four Dippers** completion, then proceed to the **Five Dippers** completion.

When the envoys are summoned, the practitioner’s **refined light** (*Guāngqì*) ascends to Heaven, assuming the Dipper’s form, its radiance illuminating the four quarters. Malevolent spirits and wickedness retreat a hundred miles, a hundred ailments vanish, and demons and malevolent forces are crushed and extinguished.

The **Five Dippers** also have their own diagram; store and visualize it for completion, and the envoys shall manifest in the Dipper’s form. The true image shines a thousand miles distant, spirits and gods submit in awe.

Recite the invocation:

> *"Five Dippers complete,*
> *The Five Phases arrayed,*
> *The Five Metals rise like autumn clouds,*
> *The Wooden Spirits are extinguished.*
> **Note:** *Spirits* refers to the multitude of malevolent ghosts.
> *The Five Woods flourish in spring, subduing the Earth Star.*
> *The Five Waters flow and disperse, severing the Fire Phase.*
> *The Five Fires blaze fiercely, the Five Metals dare not howl.*
> *The Five Earths are purified and settled,*
> *I and all things are born together.*
> *As it is, so it shall be done—just as the law decrees."*

The **Six Dippers** completion is the envoy of the **□ Star**. Also, store the **Five Dippers** completion, then proceed to the **Six Dippers** completion.

When the envoys are summoned, the practitioner’s refined light illuminates Heaven and Earth, radiating in the eight directions. Malevolent spirits and wickedness hide and vanish, while the body attains communion with spiritual *qi* (*Língqì*), its nature merging with the True Immortals. A hundred ghosts shall fear and respect, a thousand spirits shall guard and protect.

The **Six Dippers** also have their own diagram; store and visualize it for completion, and the envoys shall manifest in effect.

Recite the invocation:

> *"Six Dippers complete,*
> *Three Five move in concert,*
> *Eliminate evil and wickedness,*
> *Purify ten thousand miles.*
> *I summon the Six Dippers and Six Hexagrams,*
> *All united to guard my body and home,*
> *Attaining eternal life.*
> *As it is, so it shall be done—just as the law decrees."*

The **Seven Dippers** completion is the envoy of the **□ Star**. Also, store the **Six Dippers** completion, then proceed to the **Seven Dippers** completion.

When the envoys are summoned, the practitioner encircles the **Seven Stars**, bearing the **Seven Dippers** upon their body, their radiance illuminating the ten directions. The body aligns with the North Dipper, and malevolent spirits are struck with awe. Auspicious omens follow the practitioner, ten thousand miles are purified, and countless guards attend.

There is also its own diagram; thus, the **Seven Dippers** envoys are fully stored. Now, when the seven stars are established, the envoys manifest instantly, responding at the heart and mouth like lightning illuminating the body. Store the Dipper’s completion power, and the spirits shall endure thus forever. When the envoys are stored, the body ascends to the **Upper Pure** (*Shàngqīng*).

Recite the invocation:

> *"Seven Dippers complete the body,*
> *United with the Six Hexagrams,*
> *Drive and command the Three Elements,*
> *Reverse and turn the Five Phases,*
> *Enter the ranks of the immortals,*
> *Walk with the Supreme Unity,*
> *Dominate the Nine Heavens,*
> *Purify the Nine Earths,*
> *May my household all become immortals,*
> *Every dwelling share in eternal life.*
> *As it is, so it shall be done—just as the law decrees."*

**Laozi** says: *"The essence of the Six Hexagrams transforms into the Seven Stars."* The Seven Stars shift and move, overseeing and inspecting all spiritual beings.

**Note:** *Spiritual beings* refers to humans, gods, dragons, beasts, spirits, and ghosts, etc. Those within Heaven and Earth who are born with spiritual vitality and divine communion are called *spiritual beings*.

All spiritual beings fear the North Dipper’s Seven Stars. Thus, those who study the Dao all know of the North Dipper’s Seven Stars and habitually store and contemplate them, donning them like garments. Though garments differ in quality, length, and style, they uniformly cover the body without fail.

If one desires that all spiritual beings fear and respect, and to secure one’s own longevity, then with the **One Dipper** to **Six Dippers** according to merit, the depth and magnitude of their efficacy shall not falter by a single measure.

For those who are beginners, they must diligently cultivate day and night, memorizing this method and storing it in thought. Do not lose the names of the stars, and always keep them firmly in mind.

The Dao does not depart from the heart, nor does the heart need to depart from the Dao.
When the two are inseparable, divine efficacy is established, and immortality is attained.

**The Sixth and Seventh Scrolls of *Jin Suo Liu Zhu* (Golden Lock Flowing Pearl)**

Composed by the Great True Ones of Zhonghua:
Zai Wang Fang Ping, Zhang Daoling, Zhao Sheng, Wang Chang, Si Ming, Li Zhongfu, Mao Ying, Xu Yu Fu, and others of successive generations.
Commentary by the Daoist Immortal Li Chunfeng.

**Explanation of the Upper Section: *Zhuan Shen Cun Yong Tu* (Diagram of Transforming the Body and Storing Its Use)**

All Daoist practitioners who diligently cultivate with earnest devotion—reciting scriptures, chanting the True, offering morning and evening incense, whether three times a day, six times a day, or twice a day—
yet after ten years, twenty years, thirty years, or even their entire life, gain nothing, only to perish from old age or disease.

Some abandon food and dwell in mountains, burning elixirs and refining medicines for years without divine response—what then can they rely upon?
Such disciples perish in great numbers.

If one does not grasp the true path, what foundation can they have?
Those who rely solely on fasting, purity, and abandoning wife and child—whether Daoists or Buddhists—are even more numerous, yet none have prolonged life or extended their years, let alone ascended as dragons and phoenixes to become True Persons.

Now, the Buddhist scriptures say:
*"What one cultivates in this life will be received in the next"*—this is false.
**Note:** The Buddhist scriptures claim, *"What one cultivates in this life will be received in the next,"* but this is incorrect.

Our Great Dao does not even permit such thoughts. If kings and ministers seek to preserve their bodies eternally, why would they abandon the pride and wealth of this life to seek rewards in the next?
These words are utterly baseless and unworthy of trust.

One must seek the gate of the Supreme Dao and grasp its essential practice—realizing it in this life, becoming the Dao’s sovereign and minister. How could this not perfect body and heart?
The Dao is here, in this life. Body and heart must be cultivated together, attaining an indestructible form—how wondrous is this?

This is the explanation of cause and effect.
**Note:** The Buddhist scriptures often speak of cause and effect, yet ignorant people—especially foolish women—are deceived into believing in karmic retribution and induced to make empty offerings. This is wrong.

The enlightened follow the Dao naturally, as heaven nurtures and earth sustains.
Since heaven nurtures and earth sustains, water and fire first form the body, and when the body matures into humanity, it is again water and fire that bring about old age and death.
Thus, the origin of birth and death lies within the Three Realms, all governed by natural law, not by cultivation of seeds.
**Note:** The Buddhist scriptures emphasize the cultivation of seeds, ignoring the teaching of natural law.

Yet true alignment with body and heart lies within the Dao. The seed of the Dao and its blessings reside in body and heart itself.
All internal cultivation is complete—external seeds are irrelevant.
**Note:** True Persons cultivate body and heart, not earthen structures or temples.
True Persons refine body and heart, not metals and stones.
All is governed by the natural teaching of the Dao.

Thus, the Supreme True Ones employ methods and incantations that never leave the body, yet their influence permeates heaven and earth.
**Note:** This rejects the notion of grand diagrams.

Later, the Sage Emperor instructed the young daughter of Xi Wangmu:
*"Though you were young and read little, you will serve others well when grown."*
After several years, she saw someone reading the *Lao Jun Jing* and began learning the characters.
Once she recognized the script, she asked: *"Do you know the names of the gods within the body?"*
Hearing this, she was taught the method of *Zhuan Shen You Si Jie Xin Yin* (Transforming the Body, Silent Contemplation, and Sealing the Heart’s Seal).
**Note:** This is the inner method of the *Liu Zhu* (Flowing Pearl).

Later, with great spiritual power, she taught Xi Wangmu in return.
**Note:** Initially, Xi Wangmu could only prolong life, ride dragons across heaven and earth, and summon them at will—but she could not herself master dragons, cranes, lions, or tigers.
Now, by invoking clouds and dragons in thought, and summoning armies unseen, mother and daughter both attained it, and she is now called the Immortal King.

Again, she passed this down to the Heavenly Master, commanding him to refine his thoughts and combine the method of summoning.
When the method was perfected, he became the central teacher of the Orthodox Dao, a celestial official akin to a great prefect, his status unassailable.
He must meditate once every hundred days.
**Note:** To inspect and suppress malevolent spirits, ghosts, and evil *jing* (precise entities) that harm humanity.

He must store and apply the method once every ten days.
**Note:** *"Apply"* means to contemplate and store the method, observing the world for malevolent *jing*, evil spirits, dragons, and ghosts that might harm humanity—or for poisonous *qi* disrupting humanity and the cosmos.
He must also fear that the sun and moon may dim, stars may cease their courses, winds and rains may fail, and spirits may deceive people.
These are the first concerns.

The second concern is self-cultivation: keeping the Three Souls and Seven Spirits aligned, ensuring *qi* flows correctly, and distinguishing essence and spirit—thus attaining longevity.
Life is as depicted in the diagram: the sun and moon are clear, the stars shine within.
**Note:** Store the Seven Stars so they enter and govern the five viscera, guarding the body’s spirits.

One may also assume the form of the Dao Father as depicted in the diagram—
whether in battle, in the wilderness, or in a grand sealed retreat—
holding one’s breath, stepping in the Twelve Paces of Yu.

the Ghost’s Eye,
the Spirit’s Eye,
the Tiger’s and Wolf’s Eyes,

marking them all in red.

「With both hands clasped before the heart, strike the teeth thirty-six times, then open the eyes and recite the invocation.

Store the self as the **Examiner-Invoker** (考召法师)—

**Note:** The secret formula is on the first joint of the left hand’s index finger,
covering the **Ghost’s Eye** (游鬼目) and the **Five Armies’ Commanding Eye** (都监).

The Dao Father (太上老君) transmitted the **Twelve Manifestations of Yu’s Step** (十二迹禹步) to the Yellow Emperor (黄帝).
**Note:** This was when **Guang Cheng Zi** (广成子) instructed the Emperor.
During the reigns of Yao and Shun, he passed it to **Yu** (禹),
and **Yu** then transmitted it to the people of the world.

The Dao Father said:
*"To seek the Dao of longevity (求长生之道),
one must first align the **Step Framework** (步纲) and trace the **secret formula** (捻诀),
and also master the methods of saving others and subduing ghosts,
controlling divine Dragons, Tigers, and Leopards (神龙虎豹),
as well as averting plagues and epidemics (瘟毒疫疠).
Within the Five Armies (五兵),
one can emerge unscathed alone.
One can also restrain them,
or command them to withdraw from harm.
This method is profound and subtle (微妙),
and cannot be easily heard."*

Those who have seen and heard the **Manifestations of the Dao** attain communion with the divine, and the divine protect them as their guardians.

Those who attain this method must first receive instruction from a **Clear Teacher** (明师). Only after being transmitted the **Scriptures, Laws, and Talismans** (经法箓) may they, after three years or two years, then be granted this method’s **secret formula**. This formula is transmitted orally, strictly following prescribed rites and measures. It cannot be hastily passed in batches of three or five volumes at once. Instead, unrelated matters must be discussed, and the transmission day must be broken into three or two separate sessions of oral instruction.

Following the **precepts of past and future sages**, one cultivates the **Great Dao’s reverence for the Most Exalted Sovereign**. Knowing not to recklessly divulge the teachings, both master and disciple attain true immortality. How could this not be the master’s restraint in transmission and the disciple’s sincere resolve to receive it?

To seek the **Supreme Dao**, one must devote heart and soul, bowing in earnest and sincere petition—never casually requesting a teacher and expecting immediate instruction. In this world, ordinary teachers, yielding to human desires, recklessly transmit and lightly divulge the Dao’s methods.

**Note:** In ancient times, great immortals would transmit the Scriptures, Laws, and Talismans, then require three thousand days of cultivation before passing on the essential **secret formulas**. This was to prevent people from forgetting their cultivation, for life is fleeting. Thus, they would petition for instruction and warnings, testing the disciple through three or five matters. Only if their resolve was unshaken, their aspiration for longevity genuine, and their desire to benefit the world sincere—without leaking the teachings to the unworthy—would they grant oral transmission.

Originally, this method was not recorded in writing, for those who seek the Dao often suffer from forgetfulness, and written records would go unmastered. The **Celestial Tribunals** of the **Three Officials** (三官) and the **Divine Sovereigns of Heaven, Earth, and Water** (天曹上帝道君及后圣君) were informed, lest true immortals and holy masters be disgraced. If the transmission is not passed orally, the disciple will not attain immortality. The blame falls upon the **Three Officials**, who would then harm and kill them. This is not because the unworthy rejected the formula, but because they lacked the path to cultivation, hence failing to become immortals.

Thus, the **Ancient Sage Laozi** commanded the **True Person Light Resonance** (光妙音) to compile and practice the **secret formulas**, integrating them into the Dao’s gate. He then structured **Fifteen Volumes** and transmitted them to **Mu Tianzi** and the **Sages**, opening the path to cultivation. In the prosperous era, when the **Later Sage Sovereign** (后圣君) was known, he ordered **Wang Fangping** to compile **Thirty Volumes**, transmitting them to the **Heavenly Hosts** and **Cavernous Heavens**.

Among those who left the world and received transmission were:
**Zhang Tian Shi**, **Zhang Chongxu**, **Li Yanni**, **Li Shaojun**, **Li Babai**, **Li Jingyou**, **Li Fazhou**, **Li Changxian**, **Li Zhongfu**, the **three Teach brothers**, **Yuan Shaokang**, **True Yuanzi**, **Wei Zhongkuan**, **Zhu Shaoyang**, **Le Yi**, **Dongfang Shuo**, **Yin Xi**, **Xu Jia**, **Xu Cha**, **Xu Hui**, **Shi Jiazi**, **Jie Xiang**, **Li Buji**, and hundreds more—all who practiced this method and became **True Persons**, passing it down in succession. They compiled **Fifteen Volumes of Dao Lectures**.

From the ancient **Pan Gu era** to the present, this method has been compiled and transmitted through successive generations. **The crimes of neglecting this are grave.**

**Note:** In ancient times, **Huáng Lú Zǐ Gé Yuè** resided in **Mount Shàoshì**. This summons the spirits within the body: the **three souls and seven spirits**, the **five viscera and hundred vessels**, the **thousand tendons and myriad subtle essences**, ordering each to its proper station—**Zhèngdìng** and **Wáng**—to circulate **qi** and vitalize **fa**. When the **fa** is activated and prohibitions moved, it harmonizes with the spirits of **Heaven and Earth**, **Yin and Yang**, the **Sun, Moon, and stellar deities**, merging into one. Thus, on **Jiǎzǐ Days** or **Liùjiǎ Days**, in the first year, the **Dao**-spirits command armies. In the second year, they dispel a thousand poisons and subdue ten thousand soldiers. In the third year, the **Xian Dao** is fulfilled.

If you but focus your mind—whether walking, standing, sitting, or lying—constantly preserving the original master, you will naturally attain communion with the **Dao**. Merging with **Heaven and Earth**, you will spontaneously become **True**. Your **běnmìng** (natal destiny) shall be the first to transform. **Note:** *Always meditate on the **běnmìng** as depicted; in one year, you will commune with spirits, and spirits and ghosts will revere you in awe.* After one year, the spirits of **Heaven and Earth** will all respond to your will and speech, granting no wish unfulfilled. Each passing year, your merit grows.

Practice for one year and gain the **Five Spirits**. In two years, the **fa** is complete, and you become a **True Person**. In three or four years, the **Shàngqīng** will draw near, the **Yùnǚ** will descend in response, divine beings will appear, and all spirits will follow. Those who practice this **fa** will inevitably become **True**.

Later, the **Sage Monarch** instructed the **Shàngyuán True Person Lǐ Fāngqī**, saying: *"You wish to accumulate merit and receive divine summons."* **Note:** *The **kǎozhào fa**—healing one person’s illness counts as one merit. Three thousand people healed equal three thousand merits.* *"To attain communion with the **yōu** (mystic depths), you must cultivate stillness and transform the body."* **Note:** *The steps of **bùgāng** require bodily transformation. When the ancients spoke of **zhuǎnshēn**, they referred to the modern **bùgāng**.* *"To become **True**, quicken your steps and hasten your pace. If your **Dao**-practice is earnest and your body fails, yet your mind never ceases, you will still attain it. It is like practicing the **bù** steps—its efficacy is verified by its results."* **Note:** *The ancient **Xianren** all relied on mental cultivation.*

When a person’s practice is profound and enduring, the **Dao** naturally imprints upon the mind. A single thought suffices—no difficulty remains. If you persistently uphold this practice, your descendants will inherit it, and your merit will extend to your six relations.

Each natal element has its own **Knife Supports** to break the **Five Torments, Eight Hardships, Nine Calamities, and Hundred Illnesses** (五苦八难九厄百病). Recite the Framework within the **Three-Five Methods** (三五法) to dissipate them. If misfortunes are not eliminated within a year, they will not prevail, and the practitioner will achieve **longevity**.

The **Five Knife Supports** are detailed in the **Palm Diagram** (掌图).

**Third Method:**
If one’s **residence or courtyard is restless**, select a **Middle Primordial day of the Jiazi cycle** (中元甲子日), recite the Framework while circling the dwelling three times, or take **long strides** (长禹步)—the number of steps is irrelevant; completion of the circuit is paramount.

After three circuits, recite:
*"The **Supreme Male** (乾尊) radiates with spirit,
The **Supreme Female** (坤) harmonizes within.
Thus it is." (云云).*

As recorded in *The Golden Lock and Flowing Pearl* (《金锁流珠》), within the **Upper Alley** (上巷), the dwelling will then stabilize.

**Fourth Method:**
If **family members suffer illness** or the household is restless, select a **Middle Primordial day of Jiawu, Jiaxu, Gengshen, or Renyin** (中元甲午日、甲申、庚申、壬寅日). In the courtyard, recite the **Upper, Middle, and Lower Department Generals’ Frameworks** (上中下三部将军纲), one circuit each, then pinch the **Bright Hall Secret** (明堂诀).
**Note:** The Secret is pinched on the second joint of the left hand’s second finger.

Spit **saliva in the four directions**, storing the **Three Generals**—each commanding **three million soldiers**—to encircle the residence three times. Drive out **fire, water, lion, and serpent soldiers**, banishing **ghostly and demonic qi**, purifying the clear and dispelling the turbid.

Afterward, inscribe a **Residence-Suppressing Talisman** (镇宅符) and affix it to the doors.
**Note:** The Residence-Suppressing Talisman is found in the **Miscellaneous Talismans of the Three Departments** (三部杂符文).

Recite:
*"The talisman subjugates a hundred ghosts,
The evil spirits are vanquished and suppressed.
The **Mysterious Tortoise** (玄武) ceases theft,
The **White Tiger**... (白虎云云)."

**Fifth Method:**
If **besieged by armies** or engaged in battle, mentally perform **fifteen strides of the Central Department’s Great Step** (中部禹步一十五迹), followed by **fifteen strides of the Lower Department** (下部十五迹), then **turn the Celestial Pass** (转天关), pointing as you go, while storing the **Three Departments**.
**Note:** The **Upper, Middle, and Lower Primordials** (上中下三元) command the **Nine Generals** (总都部九将军) to strike and disperse the enemy. The practitioner will then **break through and escape**; pinch the **Knife Support Secret** (刀支诀) immediately.
**Note:** The Secret is on the right side of the second joint of the left hand’s fifth finger. Pinch urgently until blood appears.

Use this to align with the **Five Battles Garment** (五斗衣), pointing five times. Where pointed, the enemy will break. Then lead the troops to charge, and the enemy will collapse and retreat. Release the Knife Support immediately—otherwise, they will die.

Recite:
*"From death to life,
Swiftly ascending to the **Celestial Court** (天庭).
The **Azure Dragon** (青龙) supports my escape,
The **White Tiger** (白虎) guards my path.
I am the **Celestial Envoy** (天使) of the **Celestial Pass** (天关),
Breaking through your five armies.
**Swiftly, swiftly break!** (急急急急急急破).
As the precepts decree." (急急如律令)."

**Notes:**
Raise the flag, charge with horses, strike the drums, and break through—then depart immediately.

**Sixth Method:** When traveling far and passing through mountains or grasslands, fearing bandits, wild beasts, or venomous creatures—whether malevolent humans or poisonous beasts—seize a treeless spot. Walk the **Three Generals’ *Yubu* Steps** (禹步) in the upper, middle, and lower sections, each three times. Then pinch the throat and eyes of a living person, the **Knife Support**, and the eyes of snakes and tigers. Upon completion, ascend to the **Nine Heavens above**—*i.e.*, the **Alone-Empty Void** (孤虚). Should you encounter malevolent or venomous beings, strike the Void alone; even one woman can defeat nine men without fear. You will never again meet such creatures. If encountered, they will flee in terror and never harm you again.

**Incantation:**
*"Lofty and pure, you wicked one—you die, I return.
I press the Three Elements, sealing water and mountain.
Bandits and beasts flee far—no need for paths between.
The earth’s axis binds you without effort.
If you refuse to leave, bind you swiftly, bind you swiftly, bind you swiftly.
As the precepts decree."*

**Note:** Before setting out, practice the **Heavenly Halter Steps** (天纲) at home. While walking, no bandits or beasts will dare approach you—those that do will die.

**Seventh Method:** If a relative or Daoist associate in another prefecture falls ill—or if there is no barrier separating you—*i.e.*, parents, uncles, brothers, cousins, or even non-blood kin like Daoist friends or disciples (but not outsiders without righteous intent)—begin with the **Middle Section**.

**Note:** The **Heavenly Halter** (天纲) is walked in the middle section first, then the Upper and Lower Sections, each three times. The **Celestial Sovereign** then instructs the **Heavenly Master**:
*"You must also tread the **Celestial Pass** (天关) and **Earthly Measure** (地纪), each once—or reverse and return three times. Then summon the **Middle Element’s Tang General** (唐将军), one figure, eighty-one *zhang* tall, with a red headband, a **Heaven-Piercing Crown**, a sword at his side, and a spear in hand, commanding a million troops. He proceeds to the sick person’s home, sets it ablaze to drive away ghosts, thrusts his sword into the door, and roars three to five times. Lions, dragons, and serpents enter the house—above the bed, below the bed, within the walls, before the door, behind the door, left and right—slaying all malevolent, poisonous, or afflicting spirits. Let the sand collapse and tiles shatter; let the deer flee a thousand *li*. Purge and exterminate all evil. When done, the illness will swiftly abate, and the enemy’s forces will be defeated. **Note:** Compose the ritual words and pinch the **Upper Element Secret**. Next, summon the **Middle Element’s Ge General** (葛将军), seventy-two *zhang* tall, with a red headband, a **Heaven-Piercing Crown**, a sword at his side, and a scepter in hand, commanding thirty million troops to the sick person’s home in such-and-such prefecture, county, village, and household. *Note:* Adjust according to the illness—fearing harm from malevolent ghosts or spirits. Burn the house with fire and water, drive away ghostly bandits, thrust the sword into the door, and roar three to five times, as before.

Next, summon the **Middle Element’s Zhou General** (周将军), ninety-six *zhang* tall, with a red headband, a **Heaven-Piercing Crown**, a sword at his side, a scepter, and a talisman, commanding thirty million troops to the specified location. Proceed as before. Then pinch the **Secret**.

**Note:** The **Secret** is on the first joint of the left hand’s thumb. Pinch urgently, and the three generals’ formation will fly to the sky, obscuring the sun. Upon arrival, they will slaughter poisonous and disease-causing ghosts and bandits. Follow the **Three Elements, Three Generals’ Method** as illustrated in *The Golden Lock, Flowing Pearl* (金锁流珠), using visualization.

**Eighth Method:** If you or your six relatives or Daoist associates are slandered, defamed, or plotted against, walk the **Heavenly Halter** and **Earthly Measure** once each. Then disperse your steps outward, leaving fifteen footprints in a wide arc. Walk the **Middle Element’s *Yubu* Steps** three times, then pinch the **Knife Support** of the offending person.

**Note:** Pinch the **Knife Support** briefly—it will not harm the previous target. If pinched for too long, the person will weaken and die within ten or five days. Observe the signs carefully; do not harm others recklessly. Within a month or half, the matter will resolve as before.

**Immediately declare:**
*"Because of a certain matter, I am slandered by a certain person, causing my body to be restless. Now I summon one **Middle Element General**, along with one each from the **Upper Element** and **Lower Element Generals**, and thirty million soldiers. As your servant, I command the **Dark Resolution** to remove the malevolent person’s wicked schemes, their slanderous plots, and suppress them so they dare not act. Urgently make that person hide in shame and suffer misfortune themselves. May all slanderous matters depart from my body and instead harm that person’s life. Swiftly, as the law commands."*

Then recite the *Golden Lock, Flowing Pearl* (**金锁流珠**) **Earthly Measure** spell eighteen times. The spell reads:
*"I receive the **Heavenly Qi**, and I act as the envoy of Heaven and Earth."* (Repeat as above.)

The eighteen spells are all contained within the **Earthly Measure Scripture**; recite each one in turn. Upon completion, pinch the **Slander Seal**.

**Note:** The **Slander Seal** is located on the left hand’s fifth finger, at the third joint’s **wen** (vein), moving upward to the right side. Pinch the **Slander Seal** at the first finger’s second joint and beneath the fingernail.

**Ninth Method:** Always expel the **Three Corpses Worms** from your body, ensuring no reckless daytime mistakes or internal illnesses arise, so you may attain eternal life. Do this by selecting **Middle Element** or **Gengshen** days, walking the **Middle Element General’s *Yubu* Steps** three times, then reciting the eighteen-spell incantation. Upon completion, ingest the **talisman**. (The talisman is found in the *One Hundred Fifty Generals’ Spirit Scripture*.)

**Tenth Method:** Each year, select **Middle Element** or **Jiazi** days, walk the **Middle Element General’s *Yubu* Steps** three times, then ingest **three Soul-Subduing Talismans**. **Note:** One for the **Upper Element**, one for the **Middle Element**, and one for the **Lower Element**. Then recite the **Five Phases Heavenly Halter Flying Steps Spell**—the five phases (metal, wood, water, fire, earth) in sequence, with the seven stars resplendent, for the **Heavenly Halter’s supreme might**. Also recite the **Five Phases Earthly Measure Spell**—the five phases in sequence, metal subduing wood, water extinguishing fire, the **copper-mouthed, iron-tongued** decree. Afterward, observe one day of abstinence.

**Eleventh Method:** Throughout the year, on **Middle Element** days, arrange seven mirrors in a row, spanning eighteen inches wide, to inspect your inner spirit. If one mirror lacks your reflection, it means your spirit is deficient—swallow the **Soul-Settling, Spirit-Subduing Talisman**. Then walk the **Middle Element General’s *Yubu* Steps** three times and recite the **Earthly Measure Blessing to Parents** once. **Note:** *"The five [senses] arise from parents, and I endure the mundane world."* (Two talismans: **Soul-Settling Talisman**, **Spirit-Subduing Talisman**.)

**Twelfth Method:** Select **Middle Element** or **Jiazi** days within the same decan, choosing your own **birthday**, and inscribe three talismans to wear, overcoming the **Nine Calamities and Eight Hardships**, along with the **Upper, Middle, and Lower Element Talismans**. (The **Upper Element Talisman**, **Middle Element Talisman**)

「Inspect whether there are seven **spirits** (*qìpò*). If one lacks the reflection of the **Middle Element Spirit** in a mirror, it is said that the spirit is insufficient—then swallow the **Soul-Settling, Spirit-Subduing Talisman**. Upon completion, walk the **Middle Element General’s *Yubu* Steps** three times and recite the **Earthly Measure Blessing to Parents** once.

**Note:** *"The five [senses] arise from parents, and I endure the mundane world."* (Two talismans: **Soul-Settling Talisman**, **Spirit-Subduing Talisman**.)

**Twelfth Method:** Select **Middle Element** or **Jiazi** days within the same decan, choosing your own **birthday**, and inscribe three talismans to wear, overcoming the **Nine Calamities and Eight Hardships**, along with the **Upper, Middle, and Lower Element Talismans**. (The **Upper Element Talisman**, **Middle Element Talisman**,)

**Thirteenth Method:** For those who constantly guard their bodies and protect their families, after morning practice, retain the three generals of the **Middle, Upper, and Lower Elements** within the heart and kidneys, constantly using them to shield and safeguard—this is called **guarding the body**. To aid others, at the appropriate time, retain [the talismans] for a certain state, county, village, or household, encircling and patrolling the premises of a certain family, driving away malevolent and wicked crowds, and warding over the body of a certain kinsman. This follows the **Thirteen Precepts of the Holy Sovereign to the Heavenly Master**, known as the **constant retention method**.

**Fourteenth Method:** For entering mountains, waters, or fires, or crossing rivers, before leaving home, over two or three days, walk the **Upper, Middle, and Lower Element *Yubu* Steps**, each three times. Then declare: *"The Heavenly One has nurtured me, and the Earthly One has formed me. Certain [name], wearing this talisman, now unites with it. Daoist immortals aid me, and the jade maidens guard my form. The five colors transform—yellow, white, red, black, and blue—twenty-eight constellations merge into the **Purple Court**. The talisman repels disaster, granting blessings and longevity."* **As it is decreed, so it shall be done.** **Note:** Talismans are worn on the left for men and right for women after use.

**Fifteenth Method:** For entering mountains, waters, or fires, or crossing rivers, before embarking, twist the **Mountain King Ghost’s *Ghost Swords*** or the **Beastly Eyes and Thieves’ *Sword Supports***. The Heavenly Master said: *"I follow the teachings of the Primordial Master and the Holy Sovereign. When entering mountains, twist the Mountain King Ghost’s *Ghost Swords* or the Beastly Eyes. When entering seas or rivers, twist the Sea God’s Eyes. Declare: *"Bow-bow, meet-meet, River Lord leads me forward, splitting the **snake-dragon** (*jiāolóng*). All evils perish by the Heavenly Emperor’s decree."* **As it is decreed, so it shall be done.**

(Three talismans: **Entering Water and Fire Talisman**, **Entering Mountains Talisman**, **Nighttime Mountain Entry Talisman**—to be worn.)

Declare: *"The shadow of **Hengshan**, the sunward face of **Taishan**. Spirits and demons do not arise; venomous serpents lie hidden. Tigers and wolves, seeing me, are all struck with terror. There is one surnamed Li, named Ear; fierce tigers, seeing him, break their fangs and snap their teeth; venomous serpents, seeing him, cannot coil."* **As it is decreed, so it shall be done.**

Twist the **Preceptor’s Sword Support** (*Dūjiàn Guānmiào*).

**Fifteenth [Method]:** To desire a single body and one household free from illness.
Constantly, on the proper days of the solar year, tread the **Three Elemental Generals’ Three-Grade Halters** (*Sān Yuán Jiāngjūn Sān Děng Gěng*), beginning with the **Central Elemental General** (*Zhōng Yuán*), then proceeding to the **Upper Elemental General** (*Shàng Yuán*), and finally the **Lower Elemental General** (*Xià Yuán*).

After the incantation, recite the **Heavenly Halter Vow** (*Tiān Gěng Zhòu*) twelve times. Then complete the **Grand Halter** and **Grand Heart** incantations.

The **Grand Heart** (*Dūxīn*) is inscribed beneath the first fingernail of the left hand. Twist them swiftly—these are the **inner incantations of myriad transformations** (*Qiān Biàn Wàn Huà Zhī Nèi Jué*). Swallow one talisman. For a year, one’s body and household—whether one or many—shall remain free from illness. Each person swallows one talisman and thus attains a year without affliction.

On the **First Day of the First Month**, ingest this talisman once.
Declare: *"The **Supreme Venerable Lord** (*Tàishàng Lǎojūn*), the One who begets and receives his ministers.
Swiftly binding and dispatching spirits, banishing them a thousand leagues away.
Those who confront me shall die; those who gaze upon me shall perish.
Swiftly, as the **Supreme Venerable Lord’s Female Green Dao/Way’s Heavenly Decree** (*Nǚ Qīng Xuán Dū Lǜ Lìng*)."*

Then tread the **Central, Upper, and Lower Three Elemental Generals’ Halters** (*Zhōng-Shàng-Xià Sān Yuán Jiāngjūn Gěng*), each three times.
Afterward, recite the **Earth Chronicle Talisman** (*Dì Jì Zhòu*) eighteen times.

**Commentary:**
The *Golden Lock, Flowing Pearl* omits the character **领** (*lǐng*, "command").
The **Five Rigid Dao-Functionaries** (*Wǔ Gāng Shén Gōngcáo*)—one person, surname **Wēn**, given name **Shū**.
*Annotation:* According to *Liú Zhū*, only **"Dao-Functionary"** (*Gōng*) is mentioned, omitting **"person"** (*rén*). Thus, **"surname Wēn, given name Shū"** refers to this single individual alone.
The phrase **"hundred thousand million layers of men in red robes"** (*Bǎi Qiān Wàn Chéng Rén Zhī Chìyī*) should be interpreted as soldiers, not Dao-Functionaries.

According to the **Later Sage Emperor’s** (*Hòu Shèngjūn*) instruction to the **Celestial Master** (*Tiānshī*):
- **Upper Elemental General’s Upper Division** (*Shàng Yuán Shàng Bù*)—one general, **Five Rigid Dao-Functionaries** nine in number, **Administrative Dao-Functionaries** nine thousand.
- **Upper Elemental General’s Central Division** (*Shàng Yuán Zhōng Bù*)—one general, **Five Rigid Dao-Functionaries** seven in number, **Administrative Dao-Functionaries** seven thousand.
- **Upper Elemental General’s Lower Division** (*Shàng Yuán Xià Bù*)—one general, **Five Rigid Dao-Functionaries** five in number, **Administrative Dao-Functionaries** five thousand, with soldiers numbering **hundreds of thousands of layers** (*Bǎi Qiān Wàn Chéng*).

None know their exact multitude.
This is the **Later Sage Emperor’s** revelation—**true numbers**—where the **Five Rigid Dao-Functionaries** of the **Upper Elemental** are fixed at nine.
This applies to **Upper True Ones** (*Shàng Zhēn*), **Middle True Ones** (*Zhōng Zhēn*), **Lower True Ones** (*Xià Zhēn*), and **Upper Immortals** (*Shàng Xiān*).

The **"hundred thousand million layers"** refers to multitudes of **red-robed, red-headbanded** (*Chìyī Chìfù*) soldiers.

The **Grand General** holds in his right hand the **Jade Yang Scepter** (*Yù Yáng Zhī Jié*), and at his waist, the **Dragon Spring Mo-Ye Sword** (*Lóng Yuān Mòyé Zhī Jiàn*).
*Annotation:* According to *The Transmission of the Laozi*, it is the **"Sword that Beheads Evil"** (*Zhǎn Xié Zhī Jiàn*).

The **Great Luo Heaven’s** (*Dà Luò Tiān*) **Upper Inspection Ropes** (*Shàng Yóu Jiǎn*) descend into the **human heart-mind** (*rén xīnzhōng*), entering the **right kidney** (*yòu shèn*).
**Cultivation through contemplation** (*Cúnsī*) emerges from the **right eyebrow’s Heavenly Gate** (*Yántmén Zhōng*).
All methods follow those previously established for the **Upper and Central Division Generals**.

The **Later Sage Emperor** instructs the **Celestial Master** on the **Method of Extracting the Residence and Ascending to Heaven** (*Bá Zhái Shēng Tiān Jué*), stating:
These are the **Three Elemental Generals** (*Sān Yuán Dà Jiāngjūn*)—the **three divisions of the Upper Elemental** (*Shàng Yuán Sān Bù*).
They are also the **Celestial Sovereign’s** (*Tiān Huáng*) **decree**, appointed by the **Former Sage Dao-Lord** (*Xiān Shèng Dà Dàojūn*), to fill the **Upper Immortal General’s** (*Shàng Xiān Jiāngjūn*) position.
*Annotation:* *Liú Zhū* states: These are the **Three Sovereigns** (*Sān Huáng*) of antiquity, not the **Taiyi Era** (*Tàiyì Shídài*).

The **Three Divisions of the Middle Elemental** (*Zhōng Yuán Sān Bù*) were established by the **Later Sage Emperor**.
The **Lower Division Xu General’s** (*Xià Bù Xú Jiāngjūn*) methods of cultivation and practice follow those of the **Upper and Central Divisions**.
Generally, the **Lower Division** governs **earth-water-heart-mind** (*dìshuǐ xīn xíng*) affairs—all must be invoked through **awareness** (*qǐniàn*), which constitutes the method.
Each governs **earth-water spirits, dragons, and ghosts** (*dìshuǐ shénlóng guǐ*).

The **Later Sage Emperor** instructs the **Young Lords of the Four Directions** (*Fāng Zhǔ Tóngjūn*) and the **Great True Ones** (*Dà Zhēn Yán*):

The **Three Divisions of the Upper Elemental General’s** (*Shàng Yuán Sān Bù Jiāngjūn*) **Step Ropes** (*Bù Jiāng*) are used to **rectify and subdue the Three Souls** (*Sān Hún*), while the **North Dipper Step Ropes** (*Běi Dǒu Bù Jiāng*)—
*Annotation:* This is the **Flying Step of Heavenly Ropes** (*Fēibù Tiāngāng*).
—are used to **stabilize the Seven Spirits** (*Qī Pò*).
*Annotation:* Regardless of **Heavenly Steel** (*Tiāngāng*) or **Earthly Ropes** (*Dìjì*) methods, all conform to the **Seven Spirits’** regulation.

Those who study the **Dao of Immortality** (*Xiān Dào*) must first **rectify the Three Souls**, then **subdue the Seven Spirits**, establishing the foundation for the method and entering the **Gate of Immortality**. Upon completion, they ascend.

The **Yu-Step Ropes** (*Yǔ Bù Zhī Jiāng*) govern the **Ten Thousand Spirits** (*Wàn Shén*). When the **Ten Thousand Spirits** are rectified and stabilized, the **Five Viscera** (*Wǔ Zàng*) become firm and unassailable, and the **method is perfected, the body true**.

Thus it is said:
*"The True Person’s conduct—*
*When practicing the Lower Division Step Ropes,*
*All must be cultivated according to the **original name-day** (*Běn Míng Rì*) within the **Lower Elemental Jia-Zi Cycle** (*Xià Yuán Jiǎzǐ Zhōu*).*
*Walk three circuits*—

*—reciting the **Earthly Ropes’** (*Dìjì*) **Eighteen Chapters** (*Shíbā Piān*) and one **Invocation** (*Zhù*), and the **Heavenly Ropes’** (*Tiāngāng*) **Twelve Invocations** (*Shíèr Piān*), completing one circuit.
Upon completion, **twirl the Marshal’s Seal** (*Niǎn Dūjiān Jué*), and shortly thereafter, the practice is finished.

Wearing them on his person, Gāoqīu Zi abstained from meat for one hundred days, then began to travel with them.

One day, as he reached Xiányáng and the sun was setting, he suddenly saw forty-nine men in crimson robes and black caps coming to greet him. Gāoqīu Zi asked why, and they replied: "Because you bear upon your person the true speech, hidden name, true name, surname, and lineage of [a certain] ancestor, we are compelled to serve you. We have come to pay our respects. We feared that the local earth deities and ancestral shrines might be unaware, so we now report this to them in advance, so that they may know the reason."

They then took their leave.*

「Thus, the Later Emperor [常行蹑纪] often practiced the secret steps of the Dao, attaining ascension to the Cloud Celestial [天]. He further spoke of the Western Mountain’s Zhao Rui [赵芮], who for seven generations carried the hidden names of Heaven and Earth [天地之讳] and their sacred names [名], each lineage thus empowered to command ghosts and spirits [驱使鬼神], heal maladies [救人疾病], and accumulate merit [累代着功]. In total, over thirty individuals attained the Dao [得道者计三十余人], achieving longevity [得长生], or the methods of corpse dissolution [尸解之道], or the immortals dwelling in cave palaces [洞府之仙]. Only Zhao Rui’s seventh-generation descendant [赵升] ascended as a Celestial Immortal [天仙], rising in broad daylight [白日] with his entire household [拔宅], all lifted together [俱随身举].

When it came to Sun Rui [孙芮], he was skilled in restraining *qi* [炁禁], but his excessive unlawful slaughter of ghosts and spirits [非法杀害鬼神太多] incurred the wrath of the condemned immortals [被谪仙], who decreed him to serve as a scribe in the Bureau of Examinations [考召书吏]. *注：today’s bureaucratic officials.*

Two thousand years later, he would finally attain the rank of Great Immortal [大仙]. *注：According to the *Nine Provinces Geographical Record* [九州地纪], the Western Mountain was once part of the ancient Jingzhou [古荆州], which is today’s Western Mountain, known as Hongzhou [洪州].*

**Ascension by Household Removal [拔宅] to the Celestial Palace [上升天宫]**
The Most High Venerable Lord [太上老君] declared: *"I received the primordial Dao’s true speech [元始真言] and orthodox teachings [正法], and the Most High Dao Lord [太上道君] vouched for my ascension. Through my mastery of subduing Heavenly Demons [天魔] and Earthly Spirits [地灵], I was able to achieve my body’s transformation and rise in daylight [白日上升]. Only by ascending alone [唯一身而上游] could I pay homage to the Celestial Lords [谒诸天] and worship the Most High Dao Lord [朝拜太上道君]. Afterward, I was permitted to worship the Primordial Heavenly Venerable One [元始天尊], yet I still could not attain ascension by household removal [不得拔宅上升]."*

Now, I have, with unwavering resolve [志心] and focused meditation [精思], compiled the sacred texts and secret keys [秘诀] of various Daoist teachings [众法经文], as well as the hidden scriptures and true speech of the Celestial Lords [诸天隐文真言]. Through this, I have grasped the essence of the Most High’s Golden Talisman [太上金箓之要], extracted from the myriad scriptures [众文中撰出], and achieved ascension by household removal [拔宅], whereby my entire family—men, women, and all—attained the Dao [得道], and even chickens and dogs ascended together [鸡犬一时俱升] to the Cloud Celestial [云天]. From that point onward, I began to manifest ascension by household removal.

*注：Before this, there were no recorded instances of ascension by household removal. Those who prepared and ingested the elixir [将作药成服] would rise to the Cloud Celestial, their entire household lifted, even chickens and dogs attaining the same fate.*

The practice of ascension by household removal [拔宅上升] originated with the Most High Venerable Lord [太上老君]. *注：Before this, there were no recorded instances of ascension by household removal. Those who now attain it [今时得者] are quite common [往往有之], all practicing this method, numbering tens of households [计数十家], already present in the Celestial Courts [见在上天].*

Families such as Li, Wang, Zhang, Xu, Peng, and Han [李王张许彭韩等数家] all ascended by household removal [俱以拔宅]. Li was the Later Sage Lord [后圣君], who in the Western Domain of Zhuqian [竺乾] country transformed the King of Hu into a Buddha [化胡王成佛]. Later, he established the Broad Benevolence Daoist Hall [拔广慈道场], where over a hundred rooms of his residence ascended together [宅院一百余间屋俱升]. Today, it is the Purple Micro Celestial Palace [紫微上宫], the former residence of the Later Sage Lord [后圣君旧宅].

The Later Sage Lord further bestowed upon his servants, chickens, and dogs [更添奴婢鸡犬], granting them ascension as well. *注：This is the Later Sage Lord’s vast compassion and profound mercy [大慈大悲]. His blessings extend to those who have accumulated great merit and achieved profound attainments [恩流赐言功，功大积着多者]. Thus, he permits even their wives, children, disciples, servants, chickens, and dogs [及妻子子弟子奴婢鸡犬] to ascend together [同得俱升].*

The orthodox method of ascension by household removal [拔宅正法] was revealed to the Five Emperors [告五帝]. *注：The Five Emperors [五帝] are the Five Great Celestial Lords of the directions [五方大帝君]. The Former Sage of the Upper Clarity [前圣上清] spoke of offering white jade talismans [素奏丹符], and the Later Sage Lord also revealed the true scriptures to the Five Emperors [真文中五帝亦是].*

If we follow the accounts given by the Former and Later Sage Lords [前后圣人所说], as well as the Celestial Venerable One’s teachings in the scriptures [天尊说经中言五帝], the Five Emperors are the five supreme Celestial Lords [一等五大帝], with no other ranks of Five Emperors [别无五帝位].

Since possessing true names and lineages [有真名姓], in the true scriptures [真文] and the Venerable Lord’s secret talismans [老君秘符], it is said:

*"You wish to ascend your entire household [全家拔宅] and become a Celestial Immortal [上升天仙], attaining the rank of one of the Five Emperors of the directions [为五方帝之位者]. First, you must transform the Five Stars [变五星], manifest the Five Phases [出五行], erect the Five Viscera [竖五藏], transcend the Five Spirits [超五灵], and then you can harness the Five Essences [力摄五精] and command the ten thousand soldiers [驱役万兵]. Your wives and children will become immortals [妻子俱仙], and your servants and livestock will dwell in palaces and courtyards [奴婢宫阙居舍]. Ascending by household removal [拔宅上升] to the Celestial Courts [天庭], you will be titled as one of the Five Emperors of the directions [位号一方之帝], and lead all spirits under the sun, moon, and stars [统领群灵日月星].*
*注：The sun rises and illuminates all directions and the central realm [日出皆照四方中央]. The Five Emperors’ domains [五帝之界] each have their own sun, moon, and stars [皆有日月星], with the three luminaries [三光] shining upon them. All are under the Five Emperors’ directional governance [俱照，皆是五帝随方统领者], and also belong to the Five Emperors by direction [亦随方属於五帝].*

*The Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water [天地水三官], possess both soul and form [有魂魄，有形],*
*注：Those with soul and form [有魂魄，有形] are called *jing* [精].*

*and those with *qi* and without *qi*, with sound and without sound [有炁无炁，有声无声], all belong to the Five Emperors’ domain [皆属五帝之功], manifesting the Dao of nurturing and containing [生成含育之道].*
*This is the method you must practice [是卿所行]—the commandment [行令]."*

The **Dharma Key** [法诀]. The **Laozi** [老君] bestowed this key upon the Five Emperors [五帝], as well as the Three Sovereigns [三皇] and ten thousand **Daoist Immortals** [万仙人],*
*注：The **Laozi** was born before Heaven and Earth [老君先天地生], initially manifesting as the **Dao Master** [始生为道主], and through successive generations, the teachings were transmitted without interruption [代代传教不绝]. The number of those who passed on the teachings before and after him totals ten thousand **Daoist Immortals** [万仙人] and more [已上]. For brevity, we will refer to them collectively as ten thousand.*

—on the method of **ascending the body and extracting the dwelling** [举身拔宅之法], cultivating the **Way of soaring through the heavens** [修行飞蹑].*
*注：The **Way of soaring through the heavens** [飞天纲] and the **Way of treading upon the earth** [蹑地纪].*

In fourteen years, when the **virtue/power** [功] is complete [欲功满], one should begin on the **Spring Day of the Heavenly Stem-Earthly Branch (甲子)** [取春甲子日起], invoking the **Six Ten Kings** [甲子王文卿等六十人], the **Decan Commanders** [旬将], along with the **Twelve Divine Generals** [神将一十二人], the **Sixty Jade Maidens of the Six Heavenly Stems** [六甲玉女六十人], the **Sixty Jade Maidens of the Six Earthly Branches** [六丁玉女六十人], and the **Nine Hundred and More Attendant Officials** [从官九百余人],*
*注：The *Six Heavenly Stems Record* [《六甲录》] lists the exact number of Attendant Officials [从官直符正数], but these three texts differ, so the precise count is omitted here.*

—along with **a million soldiers of the Dao** [兵士一百万人], keeping the invocation both before and behind the body [存呼在身后身在前].

Commence from the **West-North (乾)** [西北乾] above the dwelling, facing **South** [面向南], proceeding with the **Yú Step** [步，作禹步行], circling the dwelling three times [绕宅三匝].*
*注：The three encirclements [三匝] are to be performed during the stillness of night, when no one can see [夜静无人知见].*

Then, **one attains it** [即　得], **but it must not be spoken of** [亦不得言之].

「Furthermore, invoke the **Eight Generals of the Three Primordial Elements and Five Celestial Virtues** [三元五德将军八人], each commanding their troops—*
*注：The **Three Primordial Generals** [三将军] are those of the Mid-Autumn (中元) recorded in the *Tang Ge Zhou’s Three Generals* [唐葛周三将军] text, with each commanding **thirty million soldiers** [兵士各三千万人]. The **Five Celestial Virtues** [五德] refer to the **Generals of the Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Dark Tortoise, and Yellow Court** [青龙、白虎、朱雀、玄武、黄庭大将军等五人], invoked as though holding the *Grand Design* [含弘图].*

**Align the troops of the Three Primordial Elements with their respective generals** [三元随配兵士], as noted previously [具前注]. **Drive them in the four directions.***
*注：The **Five Celestial Virtues Generals** [五德将军] are as follows: the **Azure Dragon General** [青龙将军] of the East, commanding **eighty-one hundred thousand soldiers** [兵士八十一万人]; the **White Tiger General** [白虎将军] of the West, commanding **thirty-six hundred thousand soldiers** [兵士三十六万人]; the **Vermilion Bird General** [朱雀将军] of the South, commanding **sixty-four hundred thousand soldiers** [兵士六十四万人]; the **Dark Tortoise General** [玄武将军] of the North, commanding **twenty-five hundred thousand soldiers** [兵士二十五万人]; and the **Yellow Court General** [黄庭将军] of the Center, commanding **twelve hundred thousand soldiers** [兵士一十二万人]. Each follows their native domain [各随本属], with their officials leading the soldiers [官领兵士] and arriving accordingly.*

**Additionally, summon the Six Generals of the *Golden Lockets and Flowing Pearls*** [《金锁流珠》中六纪将军六人] from the text, each commanding **twelve hundred thousand soldiers** [兵士各一十二万人], and the **Pillar-Heaven Generals** [柱天将军] numbering **one thousand two hundred** [一千二百人]—*
*注：The **Pillar-Heaven Generals** [柱天将军] correspond to the **one thousand two hundred days** [一千二百日] of a sovereign’s reign, directly aligning with the celestial pillar [直柱天上也]. Each general leads **twelve hundred thousand soldiers** [人各兵士一十二万人].*

**Each holds a *Golden Lockets and Flowing Pearls*** [各金锁流珠], their radiance sharp and brilliant, with **three hundred sixty thousand soldiers and steeds** [兵马众三十六万人等], responding to the will and command of the invoker [随心应口]. Thus, they form a **mysterious bond** [玄结] with this humble servant, sealing this dwelling’s boundary—**
**circular and rectangular, measuring [方圆若干亩], ten zhang thick** [厚十丈], and **one hundred chi in height** [百尺], harmonizing with the house and land alike, all rising together [与地俱升].*

**Swiftly, swiftly, as the *Liturgical Commandments* decree** [急急如律令].
**Immediately, recite the *Flick of the Heavenly and Earthly Deities’ Talismans*** [即捻天神地神诀].

**Annotations:**
The *Heavenly Deity Talisman* is located at the third joint of the left hand’s third finger [左手第三指第三节], always bound with five-colored threads. Moreover, on each day of the moon’s waxing phase, it must be anointed with vermilion and ink before twisting.

The *Earthly Deity Talisman* lies beneath both feet. **Note:** Near the heart of the left foot is a mark resembling a fish—this is the *Earthly Deity Talisman*. Always, when approaching the *Step-Binding Rite* [步纲日], three days prior, anoint it with vermilion and ink before performing the rite.

Additionally, one must twist the *Dwelling Deity Talisman* and the *Water Deity-Kua Deity Talisman*, located at the second joint of the left hand’s fourth finger—this governs the entire dwelling. The *Superintendent of the Twelve Monthly Deities* must also be invoked through the *Supreme Deity’s Eye* and the *Descending Palace Talisman*, etc.

Upon completion, command the deities thus:

*"To the five celestial generals of the East—*Jia, Yi, Ying, Mao, Chen*—governed by the Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches, leading eight hundred and ten thousand officers and soldiers, to forbid trespass and uproot this dwelling! The East marks the *Mysterious Dwelling’s* outer boundary, penetrating ten zhang into the earth, blending with the soil to uproot. May the decree ascend—along with the household’s living and dead, male and female, fowl and canine—all ascending to the Celestial Court. Swiftly, swiftly, as the *Liturgical Commandments* decree."*

*"To the five celestial generals of the South—*Bing, Ding, Ji, Wu, Wei*—governed by the Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches, leading six hundred and forty thousand officers and soldiers, to forbid trespass and uproot this dwelling! The South marks the *Mysterious Dwelling’s* outer boundary, penetrating ten zhang into the earth, blending with the soil to uproot. May the decree ascend—along with the household’s great and small, male and female, slaves and maidservants, fowl and canine—all ascending to the Celestial Court. Swiftly, swiftly, as the *Liturgical Commandments* decree."*

*"To the five celestial generals of the West—*Geng, Xin, Shen, You, Xu*—governed by the Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches, leading three hundred and sixty thousand officers and soldiers, to forbid trespass and uproot this dwelling! The West marks the *Mysterious Dwelling’s* outer boundary, penetrating ten zhang into the earth, blending with the soil to uproot. May the decree ascend—along with the household’s great and small, slaves and maidservants, fowl and canine—*
**Note:** *The ancient texts omit the term "slaves," but in *The Inner Transmission of the Later Sage-King*, it explicitly states that during dwelling-uprooting, disciples (male and female) and slaves and maidservants are included. This is the work of the winds, hence the earlier omission in the Eastern invocation.*"

And from the South, beginning and concluding with the Four Directions, Four Cardinal Points, and Four Fixations—this is transmitted only to those who uphold the Dao/Way, not to the common folk. Together, ascend to the Celestial Court. **Swiftly, as the decree commands.**

Again, the Northern Five Deities of *Geng-Xin-Shen-You-Xu* and *Ren-Gui-Hai-Zi-Chou* branches, commanding twenty-five ten-thousand officers and soldiers, to forbid trespass and uproot this dwelling. The North marks the *Mysterious Dwelling’s* outer boundary, penetrating ten *zhang* into the earth, blending with the soil to uproot. May the decree ascend—along with the household’s great and small, wives and concubines, male and female alike.
**Note:** The ancient texts also omit the terms "wives and concubines, male and female," but in *The Later Sage-King’s Transmission to the Heavenly Master on Dwelling-Uprooting*, the decree to officers and soldiers explicitly includes "wives and concubines" and "male and female." Within the Northern invocation, it specifies three wives, four concubines, and one child. All are detailed in the Northern Dwelling-Uprooting Decree. This is transmitted to those who uphold the Dao/Way, for they know that through great merit in cultivation, wives and concubines may ascend together to the Celestial Palaces of the Immortals. Slaves, maidservants, fowl, and canines ascend to the Celestial Court. **Swiftly, as the decree commands.**

Again, the Four Directions—
**Note:** *Yin, Shen, Wei, Hai* are the Four Directional Deities.
Also called the Four Seasonal Deities.
And the Four Cardinal Points—
**Note:** *Zi, Wu, Mao, You* are the names of the Four Cardinal Points.
And the Four Fixations—
**Note:** *Chen, Xiu, Chou, Wei* are the Four Fixations.
Also, it is said: The Four Seasons are the earthly names for the Four Fixations, aligned with the master’s intent. The first Fixation is Southeast, the second Northwest, the third Northeast, the fourth Southwest—hence the name Four Fixations. The scripture states: Where the Fixation is set, great calamity shall arise. Aligned with the earthly branch, thus where Saturn’s influence lingers, great calamity shall befall. The Later Sage-King knew this, so he established the Dwelling-Uprooting Divine Method, naming it the Four Fixations, to repel misfortune and avert disaster. No calamity dares to encroach. The great Dao’s divine power, the rectified Fixation’s force, uproots the dwelling. The combined power of the twelve gods of the third and fourth ranks lifts the dwelling to ascend to the clouds, to the Seven-Treasured Mysterious Platform of the Golden Gate, the Jade Capital’s Upper Palace within the Luohean Great City, upon the vacant sacred land within ten *mu*, where the dwelling may reside. As a minister aiding the Later Sage-King’s Palace, one attains the rank of lesser official, eternal life and longevity, and may serve the Later Sage-King as desired. The decree commands the uprooting of this dwelling—**swiftly, as the decree commands.**

Again, the six *Wu-Ji* Generals and six *Liu-Ji* Generals, each commanding twelve ten-thousand soldiers, with the *Xuanbu* officers forbidding trespass, uprooting the dwelling to ascend. The Heavenly Immortals unite in heart and strength, alongside the twelve gods of the Four Directions, their beasts, soldiers, horses, and all—together forming the dwelling’s boundary, ascending to the Celestial Court within the Golden Gate and Jade Capital. **Swiftly, as the decree commands.** Recite and chant.

Others may dwell in the world, gathering many people, building grand towers and pavilions, expending their **virtue** in earthly labor—thousands or tens of thousands of rooms, towers a hundred feet high—yet they too will decline and die.*

*How many more such as these! Do they not wish to attain the **Way**? Yet their aspirations and efforts only further alienate them from the **Way**, drawing them farther away.*

*All beings rely on the false **qi** of **Yin** and **Yang**, forming their bodies and receiving life. When the gestation is complete, they are born, and their birth is calculated by the **Five Phases** of their destiny.*—*Why so? The year is one, the month is two, the day is three, the hour is four, and counting the month of conception as the mother’s **Phase**, this makes five.*

*After birth, as they grow, it is the **Five Phases** that rule their flourishing.*—*When a person reaches their prime, the **Five Phases** mutually support each other without opposition. But when decline and misfortune come, the calculated **Five Phases** indeed clash, as the **Later Sovereign of the Golden Gate** has spoken.*

*Some may even face the **Five Phases’** utter destruction*—***rest** meaning extreme decline and hardship, **extinction** meaning calamity striking to annihilate them in the pool of life. You must know this early if you seek the **True Dao**.*

*Even if you have a lifespan of three, five, or six hundred years, you are not yet the **True Person**. You must draw near to the **Three Celestial Platforms** and distance yourself from the **Five Phases**.*—*The **Five Phases** of the **Zhou** are the enemies that harm the body, while the **Three Celestial Platforms** are the divine protectors of the soul and spirit. To distance oneself from the **Five Phases** is to practice the **Dao’s** methods of isolation, while to draw near is to preserve the **Three Combinations** of life.*

*By storing the spirit to guard the body and severing the **Five Phases’** harm, you will avoid the peril of death. Even if you slightly align with the **True Person’s Dao**, you may transmit this method, instructing disciples to become **True Persons** of the future.*

*You must tread the **Seven Stars of the Earth’s Measure**—*the **Great Dipper** born from **Yu’s Step**—*and regulate the **Five Phases**.*—*The **Seven Stars of the Earth’s Measure** are the **Great Dipper**, and the **Five Phases** are the **Great Golden Talisman’s** robes, found in the **Upper Scroll of the Flowing Pearl’s** Step Halter.*

*You must ascend the **Three Celestial Platforms**.*—*Though treading the **Seven Stars of the Earth’s Measure** does not require the **Three Celestial Platforms’ Step**, you must perform the **Three Steps of the Three Celestial Platforms**—each step containing three traces, nine traces in total, known as **Yu’s Step**.*—*This is the **Way’s** teaching to **Xuanyu**, hence its name. It is the essence of **Yu’s Step**, with three steps and nine traces.*

*You must enter the **Heavenly Gate**.*—*For those who aspire to the **Way**, first they must align their hearts, sit in stillness within an empty chamber, and tread the **Seven Stars of the Earth’s Measure** seven times. Then, they step down to the **Three Celestial Platforms**, performing **Yu’s Step** nine times—three steps and nine traces—before storing themselves within the **Heavenly Gate**, thus ascending to the **Flying Step of the Heavenly Pass**.*

*Each has their own oil, and each day’s practice is detailed in their respective scriptures. When flying, they must do so three or five times.*—*Three refers to the **Three Primordial Generals**, and five refers to the **Five Phases**. The three must store the **Three Primordial Generals** to emerge, treading the **Seven Stars of the Earth’s Measure** together and capturing the malevolent and destructive forces among the **Three Phases** of heaven, earth, and humanity that seek to harm me.*

*Store them as in the **Flowing Pearl’s Diagram**. Again, as with the **Three Combinations** of **Containment, Expansion, and Unity**, use them to defend and protect the body. Among the five stars, there is the **Star of Calamity**, which constantly plots to harm my life and body. Whenever you tread the **Flying Step** or before sleeping each night, lie on your back and think of the **Five Virtue Generals** in their chariots.*

*The **Eastern Azure Dragon General**, eighty-one zhang in height, commanding eighty-one million soldiers, stands at my left to guard and ward off, bow drawn and arrows ready. The **Western White Tiger General**, thirty-six zhang in height, commanding thirty-six million soldiers, stands at my right, holding a bow and crossbow. The **Southern Vermilion Bird General**, sixty-four zhang in height, commanding sixty-four million soldiers, stands before me, horn blaring in advance, soldiers wielding blades. The **Northern Dark Tortoise General**, twenty-five zhang in height, commanding twenty-five million soldiers, stands behind me, striking drums and bearing gongs, soldiers holding staves to guard my rear. The **Central Yellow Court General**, twelve zhang or seventy-two zhang in height, commanding twelve million or seventy-two million soldiers, stands before or behind me, defending my body.*

*If malevolent stars, evil constellations, or the evil spirits and demons of heaven, earth, and water—along with wicked humans—plot in darkness or strike in light to harm me, the **Five Virtue Generals** and their soldiers, with the **Three Primordial Generals**, will unite in heart and strength, capturing and exterminating them utterly, so that they vanish as if by decree. Their destruction will be swift, like frost meeting the sun—exhausted and dissolved entirely."*

In the left hand’s first finger, at the middle joint, lies the **Upper Celestial Gate**[*].
*Note: The Celestial Gate’s Nine Stars of the Dipper (九星斗), known as the "Flying Step Heavenly Restraint" (飞步天纲) meridian.*

It governs **punishments and calamities**.
*Note: Employ the Three-Five Method—expel the malevolent stars and qi of punishments afflicting my own body, as well as the disasters of the Five Phases’ mutual assaults, and all celestial stars that oppress me. All must be countered by pacing the Nine Steps (禹步) nine times, invoking the talisman of a particular star, and summoning that star from Heaven to rescue my own fate (宿). Prevent it from violating my fate. For instance, if a certain star (e.g., 金) invades like a thief, fear the Fire Star (火星). When the Fire Star assaults the fate where I was born, I implore the Water Star (水星) to save my natal fate.*

The method for summoning the Water Star is as follows: On a **Child Day** at **midnight**, when the star and moon are visible, exit through the northern door of your dwelling, grasp tightly, hold your breath, and gaze upward at the **Vermilion Star** (辰星), bowing three times.

Then recite:
*"I, [Name], aged [X] years, born in the [Month] of [Year], my natal fate [Star] is now tormented and harmed by the Wandering Fire Star (荧惑火星). I now beseech the **Purple Enclosure Celestial Sovereign** (紫微天皇君) and the **Divine of the Northern Pole’s Vermilion Star** (北极辰星之神) to subdue and extinguish it, lest it violate or touch my natal fate (本命之星) or the fate governed by my birth hour (生日所管之宿). May they swiftly rescue and deliver me, driving the Fire Star’s essence to retreat in haste, scattering its malevolent qi, which shall then dissipate. I dare not betray the **Supreme Sage’s** favor.*

*I pray for Your grace to grant me longevity and enduring vision, a secure household, and I dare not betray the **Supreme Sage’s** favor, the **Purple Enclosure Celestial Sovereign’s** grace.*

Then perform the Nine Steps (禹步) once, and three times the **Earthly Restraint** (摄地纪). Adjust the clothing, rotate the **Celestial Gate** (天关), and point to the Wandering Fire Star (荧惑) nine times, invoking the Water Star’s talisman, while preserving the **Nine Abysses Great Sea** (存九泉大海) to sever and extinguish it.

Then pray:
*"The Five Phases push one another; Metal and Wood strike in opposition.
Water and Fire extinguish mutually—copper lips, iron tongues.
Those who resist me shall perish. So it is decreed."*

In the *Liu Zhu* (Flowing Pearl) Upper Scroll, it is recorded:

*"The **Supreme Sage** first instructed the **Purple Enclosure Celestial Sovereign** (紫微天帝), who then inscribed the **Supreme Sage’s** (後聖君) talismans in red—these are the prayers for blessings. The remaining four stars (余四星) mutually restrain one another; their explanations are detailed later.

**Prayers for Blessing and Auspiciousness** (修求福):
*The **Supreme Sage** (後聖君) taught the **Purple Enclosure Celestial Sovereign** (紫微天皇君), saying: "To cultivate the mind (修志心), always maintain thoughts of stillness and reflection (常思静念). Imagine your own divine light (自身神光) transforming into the **Northern Dipper** (北斗) Star, perpetually hovering above your forehead (常悬额上). When retiring at night, reflect on it once before sleeping (夜一度思便卧), and during the day, also preserve the **Northern Dipper** in mind (白日亦存北斗), applying its talismans to your body (為配衣於身上).*

*After three years of such practice, you shall attain communion with the **Divine** (通神), and the heavens and earth will bestow blessings (天地降福). The sun and moon will shine brightly in your honor (日月为之照明), the Five Stars will align to bring you fortune (五星为之修福), and the Six Jia (六甲) will guard you. Some say: Swallow the talisman of the Six Jia (吞六甲符), and the Seven Auspicious Stars (佳七星) will turn the **Celestial Gate** (转关) for you. Whatever you point at (随手所指), it shall grant life to those in childbirth (救人生产立生), and life to those poisoned or dying from evil (救毒恶死立生). All matters shall follow your will (万事随手所指).*

*Do not recklessly transmit these talismans to those unworthy of the **Dao** (非道之子), or you shall surely harm yourself (必反损身也).*

*May your body escape the Three Calamities (令身出三灾).*

The **Three Calamities** are thus defined:

**Celestial Calamities** (天灾) include sudden disasters, decline, misfortune, slanderous diseases, and afflictions from war and thunder.

**Earthly Calamities** (地灾) arise from the *qi* of construction in one’s dwelling—whether from the clash of the Five Phases, structural flaws (such as uneven terrain, improper dimensions, or ill-placed doors), or external influences like neighbors’ constructions disrupting the *qi*. They also stem from marital incompatibility, betrayal by friends, feuds, contagious illnesses, or malevolent *qi* from ghosts and humans clashing in lawsuits or violence.

Such calamities, when trodden upon in the **Astronomic Steps** (蹑纪) and **Celestial Gate** (天门), or when the **Earthly Portal** (地户) is stepped upon, shall all be self-destroyed. If fear remains, perform the **Agricultural Steps** (禹步) and align with the **Polar Axis** (配斗), turning the **Celestial Gate** (转天关) and pointing—each shall be self-annihilated.

The **Five Torments** (五苦) or **Five Evils** (五恶) are thus addressed. If one’s body follows the sequence of **Metal, Water, Wood, Fire, and Earth** to dispel them, stepping in the **Cosmic Ropes** (步纲), trodding the **Astronomic Steps** (蹑纪), turning the **Celestial Gate** (转天关), and pointing to the **Five Stars**—beginning with **Metal**—first encircle the **Agricultural Steps Diagram** (禹步图) thrice, then point to the **Metal Star** five times, reciting the **Metal Star Incantation** (捻金星诀). Next, step upon the **Metal Star**, point to the **Wood Star**, step upon it, point to the **Earth Star**, step upon it, point to the **Water Star**, step upon it, and point to the **Fire Star**, reciting the incantation for each.

Then recite the **Disaster-Dispelling Prayer**:
*"The Five Phases push one another—Metal subdues Wood,
Water extinguishes Fire—thus it is."*

—Excerpted from *The Flowing Pearl* (《流珠》).

Thus, day and night, one becomes a **Celestial Ancestor** (仙祖).
*Note: Ancient scholars of the Dao, like those who study diligently to forget labor and fulfill their ambitions, attain office and wealth. The Daoist path likewise demands such assiduous effort and perseverance to achieve transcendence. These are the words of the Later Sage-King instructing his disciples.*

**Laozi** says:

*Note: For those born under the Wood Star (East, *Jia-Yi*, *Yin-Mao* positions—*Jiao, Heng, Shi, Fang, Xin, Wei*), on a *Wu-Wu* Fire Day at nightfall, when the star is visible, stand in the courtyard or outside the door.
