I now petition the **Southern Pole’s DanTai Supreme Sovereign** (南极丹台太初君) and the **Southern Mars Star Deity** (南上荧惑星神) to subdue and annihilate this calamity, lest it assail my natal star or birth constellation. Swiftly rescue me, causing the **Metal Star’s essence** to retreat in haste and its malevolent *qi* to dissipate. I dare not betray the blessings of the Most Holy. May I be granted longevity, prosperity, and household peace, lest I betray the grace of the Supreme Sovereign DanTai.’*
*Then perform the **Agricultural Steps** once, tread the **Earthly Measures** thrice, align the **Celestial Garment** (配衣), turn the **Celestial Gate**, and point to the **White Tiger Star** nine times, reciting the **Metal Star Incantation** nine times while visualizing the **Nine Furnaces of Fierce Fire** (九炉猛火) to subdue it. Then recite:*
*'The Five Phases push one another—Metal subdues Wood,
Water extinguishes Fire—thus it is.'*

*When the **Water Star** is harmed by the **Earth Star** in one’s natal constellation and birth position—*
*Note: The Water Star (North, *Hai-Zi-Chou*, *Dou-Niu-Nu-Wei*), the two *Seasonal Stars* (季星), appears on a *Xin-Mao* Wood Day at nightfall. Stand on the eastern perimeter of the house, grip firmly, close the *qi*, gaze upward at the **Jupiter Star** (岁星), and bow thrice. Speak thus:*
*'Subject [Name], aged [X], born on the [Month-Day], with natal star [X] and birth constellation [X], now suffers affliction from the **Earth Star’s Suppression** (镇星土灾), whose malevolent influence harms me. I now petition the **Eastern Pole’s QingTai Primeval Sovereign** (东极青台太元君) and the **Eastern Jupiter Star Deity** (东上岁星之神) to subdue and annihilate this calamity, lest it assail my natal star or birth constellation. Swiftly rescue me, causing the **Earth’s essence** to retreat in haste and its malevolent *qi* to dissipate. I dare not betray the Most Holy’s blessings. May I be granted longevity, prosperity, and household peace, lest I betray the grace of the Supreme Sovereign QingTai.’*
*—Note: The original omits ‘Sovereign’ (君).*

Take one step in the **Yú-bù** stance, then stamp the **Dì-jì** three times. Adjust your clothing, then with the **Tiānguān finger**, press the **Earth Star** nine times. Nine times recite the **Earth talisman** while gathering soil from the Nine Ridges, breaking branches from the Nine Forests, and piercing them to block and suppress.

Then pray thus:
*"The Five Phases interact in their cycles—so it is.
The **Fire Star** is harmed by the **Water Star**, assailing my natal constellation and birth host.
*Note: Fire belongs to the South—**Sì, Wǔ, Wèi**—and the stars **Jǐng, Guǐ, Liǔ, Xīng, Zhāng, Yì, Zhěn** are its hosts.
Fire is the host of the Southern mansion.
At the beginning of a **Xīn-chǒu** Earth day, when the star host appears, face the **eastern-northern quadrant** of an empty, quiet space. Grip firmly, seal the *qi*, and gaze upward at the **Earth Star**, bowing three times.
*Note: The Earth Star has no fixed position—simply follow its location in the cardinal direction for the ritual; this is optimal.*

I, subject [Name], aged [X], born on the [Month-Day], with natal star [X] and birth constellation [X], now suffer affliction from the **Chen Star’s Water Calamity** (辰星水灾) assailing me. I now petition the **Central Pole’s Yellow Palace’s Upper Platform’s Supreme True Lord** (中极黄宫上台太真君) and the **Central Earth Star Deity** (中上镇星之神) to subdue and annihilate this obstruction, lest it overflow and assail my natal star or birth constellation. Swiftly rescue me, causing the **Water’s essence** to be sealed, severed, and retreat in haste, its malevolent *qi* to dissipate. I dare not betray the Most Holy’s blessings. May I be granted longevity, prosperity, and household peace, lest I betray the grace of the Supreme Sovereign Upper Platform’s Supreme True Lord."

Take one step in the **Yú-bù** stance, then stamp the **Dì-jì** three times. Adjust your clothing, then with the **Tiānguān finger**, press the **Chen Star** nine times. Nine times recite the **Water talisman**. Gather soil from the **Three Mountains and Nine Ridges** to press and seal it, and sever the **Nine Abysses’ waters**, lest they flow. Then pray thus:
*"The Five Phases interact in their cycles—metal conquers wood, water extinguishes fire.
*Note: An ancient Five Phases incantation.
Water flows, earth is severed.
*Note: From *Taiping Jinque Housheng Xuan Yuan Yuhuang Shangdao Jun*, reissued by Yín-jūn.
For those born under the Fire command, often harmed by the Water Star’s *qi* assaulting the body, within ten or five years, suddenly declining in a month or ten days, occasionally falling ill. Yín-jūn reported to the Jade Emperor, who transmitted this incantation, altering it from the previous version—now it is flawless.
Fire generates earth above, water dies from its own heat.
With a **copper mouth and iron tongue**, those who oppose me shall be slain, those who oppose Heaven shall perish.
Earth and water contend, yet self-destruct in return.
So it is."*

Complete the ritual as before.

「金锁流珠引卷之十二竟 金锁流珠弘卷之十三 中华总真大仙宰王方平张道陵赵升王长司命李仲甫茅盈许玉斧等系代撰述 中华仙人李淳风注 五行六纪所生引中
*Completion of the Golden Lock and Flowing Pearl [incantation] for the Twelve Volumes, expansion of the Golden Lock and Flowing Pearl [incantation] for the Thirteen Volumes. 太上老君告太极真人 徐来勒是也。

曰：五命之中，唯火命帝王则吉，似衰则病。

上仙皆用此法，转令常王盛。

卿可常用庚寅、辛卯木日，可作小坛子，

今志人修求，以黄土布地为坛，佳也。

此是作一时之用。

酒杯一十五，

*which signifies inviting guests and benefactors to collaborate in generating auspicious power (fúlì).*

此谓之戴王入相，盛之无穷。

When the emperor consumes it, his **vital essence** [气] will gradually stabilize, his strength will grow, and he will tirelessly march a hundred *li* daily.

Later, he will **follow the Celestial Pattern and Earthly Divisions** [履蹑天纲地纪], forming the **heart seal** [心印] beneath the nail of the left thumb [左手大指甲下], and storing it with the right hand [右手就之存之].

All such practices should be conducted on the **third, thirteenth, and twenty-third days of the eighth month** [八月三日、十三日、二十三日], seated as per the diagram.

Alternatively, one may stand while holding the **diagram of the Encompassing Whole** [含弘图].
The diagram should be hung with both hands lowered—this is **concealment** [隐].
Simply retain it in mind as the **Encompassing Whole** [含弘], whether standing or seated, as one’s intention dictates.

The **Venerable Lord Lao** [太上老君], the **Empty Celestial Sovereign** [虚皇上帝], instructed **Yuanming Shangzhenren** [元明上真人] to teach the **heart seal’s seated and standing methods** [结心印坐立总行].

The **Yellow Emperor** [黄帝] originally drew the **Encompassing Whole** [弘一] for seated and standing practice, but later generations need only cultivate **one diagram** [一图].

The three sons each had three descendants, hence the **ninefold lineage** [三三九人].

They married within the **Jue Palace** [角宫], and their descendants flourished. Among them arose those of the **Five Phases** [五行], and at their deaths, they all ascended to the heavens **riding clouds and dragons** [乘云驾龙].

The **lineage perpetually transmits the Dao’s teachings**, with the **Cloud-Fire clan** [云火姓]—
*Note: "Clan" here denotes lineage affiliation; Cloud-Fire is the lineage of Fire.*

—**aligned with Fire’s mandate** [与火命].
*Note: Human life is inherently linked to Fire, hence also aligned with Fire’s mandate.*

They **greatly fear Water** [甚畏水].
*Note: Why does Fire fear Water? Because Water extinguishes Fire.*

All other clans are said to **mutually subdue** [相克], but Water and Fire **mutually extinguish** [相灭], hence their profound fear.

They **preserve the *Jiji* Diagram** [存蹑纪图] on the **four seasonal days** [四季日]—
**Chen, Xū, Chǒu, Wèi** [辰戌丑未]—

in accordance with **inversion, reversal, and the three transformations** [顺倒反三等].

Upon completion, they **walk three circuits** [散步三匝].

Then, they **stand before the *Diji* Seven Stars Diagram** [存地纪七星图处前], adopt the **Yǔ Step** [变作禹步], and **point to the Water Star** [指水星]—
*Note: The stars are preserved as well; just as the Five Stars Diagram represents five stars, this is the same.*

—**twisting the Water Talisman** [捻水诀].

Upon completion, they **point to the Earth Star** [次指土星] and **twist the Earth Talisman** [捻土诀].

Then, they **recite the incantation**:

Metal and Wood mutually subdue,
Water and Fire mutually extinguish,
And so forth."*

*Note: This incantation is found in the *Liúzhū* [《流珠》].*

If one performs this **three times within a month** [三度为之],

then practicing it daily throughout the year **ensures a life free from calamity, misfortune, or illness** [一生无灾厄疾患].

The *Liúzhū* and *Fēibù Tiāngāi Jīng* [《飞步天纲经》] state:
*"A year free from calamity—this is precisely it."*

**In truth, those who adhere to this talisman shall never fail to attain immortality** [实但依此言，无有不得仙之者].
If one follows the *Shǒuwén Jīng*’s teachings [手文经说修行] instead, **not one in ten thousand shall succeed** [万无一成].

Thus, this talisman is **recorded for those whose will and resolve are upright and sincere** [志修志信直心之人].
It is to be **passed down only to such individuals** [可一一传付].

The talisman is **transmitted orally** [诀以口传], with each generation **faithfully receiving and reciting it** [继代相付勑祝].

**Only the worthy may pass it on**; for the unworthy, **not even a billion ounces of gold and jade could justify transmission** [非人者万亿金玉不传].

If no worthy disciple arises to transmit it, it is **sealed on the Sacred Mountain** [封於灵山].
If even that fails, **burn the talisman and let the water flow to the Heavenly Treasure** [火烧水流天宝].

**After two years**, one is **free from military strife** [辟兵].
*Note: Practicing for two years allows the Five Phases to manifest, thus warding off the Five Armies of calamity.*

The **Sage Emperor** [后圣君] told the **Celestial Master** [天师]:
*"You may become an Immortal King.
When the Five Phases converge, you shall be able to **strengthen one through all five** [强一].
The **Upper Elemental Lord** [上元主天], who governs the **Heavenly Step Talisman** [飞步天纲],
the **Middle Elemental Lord** [中元主人], who governs the **Yǔ Step** [演禹步],
and the **Lower Elemental Lord** [下元主水地], who governs **Treading the Earth** [蹑地],

are all **aligned with the Northern Dipper** [北斗星], hence the name **Earth-Water** [地水].
Together, they **subdue the Water Regions** [俱镇水乡].

**For those who cultivate immortality with sincere resolve** [志心学仙],
to **abandon the immortality-treading talisman** [去仙履地水] is to **practice the Lower Elemental method** [即今蹑地纪图顺倒反],

which is the **Yǔ Step** [即为禹步], **three steps and nine traces** [三步九迹], known as the **Middle Water Elemental** [谓中水元].

To **master the Heavenly Step Talisman** [履天纲] and **fly with nine traces** [飞行九迹] is called the **Upper Elemental** [谓之上元].

This doctrine of the **three methods** [此说三者] is to **record the Three Souls** [以录三魂] and **restrain the Three Officials** [制止三官].
The Five refers to the **Five Phases** [五行], as explained above.

**After three years**, one attains **divine communication** [通神] and the **path of non-death** [不死之道], whether standing or seated.

**After nine years**, one may **enter Water, enter Fire, enter Stone, enter Wood, enter the Sun and Moon without obstruction** [入水入火，入石入木，入日月，无碍也].

The **Venerable Lord Lao** [太上老君] bestowed the **Fire Phase Talisman** [火行符], which the **Three Celestial Mandate Lords** [三天司命君] wear to **ward off Water’s harm to life** [辟水害命水官].
It is **worn on the head** [戴安头上],
*Note: Some say it should be worn long-term; others say it should be inscribed on the day of one’s birth or the Water Day, ensuring lasting protection from calamities.*

—**to dispel Water’s harm to *qi*** [去水害炁].

The **Fire Phase Talisman** [火行符]—
*Note: The first talisman of the Fire Phase, carried by Fire-Mandate individuals to ward off Water calamities.*

—**the Sage Emperor** [后圣君] said:
*"The talismans of the earlier sages to subdue the Water Mandate Officials were all in written form* [告命水官符，皆是文字].
I now **explain the Fire Phase Talisman** [解火行一符],
*Note: Some say "now reveal."*
and the **four subsequent talismans follow the same principle** [后四符同].
The **Venerable Lord Lao’s talisman** [太上符] is used to **steam the Earth and block Water’s calamities** [火行蒸土，塞水害灾是也]."

The **Wood Phase Talisman** [木行符]—
*Note: The second Fire Phase talisman, worn by Wood-Mandate individuals to ward off Metal’s harm to *qi*.*

The **Metal Phase Talisman** [金行符]—
*Note: The third Fire Phase talisman, worn by Metal-Mandate individuals to ward off Fire’s harm to *qi*.*

The **Water Phase Talisman** [水行符]—
*Note: The fourth Fire Phase talisman, worn by Water-Mandate individuals to ward off Earth’s harm to *qi*.*

The **Earth Phase Talisman** [土行符]—
*Note: The fifth Fire Phase talisman, worn by Earth-Mandate individuals to ward off Wood’s harm to *qi*.*

The **Venerable Lord Lao instructed the Mandate Lord Hàn** [老君告司命韩君]—
*Note: Named "Xìn Xiàngshàng," Hàn Xìn was the Mandate Lord during the Yellow Emperor’s era, not the Han Dynasty’s Hàn Xìn.*

—**Hàn Xìn of old**, who was **faithful to the Celestial** [上古信上], and served as the **Three Celestial Mandate Lords** [三天司命].
In the **Han Dynasty**, he was the **Mandate Lord overseeing the regions of Qi, Chu, Yan, and Qin** [信汉将].
*Note: After the death of later heroes, Hàn Xìn became the Mandate Lord for the Han general.*

*"Within the Five Phases**, two phases favor life and completion** [二行好人生成].
The **Eastern Nine *Qi*** [东方九炁] **govern life’s flourishing** [主好生].
The **Southern Three *Qi*** [南方三炁] **govern completion’s success** [主好成].

Now, the **Great Dao’s teachings** [大道之教] **emphasize life and completion** [以重生成].
The **teachings of the Netherworld** [阴鬼之教] **prioritize repose and decay** [以重休废].
*Note: The Netherworld is also called the Earth Teachings.*

**Repose and decay belong to Yin** [休废属阴].
*Note: Yin is anciently termed the Earth Teachings.*

In the **recent Zhou Dynasty**, the **Western lands produced the Hu deities** [西国出胡神], with the surname **Shì** [姓释], titled **Fó** [号佛], and called the **World-Honored One** [称世尊].
They **prospered the Yin teachings**, instructing people in **dragon ghosts** [教人龙鬼].
Chinese **scholars named this the Yin Teachings** [中国名儒以号阴教].

Those who **master the teachings of dragon ghosts** [通人龙鬼之教] **are skilled at encouraging virtuous conduct and sincere resolve** [甚能劝善行心],
and their talismans **share the same efficacy as the Dao’s** [诀与道同].
Yet, they **do not advocate early transcendence and early birth** [不合令劝人早化早生],
for such views **prioritize repose and decay without merit** [如此之见，以重休废不虚].
Thus, they **do not surpass the Great Dao’s emphasis on life and completion** [即不似重生成之义而为大].

The **teachings of the Yang Deities** [阳神之教] **prioritize life and completion** [以重生成], which belong to **Yang** [生成属阳].
*Note: Yang is anciently termed the Heaven Teachings, with no distinct name.*

In the **era of the Three Sovereigns** [三皇之世], the **multitude of deities had no names** [众尊无名], and their teachings were **equal and strong** [平等之教].
However, the **Yellow Emperor’s time**, the **Emperor valued the Great Strength** [帝重大强], and its name **seemed inconsistent with the Great Dao’s laws** [其名似不合大道之教律],
so it was **renamed the Heavenly Dao** [改名曰天道].

In the **era of Yǔ’s succession** [近禹代之时], the **proper name was restored** [而取正名],
and it became the **Supreme Great Dao** [曰太上大道也].

**Yin is likened to the moon** [阴与月为喻],
*Note: The moon symbolizes thirty days, with fifteen days representing fullness and fifteen days representing gradual waning,*
to signify **that life’s mandate is not long-lasting** [喻命不用久长].

**Yang is likened to the sun** [阳以日为言],
to signify **long life and enduring vision** [言长生久视].
Thus, **Yin and Yang in their seasons** [阴阳二时],
**practice Wood and Fire for life and completion** [行木火好生成].
This is the **first and second principle** [是一二义].

**Practice Metal and Water for repose and decay** [行金水好休废].
This is the **first principle** [是一义].

**Another principle is to follow auspicious and inauspicious patterns** [又一行顺吉凶].

「**Note:** Thus, Earth follows auspiciousness, yet also follows inauspiciousness.
Hence it is said that the Sage-King follows both auspicious and inauspicious patterns—or follows inauspiciousness.

My teaching, though likened to the origin of Yin and Yang,
returns to the **qi of Yin and Yang**,
abandoning the paths of auspiciousness and inauspiciousness,
treading the **Lunar Steps** and **Starry Paths**,
ascending to the **Celestial Immortal Gate**.

Later, the **Sage-Sovereign** instructed **Yinxi the True Person**:
*"The **Supreme Void Emperor** transmitted the **Five-Phase Talisman** to the one of Fire.
Fire belongs to the summer’s heat,
able to nurture and complete all things,
and also to refine through fire, dispelling calamities and dust.
**Note:** Gold and silver refine away the taint of dust to reveal their luster;
fire refines away misfortune and affliction to reveal vitality—
thus, fire’s hundred virtues are recorded, and the **Fire Phase** is inscribed.

What was transmitted was the **Fire Phase**.

The **Supreme Dao-Sovereign** told **Laozi**:
*"What Phase did you command?"*
Laozi replied:
*"I commanded the Phase of Wood."*
The Dao-Sovereign said:
*"I commanded the Phase of Fire."*
We both have emerged from Water and Fire,
and thus have no worries.
**Note:** These two Most High True Ones, with their bodies transcending the Five Phases,
have no term of decay or ruin—hence the saying.

Yet the lower True Ones of the Immortal Way struggle to depart from Water and Fire.
Though their bodies may linger, they do not exceed a thousand years.
Water and Fire cycle endlessly, with decay and suffering ever in attendance—
self-destruction and slaughter are inevitable unless the Dao intervenes.
Thus, the two Most High Teachers discussed Water and Fire.

Later, the **Sage-Sovereign** told the **Celestial Master**:
*"I have heard that the two Most High True Ones of Ultimate Reality discussed Water and Fire—why?"*
Because among the Five Phases,
Water and Fire **clash destructively**,
bringing countless illnesses, afflictions, and failures,
and even shatter Heaven and Earth.
How much more so for the human body,
which lacks an unbreakable form!

Moreover, the **Fire Star** and the **wandering Mars**,
suddenly dispersing into **Yang qi**,
become **Fire’s destructive poison**.
The great wind blows the Water,
and the **Water’s Star of Chen** suddenly disperses into **Yin qi**,
becoming **thunder and rain**—
both move in assault, striking and conquering each other,
thus creating **Heaven’s affliction**.
Suffering this **howling wind and violent storm**,
Heaven is struck by falling stars and shattered rocks,
Earth by snapped trees and crumbling mountains,
and humanity by ruined dwellings and lost lives.
This afflicts the **Three Realms**—
hence the Most High True Ones’ intent in their discourse,
desiring that the lower True Ones of the Immortal Way
receive these words within their hearts.
The heart must not suffer Water and Fire’s calamities and ruin,
nor must the body and mind fail to attain **transcendence**—
to transcend the Five Phases’ paths,
seeking the **Three Pure Ones’ essence**.
The nature of Water and Fire, when natural, is without worry,
unaffected by Water and Fire’s disasters and misfortunes.

Thus, the three Most High Saints of old
used the analogy of Water and Fire
to admonish the lower True Ones of the Immortal Way,
so that they might transcend Water and Fire’s calamities,
enter the **effortless nature**,
and naturally attain True Reality.
Their **Dao-bodies** become firm and pure,
cleansing Heaven and Earth.

As for the body,
refer to the previous notes.»

「This also brings worry to mortals.
*(Also, refer to the previous notes.)*
You are the teacher of humanity and Heaven—
thus, you may transmit the **Water and Fire talismans**,
to guide the lower True Ones into the ranks of the Immortals,
and help them escape the **Water and Fire afflictions**.

**Note:** Those who cultivate the Way with sincere resolve,
all lack the Water and Fire **Dao-nature**,
dwelling in mountains and forests,
devoting their utmost sincerity and resolve,
burning incense and reciting scriptures without cease.
Some refine gold and stones, ingesting their elixirs,
others practice **shell-breaking** and **breath-work** (*xūqì* 服炁).
These ranks of practitioners,
through years of earnest Dao-cultivation,
remain trapped in Water and Fire’s afflictions,
succumbing to decay, aging, and death,
yet gain nothing—at most.

The **Most High Dao Lord** (*Tàishàng Dàojūn*) commands **Laozi**,
who teaches those of steadfast resolve
to escape the Water and Fire afflictions within the body,
and the Water and Fire calamities of the Five Phases,
thus bestowing the **Five Star Talismans** from the *Líu Zhū* (*Flowing Pearl*) scripture,
and issuing this book,
along with the **Later Saints’** talismans passed down by the **Celestial Master** (*Tiānshī*),
the **Three Five** (*Sānwǔ*) *Líu Zhū* scriptures,
and the **Most High Three Five Orthodoxy Talismans** (*Tàishàng Sānwǔ Zhèngyī Fúluò*),
the **Eighty-One Stages**,
to safeguard body and home,
and avert Water and Fire disasters.

**First Water Talisman.**
**Note:** The talisman is within the *Língbǎo Wǔ Fú* (*Soul Treasures Five Talismans*).
The great one declares:
*"This is the talisman of the Northern Emperor,
written in black ink,
to be worn upon the back."*
The Five Phases’ **master talisman**,
which **Laozi** bestowed upon **Yellow Emperor** (*Huángdì*),
is the true original.
**Yǔ**’s version from **Jīngshān** (*荆山*) and his later cultivation
is a lesser copy—
not personally inscribed by **Laozi**.
It is somewhat similar,
yet not as efficacious as the great original.

**Second Fire Talisman.**
**Note:** These two talismans appear together in the *Five Talismans*—
this one is not further detailed here.
**Laozi** instructed **True Lord of the Southern Pole** (*Nánjí Zhēngōng*):
*"How old are you?"*
The True Lord replied:
*"I am one hundred and seventeen years old.
When I must walk, I walk;
when I must run, I run.
My **qi-force** does not wane,
and my hair, once white, will never darken again."*
**Laozi** said:
*"White hair is trivial—
your body has yet to escape Water and Fire’s afflictions."*
The True Lord pondered this for a long time,
then realized its meaning.
He prostrated himself twice,
begging:
*"I humbly implore the Most High’s boundless compassion
to save my withered bones,
granting me the path of eternal life.
Moreover, I have always heeded your teachings,
yet you say my body has not escaped Water and Fire’s calamities—
how then can I attain the rank of the Immortals?
I do not know how to escape Water and Fire’s afflictions.
These Water and Fire afflictions are called **‘years of ruin’** (*huài jié* 坏劫),
and yet, what specific year will they arrive?"*

**Laozi** laughed for a long time,
then spoke:
*"The Water and Fire ruin—
that is your body.
If your body does not escape Water and Fire,
then all will be destroyed and ruined—
thus, it is called **‘ruin of the years’** (*huài jié*).
The heavens and earth have no set time for collapse.
Now, I reveal the **meaning and talismanic key** of Water and Fire.
This scroll contains them.
After nine years of practice,
the Dao will be perfected,
and you shall become the **True Lord of the Southern Pole**—
**Zhèng Rén’ān** (*郑仁安*), whose given name is **Zǐ Zāi** (*郑子崎*).
The *Běnxíng Jīng* (*Scripture of Original Conduct*) states:
*"The **Red Emperor of the South** (*Chìdì* 赤帝) is **Zhèng Rén’ān**."*
Even now, he still wears these two talismans,
along with the *Five Talismans* belt.

**Third Talismans of Metal, Wood, and Earth.**
**Note:** These three talismans
are worn by those of earnest resolve
according to the seasons,
and used in morning rituals.
They are also observed on **natal days**, **Gēngshēn days** (*庚申*), and **Jiǎzǐ days** (*甲子*).
On other days, they are not worn—
these are called the **Five Phases Talismans**.
For those practicing Water and Fire,
these talismans are always worn on the head,
never removed,
and changed every two years.
All are inscribed by the **original teacher**,
each bearing a specific date.
The **Later Saints’** talismans instructed **Yīn Xiānsheng** (*尹先生*):
*"The Five Talismans of the *Soul Treasures* are inscribed on different days.
The **eastern green talisman** (*Qīngfú* 青符) is written on **Spring Begins** (*Lìchūn* 立春),
requested from the original teacher,
and worn on the back of the left elbow.
The **southern red talisman** (*Chìfú* 赤符) is written on **Summer Begins** (*Lìxià* 立夏).
The **western white talisman** (*Báifú* 白符) is written on **Autumn Begins** (*Lìqiū* 立秋).
The **northern black talisman** (*Hēifú* 黑符) is written on **Winter Begins** (*Lìdōng* 立冬).
The **central yellow talisman** (*Huángfú* 黄符) is written on **Winter Solstice** (*Dōngzhì* 冬至).
And on **Pure Brightness Day** (*Qīngmíng* 清明) in spring,
and **Duanwu Day** (*Duānwǔ* 端午) in summer,
each is written on the day corresponding to the seasonal **pure qi** (*zhèngqì* 正气).
If one cannot adhere to the seasonal **rectification of qi** (*zhèngqì* 正气) days,
then on the **fifth of the fifth month** (*Wǔyuè wǔ* 五月五),
**ninth of the ninth month** (*Jiǔyuè jiǔ* 九月九),
or **tenth of the tenth month** (*Shíyuè shí* 十月十).
These three months’ days are also acceptable.
When writing these talismans,
the **original teacher** must inscribe them
in a state of purity,
after fasting and abstaining,
and at **midday** (*shízhōng* 日中),
before bestowing them upon the disciple,
who should then wear them.
The **wood talisman** is worn on the back of the left elbow,
the **fire talisman** on the head,
the **metal talisman** on the back of the right elbow,
the **water talisman** around the waist,
and the **earth talisman** upon the back.
For the **Five Talismans** above,
each must be stored in a **silken pouch** (*jǐnchuāi* 锦袋).
One inscription lasts five years.
If there is no original teacher,
or if the teacher is elderly and unable to inscribe,
then a **worthy disciple** (*bǎojǔ shī* 保举师) should write them.
If none is found,
then a **high-ranking adept** (*fǎluò gāozǔ* 法箓高三五足) from the assembly may inscribe.
When obtaining such a person’s name,
the **Five Phases’ keys** are revealed.
Do not recklessly practice—
let not one who cannot receive **efficacious qi** (*língqì* 灵炁) inscribe them,
nor one who knows not their meaning.
The **Five Stars and Five Emperors** will not submit to such.
Each must be inscribed by the original teacher,
on the days of the **Five Laws and Five Talismans**,
as with the **talismanic scriptures** (*luò* 箓),
and each must be transmitted to disciples who chant and recite,
teaching them the **method of enlightenment** (*míngdù fǎ* 明度法).
If the teacher does not know the **Five Laws** as the **keys to escaping the Five Phases**,
nor the **efficacious texts** (*língwén* 灵文) that avert great and small calamities,
then they should not separately inscribe the talismans along with the transmission.
Instead, from **Spring Begins** onward,
*(as noted previously)*
request a **clear teacher** (*míngshī* 明师) to inscribe them,
and wear them according to the seasons.
If fearing that the Five Phases’ calamities may approach,
then inscribe them on a **auspicious day** (*jí rì* 吉日),
or on **Duanwu Day** (*Wǔyuè wǔ* 五月五) or **Chóngyáng Day** (*Jiǔyuè jiǔ* 九月九)—
these two days are **‘days of extending life and dispelling calamities’** (*xùmìng xiāozāi* 续命消灾),
and thus are acceptable.

**Guāngchéng Jūn** inscribed the Water and Fire talismans
on **Duanwu Day** (*Wǔyuè wǔ* 五月五),
and at midday bestowed them upon **Yellow Emperor** (*Huángdì*).
**Yellow Emperor** then prostrated himself twice and asked:
*"First, you dispelled Water and Fire—
then, how do you escape the Five Phases?"*
**Note:** Though the **true Immortals of the Most High Way** possess
**spiritual mobility and freedom** (*shén tōng zìrán* 神通自在),
their bodies have yet to escape Water and Fire.
Though their hearts have escaped Water and Fire’s afflictions,
their bodies remain trapped within them.

The body and mind both transcend Heaven and Earth, yet Water and Fire remain unvanquished.

When speaking of the calamities of Water and Fire, those whose body and mind both transcend Heaven and Earth—meaning they have escaped Water and Fire, departed the Three Realms—are called **Middle True Great Immortals**. The Three Realms are Metal, Wood, and Earth.

Metal: The vulgar scholars, following the Buddha’s teachings, liken Metal to precious gems, jade, and treasures that do not attract women or music—unaffected by them.

Earth: The vulgar scholars liken Earth to official rank, honor, wealth, and the arrogance of territorial rule—unaffected by them.

Wood: The vulgar scholars interpret Wood as not sitting in pavilions, halls, or lofty structures, with no attachments of the heart—this is called the mind transcending the Three Realms. This, according to Daoist classification, is called the mind transcending, yet the body has not yet transcended.

This practice, when consistently applied,
Will yield great efficacy.

They can also suppress **army disasters** (兵害) and subdue **heavenly demons** (天魔).
*Annotation:* In antiquity, a Daoist in the mountains named **Li Boyao** (李伯药),
Often cultivated the **Six Jia Method** and ingested the talismans.
He stayed in the mountains for five years without emerging.

One day, suddenly, he saw a man in green robes,
Riding a leopard, offering a small bottle.
The man said:
*"This is the **Great Elixir Master Boyao** (大丹伯药).
You have nearly attained the Dao,
But your form and spirit are withering.
You must ingest this elixir,
And you will achieve long life.
I have come today to bestow this medicine upon you—
This is the **True Great Reversion Elixir** (真大还丹).
Here is a golden bottle.
Look, the bottle contains the **True Golden Elixir** (真金丹),
With pills of a **purple-gold hue** (紫金色).
I tell you, my disciples:
I have now attained the Dao.
The **Daoist Messengers** (仙使) have brought me the **Great Elixir** (太丹).
I will take it and ascend to the heavens.
You must follow my practice,
And never waver in your resolve—
You will surely also obtain this elixir.
On the day of my departure,
Come to the heavens to seek me out."

Li Boyao’s disciple, **Wei Xiang** (韦祥), did not yet understand,
And only heard voices in the forest,
As if from hundreds of people,
Including the sounds of women.

In a short while, one voice issued orders:
*"Seize him!"*
Immediately, over ten men in red robes,
Clad as **leopard-riding messengers** (乘豹使者),
Captured and threw the man to the ground.
He transformed into an **Old Dragon** (老龙),
And the leopard into an **Old Tiger** (老虎).
They struck him with twenty blows.

With a stern command, they declared:
*"Li Boyao has attained the Dao,
Though he has not yet gained renown—
He has long been inscribed in the **Daoist Register** (仙籍).
How dare he act as a **malevolent ghost** (为祟),
Seeking to harm with poisonous elixir!"*

Li Boyao knew this was not a true person,
And questioned them about their origins.
The **Jade Girl of Jia-Shen** (甲申玉女) responded:
*"The **Heavenly Demon Poison Ghosts** (天魔毒鬼),
Transformed into an Old Dragon and Old Tiger,
To harm you.
If you do not diligently cultivate the Six Jia,
You will surely fall to their poison and die."*

In a short while, the **Dragon and Tiger Poison Ghosts** (龙虎毒) all dissolved into ghosts and perished.
Were it not for the **Six Jia Deities’ power** (六甲神之功),
Li Boyao would not have been saved,
And would have been poisoned by the **Heavenly Demon’s elixir** (天魔进药) and died.

Now, this account is recorded for the world.
People should not presume to refuse or neglect them—
The **Heavenly Demon** will take back the elixir,
And depart in submission after bowing.
They will no longer dare to harm others,
And such instances often occur.
This allows one to earn merit and attain the Dao.»

「You, among the various teachings, have shown true earnestness.
Thus, you must first diligently cultivate the **Three Elements** (三元) and **Six Jia** (六甲),
And over time, you will naturally attain communion with the gods.
This method is subtle and profound,
And should not be carelessly transmitted to those unworthy.

**Laozi** (老君) said:
*"This method possesses six divine powers (六通神力).
First, it grants passage into the **Great Dao’s Gate** (大道之门),
Skillfully leveraging the **Dao’s authority** (假道威),
Subduing gods and enslaving ghosts,
Quelling and annihilating malevolent spirits and **Jiao-demons** (精妖),
Severing and dispelling **Feng-spirits** (凶祟).

Second, it allows communion with the **Heavenly Realm** (通天),
Inspiring the **Heavenly Gods** (天神) and **Heavenly Dragons** (天龙)
To exterminate demons and subdue **Heavenly Conflicts** (祆).
It can gather clouds and summon rains,
Countering the **obstructive and malevolent qi of rebellious spirits** (逆横祆恶之炁),
And effectively dispel such calamities.

Third, it grants communion with the **Earthly Realm** (通地),
Inspiring the **Earthly Gods** (地神) and **Earthly Dragons** (地龙),
As well as the **Wind and Cloud Lords** (风云雷公),
**Lightning, Rain, and Wind Officials** (电师雨师风师),
The **Five Sacred Mountains** (五岳) and **Four Celestial Constraints** (四镇).
*Note: The Four Celestial Constraints are also called the Four Rivers (四渎), the official waters that constrain the mountains.*
The **Nine Regions and Ten Thousand States, Myriad Countries** (九州千邦万国),
And all **terrestrial deities** (土地山川神灵),
**Ancestral shrines and city gods** (社庙城隍),
*Note: City God (城隍神) is a deity appointed by the later Sage Emperor (后圣君) to oversee the Underworld (地府).*
As recorded in the **Sū Brū** (苏吴纪纪云): *"King Fú of Wú"* (吴王苪是).
The **Left Ancestral and Right Harvest Deities** (左社右稷神官).
They will assist the realm,
Protect your person and family,
And aid all living beings.

Fourth, it grants communion with the **Watery Realm** (通水),
Inspiring the **Water Gods** (水神) and **Water Dragons** (水龙),
As well as the **Water Officials** (水中君官),
**Generals and Spirit Ministers** (将军灵吏),
And all **fish, scales, and beasts** (鱼鳞兽等).
They will assist the **Dao** and protect your person,
Help your family and realm,
And aid all living beings.

Fifth, it grants communion to **guard and shield** (通感卫) the person.
If one persistently cultivates and practices it,
One’s body and family will transcend the **Five Phases** (五行),
And achieve eternal harmony.
It removes the **Five Sufferings** (五苦),
**Eight Hardships** (八难),
And **Nine Calamities** (九厄),
And all diseases will naturally vanish.
One will rise above the **Three Realms** (三界),
Attain **Long Life** (长生),
And command the **Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water** (天地水三官神灵),
With distinct and clear results.

Sixth, it grants communion to **command the Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper** (七星北斗君),
**Divine Consorts and Ladies** (神妃后女),
*Note: Within the Northern Dipper (北斗), there is one Principal Lady (正后),
Three Consorts (三妃),
Two Ladies-in-Waiting (二夫人),
And two Delicate Damsels (并二娇女),
All holding titles as the Seven Officials of the Northern Dipper (北斗之七君位号).*
And others, to oversee the **register of human deaths** (主世人之死簿).
When people learn of this,
They often take **Six Jia Days** (六甲日) to create diagrams,
First following the **Earthly Measure** (地纪),
Then the **Heavenly Measure** (天纲),
And finally the **Yǔ Steps** (禹步).
*Note: The Three Measures (三等) correspond to the Three Elements (三元数).*
Common folk follow the **Heavenly Measure** (步纲),
Using the **Earthly Measure** (地纪) as the **Upper Element** (上元).
Immortals follow the **Heavenly Measure** (步纲),
Using the **Heavenly Measure** (天纲) as the **Upper Element** (上元).
As **Yǐn Shòu** (尹寿子) said:
*"For common folk, whose bodies have not yet transcended the Three Realms (三界),
They follow the Earthly Measure (地纪) first,
Thus making it the Upper Element (上元).
For Immortals, whose bodies have transcended the Three Realms of Water, Fire, and Earth (水火三界),
They follow the Heavenly Measure (天纲) first,
Thus making it the Upper Element (上元).
Moreover, the practice of the Heavenly Measure (步纲法),
Must be completed in three full sets of steps,
Called the Heavenly Measure Steps (步纲数).
This is referred to as the **Heavenly, Earthly, and Human** (天地人),
Which corresponds to the method of transcending the Three Realms and Three Calamities (三界三灾),
And entering the path of **Divine Immortality** (神仙),
The **Dao of Long Life and Non-Death** (长生不死之道).
There is a secret formula within the *Líu Zhū Shàng Yǐn* (流珠上引).
*Note: The formula is found in the first volume of the *Líu Zhū Shàng Yǐn* (流珠上引).*
All who learn the **Dao** (学道者),
Should understand this principle,
And thus know the **Six Jia’s Six Powers** (六甲六通),
To transcend the Three Realms of Water and Fire (离水火三界之法),
And avoid the calamities of the **Seven Mansions** (去七宿之灾害).
*Note: The Southern Dipper (南斗) oversees the vital qi (王炁) of all people,
Causing them to attain early birth, longevity, and prosperity (早得生荣长年),
And wishes that people do not die.
The Northern Dipper (北斗) oversees the declining qi (衰炁) of all people,
Causing them to fall ill early and die from severe disease (早得疾病，病极而死).
The later Sage Emperor (后圣君) greatly abhorred this,
Thus he reversed the roles of the Northern and Southern Dippers (前后易身出世),
And revealed the **Divine Talismans and Secret Dao** (告命灵符秘法),
Interpreting the *Jīn Suǒ Líu Zhū* (金锁流珠) as a new name,
Changing the old terminology of *Jīn Luó* (金箓),
Clarifying the method of following the Heavenly and Earthly Measures (明出天纲地纪步蹑之道),
To subdue and control the **six yin deities of the Northern Dipper** (制伏北斗中六阴之神灾害炁),
Eternally attaining the **Dao of Long Life and Divine Immortality** (永出长生仙道),
And avoiding the influence of the Northern Dipper (得离北斗之下).
When common folk encounter this,
They all know to practice and cultivate it.
If they do so with sincerity and achieve results,
The six yin deities of the Northern Dipper—
The **Consorts, Ladies, and Delicate Damsels** (神君妃后娇女等)—
Will fear and submit to their commands,
Using them as **divine garments** (为衣),
And following their hand gestures to open the **Heavenly Gate** (转天关),
Subduing all **Heavenly Demons and Earthly Conflicts** (摄天魔地祆).
This is what the later Sage Emperor (后圣君) taught in his great transmission.
It allows one to attain the Dao (得道),
And ascend to the heavens (上升云天).

**Laozi, the Most High Sage** (太上老君),
Explained the **Secret Talismans of the Six Jia** (六甲秘符文) as follows:
*"I practiced the Six Jia Talismans (服六甲符),
First receiving the **Preceptor’s Instructions** (先师令服授文).
For sixty days (六十日),
I gradually began to understand.
After one hundred and twenty days (一百二十日),
All hundred diseases retreated (百病退).
After two hundred and forty days (二百四十日),
All hundred diseases were eliminated (百病消除)."*」

「Three hundred and sixty days,
The **Celestial Maiden** (玉女) attends and guards the **soul and vital essence** (魂魄),
Often appearing in dreams as if in person.

At one thousand days,
The Celestial Maiden will manifest during the day,
Guarding both the **Divine Essence** (神) and the **Divine Officials** (官).
*Note: There are often signs of spiritual efficacy and verification (灵瑞征验事), which are not limited to this account.*

At two thousand days,
The talisman’s efficacy manifests—
The body enters the realm of the **Immortal Deities** (神仙),
And the Divine Essence appears as a human being,
Often seen in person.

But the spoken words (言) are only for the self;
The body does not often appear.
The **Polarity** (冲) is near to humanity.
*Note: According to this, Laozi does not often appear in human form,
But is seen through the talismans of soldiers, officials, and Celestial Maidens (玉童玉女等).
Fearful that people might doubt his words,
And slander him as a demon (妖), destroying the true Dao,
Hence the transmission through generations.*

Thus, the **Direct Transmission of the Single Mind** (正一心直) is passed down,
Entering the **Way of Non-Action** (无为之道),
Free from confusion and perversity (无惑无邪),
Free from error and loss (无非无失),
Attaining **Oneness** (得一者也).

At three thousand days,
The Six Jia Celestial Maidens (六甲玉女) often appear in person.

After fourteen years,
One ascends to the heavens (上升天),
Entering the **Shaking Light** (摇光),
And bowing to the **Big Dipper** (北斗).
*Note: When a person’s steps align with the Dao (步纲得道),
They must first ascend to the Big Dipper’s realm (北斗),
Then enter the heavenly palaces (天宫).
Hence, the Big Dipper must welcome this person,
And the phrase "entering the Shaking Light, bowing to the Big Dipper" (入摇光，低昂北斗) is used.*

The Big Dipper **lowers once** (北斗一为低),
And the Shaking Light **welcomes below** (摇光之下迎).

Laozi says:
*"If one wishes to tread the **Seven Stars** (步七星),
The Six Jia must first be perfected."*

*Note: For humans, the soul and vital essence (魂魄) all fear the Big Dipper (北斗).
Thus, those who swallow talismans and practice the Six Jia (吞符服六甲)
Can be reborn in humanity,
And the soul and vital essence no longer fear the Big Dipper.
Hence, the Six Jia can bring rebirth in humanity (生於人),
And the soul no longer fears it,
Yet still fears the Big Dipper.
Therefore, the Sage Emperors of each generation (代代圣人)
Intended this as a means to align with the Dao (为纲步之一),
So that the soul and vital essence do not fear it.*

To **subdue the Big Dipper** (伏北斗),
Use them as **divine garments** (为之衣),
And command them as if they were obedient servants (如从仆),
Respecting them like kin (敬之如兄妹).

To tread the **Nine Steps** (步九迹),
The Six Jia must first be **accumulated** (先积).
*Note: "Accumulated" (积) refers to the practice of swallowing talismans and cultivating (服符修行积).
All are functions of the Six Jia.*

The Six Jia have three ranks of **Divine Armies** (三等军),
And also three ranks of **Divine Offices** (三等府院).
*Note: The Divine Offices (府院) resemble the three ranks of armies (三军营),
And there are also three ranks of offices.*

The highest rank is the **Supreme Unity Office of the Upper Element** (上元太一府),
The Six Jia **Divine Army** (六甲军).
*Note: Within the Supreme Ultimate (太极),
This is called the Heavenly Upper (天上),
The Six Jia Divine Army’s encampment and office (六甲军营府).*

With three **Divine Generals** (三官将) overseeing,
The generals and their subordinates—Celestial Maidens and Maidens (玉童玉女)—
Are named as recorded in *Laozi’s Secret Talismans of the Six Jia* (《老君六甲秘符箓》).

The **soldiers** (兵士) number **three million six hundred thousand** (三百六十万人众),
To subdue the **inverted forces of Yin-Yang and the Five Phases** (阴阳五行之逆炁).
Hence, they are stationed in the Supreme Unity Office (上太一之府),
The **Upper Divine Official of the True Middle** (上真中官),
The **Middle Divine Official of the River Source** (中镇河源),
And the **Lower Divine Official of Humanity** (下镇人世),
So that the four seasons follow their commands without error (四时行令不失),
And the Five Phases transform in accordance with their due times (五行变化得时).

The **Supreme Unity Messenger** (太一使者) commands one army,
The **Upper Divine Official of the Heavenly Palace** (上镇天宫),
To subdue demons and protect those who attain the Dao (保举得道之人).

The Supreme Unity Messenger (太一使者)
Each year presents **three offerings** (三奏) to the **Supreme Daoist Sovereign** (太上道君)
And the **Later Sage Emperor** (后圣君).

The **Heavenly Master** (天师) says:
*"The highest rank of Laozi’s Six Jia (上等老君六甲) is one Sovereign (一君),
Assisting and guarding at the **Golden Threshold of the Later Sage Emperor** (太平金阙后圣玉皇上道君殿)
On the left staircase below (左阶下立).*
*Note: Like the worldly sovereign (世天子),
They stand in the proper court assemblies (会立正朝之卿),
With left and right distinctions.*

Each year, they hold **three great assemblies** (三大朝),
Raising the **flags and banners of the Immortal Deities** (仙真旗仗旌节),
Commanding the **Divine Forces of Demons** (魔威神) to restrain the hearts of ghosts (制鬼之心),
So that they submit to the **Daoic威** (道威),
And the **Ten Heavens** (十天) are properly revered by gods, humans, and deities (天地人神),
The **Dragons and Ghosts** (龙鬼) subdue demons (制魔),
And protect those who attain the Dao (保举有道),
Eliminating faults and transgressions (消伏愆过).

Within one year,
There are three assemblies of reverence and offering.
*Note: The first assembly (上元) is on the fifteenth day of the first month (正月十五日).
The second assembly (中元) is on the fifteenth day of the seventh month (七月十五日).
The third assembly (下元) is on the fifteenth day of the tenth month (十月十五日).
In one year, these three days (三日)
Are when the gods of the Ten Heavens, the Five Phases, the Six Jia (十天之内，三元五行六甲等),
And the Immortal Deities’ officers and soldiers (神人真仙官兵将玉童玉女等)
All, one by one, follow the **Heavenly True Immortal Sovereign** (天真大仙),
Assisting and guarding in the assemblies before the **Later Sage Emperor’s Heavenly Palace** (玉皇上道君殿前),
To inspect the Ten Heavens (明检十天),
Driving and dividing left and right (驱分左右),
Marking those with intent (点记有心),
And before them, the true cultivators who have attained the Dao (前言成道之真人),
Their number seen in the present and future,
And afterward, they inspect the living populace (后检生民).

Within the Ten Heavens,
All good and evil deeds and merits are reported to the Jade Emperor (玉皇).
The Jade Emperor then commands the **Three Officials** (三官),
Each to subdue the wicked and evil (制伏凶恶),
To record the fate of life and death (令部生死),
To entrust the inspection of the virtuous and foolish (托受巡内贤愚),
To judge and classify crimes and goodness (分判罪善),
And to maintain fairness and equality (允其平等),
Listing their records in the Ten Heavens (列记十天).

Do not allow the **rebellious hearts** (死心) to submit to the world of life and death (屈於生死世界),
And clearly entrust them to the **Divine Official of Fate** (司命).

The middle rank is the **Six Jia of the Soul’s Flight** (灵飞六甲),
Assisting and guarding at the **Golden Threshold of the Later Sage Emperor** (太平金阙后圣君玉皇上道君殿)
On the right staircase below (右阶下立).
*Note: The same as the left, in terms of timing and month.*

The lower rank is the **Yin-Yang Six Jia** (阴阳六甲),
Assigned to human life according to the **Five Phases’ correspondences** (金木水火土),
To match the **life-giving and life-subduing cycles** (得人之命),
And to correspond with the **auspicious and inauspicious timing** (相生相克之候),
Judging fortune and misfortune (候吉凶) and matching accordingly (而相匹配).
*Note: This refers to the affairs of Yin-Yang correspondence in humanity (世人夫妻水火相刑相克之事).
In practicing the Great Dao (行大道),
One naturally dissolves this cycle of subjugation (自消此相克).*

The latter two ranks of the Six Jia (右些二等六甲),
For those who study in the world (世学之人),
Knowing the methods of these three ranks of the Six Jia (三等六甲之法),
The **Six Functions of Practice and Cultivation** (六功修服步蹑)
Make all matters align with intent (万事应心),
Naturally dissolving the **Yin’s rapidity in Water and Fire** (自消阴速於水火),
And the **Yin’s attainment of longevity** (阴取长生),
Swiftly accomplished through the **Nine Steps** (疾於步蹑).
*Note: Those who speak of the Yin attaining longevity (阴取长生)
Refer to practicing the Six Jia talismans of Laozi (服老君六甲符),
And the Six Jia talismans of the Soul’s Flight (灵飞六甲符),
Accumulating their efficacy (功着更着),
And further practicing the Nine Steps to align with the Dao (步蹑天纲地纪之功着),
Swiftly achieving the **subduing of the Nine Steps** (疾成於步摄).

Thus, the highest and middle ranks of practice and cultivation (上中二等修服之功),
The first rank’s function of matching fate and destiny (一等以命运匹配),
Mutually supporting, generating, and following (相扶相生相顺),
Encourages humans to act virtuously (志人善行),
*Note: The lower rank has its own distinct function,
As mentioned earlier in the passage regarding the Five Phases (下等别自有引，在上巷中言五行).*

And to establish the **Way of Longevity** (立入长生).

The second rank is the **Six Jia of the Soul’s Flight, Supreme Unity Office of the Upper Element** (灵飞六甲上元正一府),
Called the **Six Jia Divine Army of the Soul’s Flight** (灵飞六甲军).

The **encampment and its officers** (右营营中官将),
Are the same as those of the left office (一同左府具),」

「*Note:* The **encampment and its officers**, soldiers, and ranks
Are identical to those of the **Left Office of Laozi’s Six Jia Divine Army** (左老君六甲軍營官品人數是也).
Only the **Ten Pure Ones of the Jade Maiden** (玉女一旬十人直) serve directly under the **sacred ordination** (經箓).
Moreover, within the **Six Jia Inner Talismans of Laozi** (老君內符六甲), one attends per decade (一旬一人), the Jade Maiden’s direct retinue (玉女直也).
Two **Decade Commanders** (旬將二人) oversee them.

The **Jade Maiden of the Six Jia Soul’s Flight** (靈飛六甲玉女)
Is the **Ten Pure Ones** (即十人直),
Yet lacks a **Divine Commander** (神將) to serve under the sacred ordination (當直經箓).

However, those in the world who study the **Dao** (學道之者),
All remain unaware of this **method of the Six Jia Left and Right Armies** (六甲左右軍之法).
Thus, their distance from the **Dao** grows (去道漸遠),
And they do not know by which **gateway** (門) to enter and see the **Way** (道).

This **gateway** (門) has been known by the **ancient sages and later saints** (前聖後聖),
All of whom attained the **Dao** (道) through this very path (皆因此門成道).
Yet the common world knows only the **Ge lineage** (葛氏),
Which alone has preserved this knowledge across generations (繼代總自知之).
For though they practice the **Way of Immortality** (不死之道),
They fail to ascend to heaven (不得升天),
And are confined to the ranks of the **Immortal Officials** (仙官之位).
The **Wind** (風) continually reflects on their cultivation (修行),
Searching for those who earnestly seek the **essential gateways of the Dao** (志要門戶之人),
Yet none have truly found the proper gateways (門戶).

Even if some encounter them,
They often employ the methods too excessively (用之太多),
Or fail to follow their principles (不依其理).
Therefore, I now present the **sacred ordination** (舉箓),
To record the **true nature of the Great Dao** (大道之性),
So as to enlighten future generations (以曉後生).

The **officers, commanders, soldiers** (官將兵士) are also included.
And it is called the **Six Jia Soul’s Flight Right Army for Guarding the Dao** (靈飛六甲衛道右軍).
*Note:* The **Right Army** (右軍) refers to the **Heavenly Soldiers** (天兵).
The **Master** (師) takes **Lord Taiyi** (太一君) as the **Left Heavenly Master** (左天師),
And the **Lord** (君) as the **Right Heavenly Master** (右),
Each recording their deeds of merit and transgression (各舉功過之事).

**Li Chunfeng**, the Daoist Immortal, annotated.
