Mortals all arise from Three and Five,
and receive the sovereign *qi* of the Five Phases.
They also perish from Three and Five,
*Annotation: When one turns inward, they receive the Three Primordials’ *qi*;
when the Five Phases begin to manifest,
they belong to the categories of Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, and Earth.*
As the revolving years and seasonal stems shift,
the body experiences flourishing and decline.
The sovereign *qi* of the Three Primordials brings forth
auspicious stars and celestial guardians for protection.
If the Three *qi* wane,
calamity descends to subdue the self—
Metal and Wood clash,
Water and Fire counter one another—
and disaster strikes the body,
while blessings do not manifest.

To comprehend Three and Five
is the gateway to the *Yujia Step*.
Thus, one enters the Dao of eternal life and non-death.
This method is profound and secret—
it must not be transmitted to the unworthy.
If recklessly transmitted, the master descends from the immortal ranks,
and the disciple faces retribution.

The Three Primordials govern life,
circulating the *qi* of Heaven and Earth.
*Annotation: The Upper Primordial governs celestial phenomena;
the Lower Primordial governs earth and water.*
The enlightened one.
*Annotation: The enlightened one harmonizes Heaven and Earth.*
Humans also embody the Three Primordials.
*Annotation: Moreover, the Three Primordials command nine generals,
mirroring Heaven, originating from Earth, and harmonizing with humanity.
Humans possess nine orifices,
through which the Three Primordials’ *qi* is inhaled and exhaled.*
Humans are formed by the Five Phases

*Subdued* means *dissolution*.
To master the Five Phases—
*Annotation: Mastery refers to the *Jīnsuǒ Liúzhū* (Golden Lock, Flowing Pearl)
First Scroll’s eighteenth spell,
as well as the *Yujia* earthly cycles.*
—is to master the calamities of the Three Primordials,

Next comes the *Liúzhū* (Flowing Pearl)

the Five Phases propel one another.
Seven stars radiant, the Heavenly Halberd’s might supreme.'*
When practiced for a year,
one attains non-death and stands in eternal life.
This is the Highest Sage’s instruction to the Sage-King.*

Five Phases Supplementary Transmission.

chunks.original_text: 天师曰：周将军在后者，为卷之首、何也。 太上老君言：为周将军主人之心，故人一身之中，以心为身神之王。 故令撰周将军，为中元三将军，《流珠》卷之首。 若据《正三元经》，即中元上部唐将军为首，葛将军第二，周将军第三。 今依太上勑，排虽为首，而用之者，须依《三元正经》所用也。 夫用法，欲使中元要法诀者，是老君口诀。 先蹑纪五遍，讫散为禹步，三步九迹。 讫，配衣七斗，思之如法。 毕，便先思左肾中唐将军一人，从左肾中出，初只长一寸，惭长八一丈，领兵三千万众，往某州县乡里某人家有某事，云。 注：此心中或言捉某祟鬼，或凶人。 又捉鬼救病，或有恶神鬼，及县官口舌之人，见谋於我者，种种思之，得一，在人意后用也。 后圣君告张天师曰：本三元之法， 注：上中下三元，以主天地人也。 修道保护身家，用以制凶恶。 注：凶是人，恶是鬼也。 不为己崇，并救他人一切之灾厄，亦得即蹑纪三遍，散为禹步，三遍，即配衣。 讫，咒曰： 吾生於父母，长在俗间，云云。 咒在《地纪经》中前咒。 诀在左手第一指第二节。 老君曰：周将军者，人之心神也。 人若学道通灵，以起心念便行，不必在於步蹑之道，备具之法。 注：备具，足先蹑纪，次即禹步，次即配衣，次即捻诀诵现，是某备具之 法也。 第一修生，即须备具，缘初学之人，虽受法箓，法箓具备， 注：法箓贝备，从正一毕於五法上清也。 步蹑未感神通灵，要须步蹑。 注：步是飞天纲，蹑是地纪也。 取通神感灵。 注：昔刘纲妻樊氏，步纲镊纪一十四年，潜行之，不令夫知，常以候夫不在家，则为之，不论凶吉之日。 且其夫尝为县宰，日有两衙勾当县事时，妻辄为之，往往如此。 七年，忽一旦有神人乘五色云，从者二十四人，玉童玉女各四人，下谓樊夫人曰：汝功就力通，可心念便得也，有何所要。 夫人对曰：要水住而不流，要虎伏乘而不伤。 神人曰：小事。

The Celestial Master said: *"Why is Zhou General placed last in the scrolls?*
The Most High Laozi spoke: *Because Zhou General is the master of the human heart, and thus the heart is the sovereign spirit of the body. Therefore, Zhou General was composed first as the foremost of the Three Mid-Autumn Generals in the *Flowing Pearl* scrolls. However, according to the *Zheng San Yuan Jing*, the Mid-Autumn Upper Division begins with Tang General, followed by Ge General, and then Zhou General. Now, though arranged first by the Most High’s decree, its application must follow the order prescribed in the *San Yuan Zheng Jing*.

The method’s purpose is to impart the Most High’s oral transmission—the essential formula of Mid-Autumn’s core technique. First, tread the *Ji* [纪] five times, then disperse into the *Yu Bu* [禹步], three steps with nine traces. Upon completion, adjust the clothing seven times, meditating as prescribed. Then, first visualize Tang General alone within the left kidney, emerging from there—initially only one inch tall, then expanding to eight *zhang*—commanding thirty million troops to a specific province, county, village, or household to address a matter. *Note: This may involve seizing malevolent spirits, a malefactor, or performing exorcisms to cure illness, or confronting malevolent spirits, officials, or those plotting against you. Visualize accordingly, and one image shall suffice for later use.*

The Later Sage-King instructed Master Zhang: *The Three Elements’ method—note: the Upper, Middle, and Lower Elements govern Heaven, Earth, and Humanity—is for cultivating the Dao, safeguarding one’s family, and subduing malevolence. *Note: ‘Malevolence’ refers to humans; ‘evil’ refers to spirits.* It must not be used for personal aggrandizement but also to rescue others from all calamities. One may then tread the *Ji* three times, disperse into the *Yu Bu*, and adjust the clothing. Upon completion, recite the incantation: ‘I was born of my parents, raised among the vulgar…’ *This incantation appears in the *Di Ji Jing* as the pre-incantation. The formula is on the second joint of the left hand’s first finger.*

Laozi said: *Zhou General is the human heart-spirit. If one practices the Dao to attain spiritual communion, the moment intention arises, action follows—no need for ritualized stepping or complete formalities. *Note: ‘Complete formalities’ means first treading the *Ji*, then the *Yu Bu*, adjusting the clothing, and finally pinching the formula while reciting to manifest. The first stage of cultivation requires these steps, for though beginners may receive scriptures and complete the rites—*note: receiving scriptures and rites is from the *Zhengyi* tradition’s Five Methods of Shangqing*—they must still practice stepping to attain spiritual efficacy. *Note: ‘Stepping’ refers to the Heavenly Halberd; ‘treading’ refers to the Earthly Measure.* Only then does one achieve communion with spirits. *Note: In ancient times, Liu Jiang’s wife, Lady Fan, secretly practiced the Heavenly Halberd and Earthly Measure for fourteen years without her husband’s knowledge. She would act only when he was absent, even during his official duties as county magistrate. One day, a divine being descended on five-colored clouds, accompanied by twenty-four attendants—four celestial boys and four celestial girls—and spoke to Lady Fan: ‘Your merit is complete, your power attained. Now you may act by thought alone—what do you desire?’ Lady Fan replied: ‘I wish to make water stand still and a riding tiger not harm.’ The divine being said: ‘A small matter.’*"*

chunks.original_text: 乃授夫人止水之法，伏虎之符。 汝行之便验矣。 汝更勤修行，满一十四年，要升则升，要住世则富贵。 后果夫妻俱升，天仙人也。 方则一念，便得感应，天地为之感通。 如未得通神，事须步蹑，具备图诀，思神配衣，咒诵行用。 亦存周将军主在心。 心至则得通，神一起念，心皆自合，愿愿善而无不应，立在须臾。 天师受诀图，有五等用之，三将军皆同一用。 一者自身在外修长生，思存将军，来山林精舍道场中，遣恶人恶鬼，存卫身，令无患害。 二者或身在外，思将军归本住道场，检校辟除人鬼患害。 三者思辟凶恶逆流。 四者存思，与人治疾病急救，遣截鬼祟，应时得平差，立限应心，在於须臾。 五者存念助国助君，收捕凶贼，及善道友被枉谋害。 已上五事，非志道之人，不可妄令知见，莫道妄传，殃及九祖，非独子身。 周将军禹步纲法 经云：不步不使，使之皆步纲也。 如行之年月岁深，自得通神感灵，不必在步纲蹑纪，使心念便是。 天地为之纪纲，神灵为之走使。 昔禹皇妹飞仙娘， 注：一云名。 见兄步纲，因而学之。 一年，小疾除。 注：一云：百病除。 是定本洞中大仙所注言也。 相承本即小疾也。 二年，身轻。 三年，入军辟兵。

The divine being then imparted to Lady Fan the method to **halt water** and the **talisman to subdue tigers**, saying:
*"Practice this, and you shall see results immediately. Continue your diligent cultivation for another fourteen years, and you may ascend to heaven when you will—or remain in the world, rich and noble."* Indeed, later, the couple ascended together as **Celestial Immortals**.

When one’s mind is focused, responses manifest instantly—**heaven and earth resonate in harmony**. If one has not yet attained communion with spirits, the practice must be performed with **ritual stepping and treading**, fully observing the diagrams and incantations, visualizing the spirit attuned to the **sacred robe**, and chanting as one acts. One must also **keep the General Zhou in mind**.

When the heart is fully devoted, communion is achieved. With a single thought, the spirit arises, and the mind aligns effortlessly—**all wishes are fulfilled without delay, in the blink of an eye**.

The **Celestial Master** received the diagrams and methods, which have five applications, all shared by the **Three Generals**:

1. **For personal cultivation outside**: To prolong life, one visualizes the General and retreats to mountain forests, sacred halls, or Daoist ritual grounds, dispatching malevolent humans and ghosts to guard and protect, ensuring no harm befalls one.

2. **When away from the grounds**: One visualizes the General returning to the ritual site to inspect and repel human and ghostly afflictions.

3. **To repel malevolent and rebellious forces**.

4. **For healing and emergency aid**: By focusing one’s intent, one treats illnesses, cuts off ghostly torment, and achieves immediate resolution—**fulfilling the will in an instant**.

5. **To assist the state and sovereign**: Capturing criminals, rescuing righteous Daoist friends wrongfully harmed.

These five methods must **not** be recklessly revealed to those without Daoist resolve. Do not speak of them lightly—**misuse brings calamity upon the Nine Ancestors**, not just oneself.

The **General Zhou’s Stepping Halberd Method** states:
*"Without stepping, none may act; all actions must follow the Stepping Halberd’s order."* With deep practice over years, one naturally attains communion with spirits and divine responsiveness—**no longer bound by ritual stepping and treading**; a single thought suffices. **Heaven and earth align as its framework; spirits move at its command.**

In ancient times, **Yu the Great’s sister, the Flying Immortal**,—*[Note: Some texts name her]*—
witnessed her brother practice the Stepping Halberd and learned it herself. **After one year, her minor ailments vanished.** *[Note: Some texts say all diseases were cured. This is the original text’s definitive account from the Great Immortal of the Cavern.]*
**After two years, her body grew light.**

chunks.original_text: 四年，名入仙籍。 五年，通灵。 六年，道术成。 七年，能隐形。 八年，履水行。 九年，上朝中清，封为女圣仙姑，如仙卿之位也。 皆按此图，为法甚妙。 诀在左手第三指中节，以五色丝缚之。 讫即配衣，存使周将军如图，存使兵吏师子猛火，烧彼凶恶鬼贼之宅。 事事如图思存，使之神验。 存使葛将军法图 天师曰：将军是右部将军，使之为第二，何也。 太上老君言：为其周为前部，属阳，合居阳数，即第一次。 即合阴数，第二，合其双数之义也。 即言唐将军居左，亦属阳数，即第三也。 注：据先师常先思唐将军，次即葛，次即周。 今以周将军为第一，是表心神之大也。 故於巷中为第一，以应上元神将之像，人神将也。 若用即先是唐将军居前。 即松呼有应验之凭也。 又按《三元肘后灵书》 云：唐将军为第一，又属上元。 次即葛将军第二，属阴数，又属中元。 次即周将军第三，又属下元。 此两说不同。 何也。

The **Fourth Year**, she was enrolled in the **Celestial Register of Immortals**.
The **Fifth Year**, she attained **spirit communion**.
The **Sixth Year**, her **Dao/Way arts were perfected**.
The **Seventh Year**, she could **become invisible**.
The **Eighth Year**, she **walked upon water**.

chunks.original_text: 《太上老君秘录枕中记》云：不用法术，即依三元之法。 次唐将军为上，即第一，顺天道数而行。 若修行及用诸法，赏罚善恶，遍行天下，收录鬼神，即周将军，居心属下元，为人，又且是下元之中，即周将军居前为第一，逆行天道，攻伐恶逆，迁赏善道，即可依《流珠》行用，有验之，可凭也。 若依阴阳，《太一太医神仙方》云：左为肾，右为命门。 即可依此言也。 且唐将军为左肾之将军，葛将军为男子命门也。 故以步纲使法，皆存为第二之将，各领三千万兵，以防护命门，后从西方而径卫臣则玄身。 讫，即从右发阵行法领兵，如图。 讫，即步图兵－纲。 讫，即又存使之，如图捻诀行用，无不验也。 步纲。 注：步葛将军禹步法，右脚为先，以象阴也。 常初起即如此，勿令失错。 此纲不同周、唐等二将军之法也。 后圣君告张天师曰：步纲，书符吞之，后即步纲，有上中下三符。 太上告命文令，先步三元纲，后即配衣存使之。 昔有道士刘根，常行此三元之步，后散为九迹禹步。 如此三年，一切神鬼敬而受使，力能移山河。 一旦被郡主 注：郡主，古之太守官也。 追而欲害，令使我自日见鬼，我即放汝生命，若不令我见鬼，汝即为鬼。 根大嗔，以脚行中作纲步，向郡主厅上，借郡主按打之数下，心存配衣在手，以魒星指郡主本州县乡里住处地界社庙，及冢侯墓伯，先追禁郡主某亡父母。 讫，即以左手捻诀，使三将军往取郡主父母，以绳缚手，送从南门边壁中入，郡主见，下床迎拜。 骂郡主，吾生汝身，为官不解与父母，为福佑於亡人，何忽触犯仙官，令使追捉吾於此，汝火急拜谢仙官，放去。 汝得生命。 如不肯，汝须立死。 郡主再拜谢根，根即云：汝去。 须臾之间，一时与根，俱不见也。 此是三将军禹步之功也。

The **Highest Venerable** (*Tàishàng*) commanded **Mìngwén Lìng**: 'First perform the **Three Primordial Bùgāng** [method], then invoke the talismans and dispatch them accordingly.'

In ancient times, there was a Daoist named **Liu Gen** (*Liú Gēn*), who habitually practiced the **Three Primordial Step** (*sān yuán bù*). Later, it was transformed into the **Nine Progression Step** (*jiǔ jì yǔbù*). After three years of such practice, all spirits and ghosts revered him and obeyed his commands, and his power could move mountains and rivers.

One day, he was pursued by an **Idiom: County Magistrate** (*Jùnzhǔ*—*Note: County Magistrate, an ancient title for a prefectural governor*), who sought to harm him. The magistrate ordered him to appear before a ghost by day, threatening that if he refused, he would become a ghost himself. Gen was enraged; he performed the **Bùgāng** [method] in the center of the hall, borrowing the magistrate’s official seal as a talismanic token. With the talisman in hand, he invoked the **Arcade Star** (*Yùxīng*) to mark the magistrate’s native county, villages, ancestral temples, and the graves of his deceased parents and grandparents. He first summoned and bound the magistrate’s departed father and mother, sending them through the southern gate to be hung on the wall. The magistrate saw them, descended from his bed, and knelt in welcome.

Gen cursed the magistrate: 'I was born from your body, yet you, as an official, do not honor your parents. The magistrate repeatedly knelt and apologized to Gen, who then said: 'Go.' In a moment, both the magistrate and Gen vanished. This is the efficacy of the **Three Primordial Step** (*sān yuán bù*) of the generals."

chunks.original_text: 此法非但存唐将军，葛、周总存之共击。 此说只论前后存出击伐，非独一军出，三军总出。 讫，更出五德将军佐助，击伐天魔。 事非轻小，切须在心正直，行大道无有阙失，皆得随口顺心。 夫步纲，使大道吏兵三将军为先。 如大阵战敌贼鬼，皆须出九将军，非独中元三将军也。 上元、下元，皆须出佐助之，如含弘图。 大约是中元三将军为前，使前出击伐，自是一部雄猛，偏能救急难之事，偏能理鬼神妄作妖怪，治人五藏，伐恶举善，无偏无党，宜猛行道之神将也。 后圣君更再除《金锁流珠》、繁重之处，撰为一十五卷，兼添修正引三十卷，引人入神仙流珠之门，令后学之人稍易得道。 给授张道陵，显说用流珠中之事，亦於后学法箓中为宝，非人不可妄传，老君授王君步中元上部纲法，并迹为丁纲步斗，并散为禹步之法。 或为正纲，或为丁步之法。 《金锁流珠正经》云二使五五步纲，皆先存使唐将军一人为首，领兵三千万众，左手把金符，右手弩力震筋，捉凶恶鬼贼之势甚雄，大猛之状，吏兵斫凶恶鬼之宅。 回面看中元、下元将军等号令，令齐心一意，急急齐到某凶恶鬼贼之宅，各吐自然天火，烧凶恶鬼贼之宅。 亦有自然狮子，吃凶恶鬼贼魂神，令不敢为祟害，害於人物及我等身。 又呼召唐将军，下自有三千万吏兵速速到，并与二将同心，并力交阵，左右围远鬼贼营域庙舍。 次副唐将军者、葛将军一人，身长七十二丈，右手把戟，左手弩拳，筋力震转，雄烈壮猛，力势崩山，到来。 同唐将军一心，共并凶恶鬼贼屋宅及身，亦吐自然天火，狮子他弋大蛇，铁‘色班文吏兵等，凶烈毒猛，把刀剑，同入凶恶鬼贼屋宅之中，一一诛斩，勿令脱漏一鬼一贼，急急。 又狮子毒蛇咬吃鬼贼，急急。 次副前后将军周将军，主人心神。 故《金锁流珠》录之，为首一者，主心之弘道，使神也， 注：此是老君官告玄洲二十四大真人，修行步蹑天纲地纪之法，一一皆得真仙，从心使使将军吏兵之功，功而着积，积满三千，深累成道，皆心主之，故主於一也。 诛鬼也。 今据后圣授张天师、王君小童君等言，即是周将军为前部。 或为后部，不合专使为第一。 若修行求道长生，即合唐将军居前为第一。 若欲求救疾病，收捕凶恶，即以周将军前居为第一，亦可得矣。 若能通大道，即用唐将军为第一。 周将军左手把节，右手震筋弩力，走来捉凶恶鬼贼，驱之，即在后来。 即可足明，是副唐将军之行阵，可为第三。 今所解，且依经引解指注用，即依修行正典，取为第三。 但任流珠书为第一，自心使，依次使用也。 注：此是赵氏所添益言，非老君正金口所说用。 老君告王君曰：夫三元管四时， 注：春夏秋冬是四时，神入太一雷公六壬等式法用。 四时 注：天公之神。 管五行，五行管六甲，六甲管七星，七星管八方， 注：天上八方，地下八卦，乾坤兑巽艮震高坎，是并中官，即呼九宫之位。 八方管九宫，九官生十直， 即今十干。 十直生十二支，皆起大道自然之炁，呼之相应，使之相助。 能一心志精，至妙知之，得三元五行所卫，修求久而不休，获得长生久视之道。 吾昔授此道於神农，神农但只解寻究三元，而不知有六甲，有百余岁，而无衰老之容，后得尸解之道。

This method is not merely for deploying the General of Tang alone, nor for the joint assault of Generals Ge and Zhou. This teaching only discusses the sequential deployment of troops for striking and assaulting—it is not limited to a single army but encompasses all three armies.

The **Step of the Halter** commands the Three Generals of Dao Officials and Soldiers to lead first. When facing a great battle against enemy spirits and demons, all nine generals must be deployed—not just the three of Zhongyuan. Both Shangyuan and Xiayuan must also send their aides, as in *Han Hongtu*.

Generally, the three Zhongyuan Generals lead the charge, striking and assaulting first. This is a formidable force, capable of rescuing urgent crises, suppressing false deities and spirits causing havoc, regulating the Five Viscera, and eliminating evil while promoting goodness—without favor or bias. They are the fierce and righteous divine generals of the Dao.

Later sages further refined *The Golden Lock and Flowing Pearl*, removing cumbersome passages and compiling it into fifteen volumes, along with thirty additional volumes of corrected prefaces, guiding disciples into the Daoist path of the Flowing Pearl and making the way easier for later seekers.

Granted to Zhang Daoling, it clearly explains the use of the Flowing Pearl’s methods, also treasured in later scriptures. It must not be recklessly transmitted by mortals. The Celestial Master instructed King Jun in the Zhongyuan Upper Halter Step, which also includes the **Ding Halter Step** and the **Yǔ Step**—sometimes as the **Proper Halter**, sometimes as the **Ding Step**.

*The Golden Lock and Flowing Pearl Canon* states that the two aides take fifty-five steps in the Halter, always deploying the General of Tang first, commanding three hundred million soldiers. With the left hand holding the golden talisman and the right hand wielding the bow’s sinew-shaking force, he seizes the fierce and malevolent demons and bandits with overwhelming might. The soldiers and officials then demolish the lairs of the malevolent ghosts and demons.

Turning to face the Zhongyuan and Xiayuan Generals, he orders them to unite in purpose, swiftly converging upon the lair of the malevolent demon or bandit. Each exhales natural heavenly fire, burning the lair of the malevolent demon or bandit. There are also natural lions that devour the spirits and souls of the malevolent demons and bandits, preventing them from causing harm to humans or ourselves.

The General of Tang is then summoned, and immediately three hundred million officials and soldiers arrive, aligning their hearts with the two generals. Together, they encircle the distant encampments, temples, and dwellings of the malevolent demons and bandits.

The second-in-command to the General of Tang is General Ge, seventy-two *zhang* in height, wielding a spear in his right hand and a fist-shaking bow in his left. His sinew-shaking force is mighty and fierce, capable of shattering mountains. He arrives united in purpose with the General of Tang, attacking the malevolent demons and bandits in their dwellings and bodies. He also exhales natural heavenly fire, alongside lions, great serpents, and iron-clad soldiers marked with *seban* texts—fierce, poisonous, and savage. Wielding swords, they enter the lairs of the malevolent demons and bandits, exterminating each one without escape.

The lions and poisonous serpents also bite and devour the demons and bandits.

The third-in-command, General Zhou, governs the mind and spirit. Thus, *The Golden Lock and Flowing Pearl* records him as the first in command, mastering the expansive Dao and commanding the spirits. *(Annotation: This is the Celestial Master’s proclamation to the Twenty-Four Great True Persons of Xuanzhou, instructing them in the practice of stepping along the celestial and terrestrial Halter, each attaining true immortality. Through the heart’s command of the generals and soldiers, their merit accumulates, reaching three thousandfold, and through deep cultivation, they attain the Dao—all governed by the mind, hence the emphasis on the first.)*

This is for exorcising demons. According to the later sages’ instructions to Zhang Tian Shi and King Jun, General Zhou should lead the vanguard or rearguard and must not be exclusively ranked first.

If one seeks the Dao for longevity, the General of Tang should lead as first. If one seeks to cure illnesses or capture malevolent forces, General Zhou should lead as first, and success will follow. If one masters the Great Dao, the General of Tang should lead as first.

General Zhou, with his left hand holding the scepter and his right hand wielding the sinew-shaking bow force, arrives to seize and drive away the malevolent demons and bandits, following behind. This clarifies that he is the third in the General of Tang’s formation, as explained in the scriptures and prefaces.

The current interpretation follows the *Flowing Pearl* text as primary, governed by the heart’s intent and used in sequence. *(Annotation: This addition is from Zhao’s commentary, not the Celestial Master’s original Golden-Mouthed teachings.)*

The Celestial Master told King Jun: The Three Elements govern the Four Seasons—*(Annotation: Spring, Summer, Autumn, and Winter are the Four Seasons, corresponding to the divine entry into Taiyi, Lei Gong, and Liu Ren’s methods.)*—the Four Seasons *(Annotation: The gods of Heaven)* govern the Five Phases, the Five Phases govern the Six Jia, the Six Jia govern the Seven Stars, the Seven Stars govern the Eight Directions—*(Annotation: The Eight Directions in Heaven, the Eight Trigrams on Earth—Qian, Kun, Xun, Zhen, Kan, Gen, Dui, and Xian—all centered in the Middle Palace, invoking the Nine Palaces.)*—the Eight Directions govern the Nine Palaces, and the Nine Palaces generate the Ten Celestial Stems—*(Annotation: The current Ten Stems.)*—the Ten Stems generate the Twelve Earthly Branches, all arising from the natural *qi* of the Great Dao. When called upon, they respond and assist.

With a single-minded and refined intent, one attains profound understanding, securing the protection of the Three Elements and Five Phases. Through persistent cultivation, one achieves the Dao of longevity and eternal youth.

I once transmitted this teaching to Shennong, who only understood the Three Elements but not the Six Jia. Though he lived over a hundred years without signs of aging, he later attained the method of *shīxiè* (corporeal ascension).

chunks.original_text: 吾知六甲力，能守神治身，通神三元，能守人救人，治身通真，取真七星，能摄鬼通灵，立制邪精。 久而修求， 注：修者，步蹑配衣之法。 求者，是醮祭存咒术之道。 昔女仙樊夫人，每至本命之日，常行祭醮之法，往往行之。 十年一旦，北斗七星女天真下，教以步蹑之道，功满白日上升。 唯夫妻旧衣，俱不将去，邑人收葬之，至今人传刘樊旧衣之冢也。 立得长生。 皆须从三元而通七星，相假始兴行，能知此即位仙卿。 秘之，勿妄传非人。 吾故从一起，立二，使三，通四，翻五，服六，御七，指八，存九，应仙之法。 教之通神入真之道，无不因三元将军得通者耳。 一起初法，一者元炁也，在身之先生，故名元炁，为一。 注：身内神也，在泥丸之中。 又太一是也。 一有二等，一等身之外者，天也，太一之神。 一能使二，二即地神也。 注：在身即肾脾之神是也 龙神之长，曰地祇也。 一等身之内者，心也。 正一之神能使二，二即肾脾神也。 添左右肾 注：男左肾，女右肾也。 曰三也。 法曰：二能使三，即唐、葛、周是也。 三能摄伏百灵，医治百病，散解千灾，收灭万毒，. 注：毒祸之类是也。 皆此法为上，一炁之功也。 一法先步一字之纲，主心。 注：一者，元炁，脑神太一也，入藏主心。 后圣君谓王君曰：一神入五行，是也。 心起一念，便是行法纲纪之理。 纲纪既行，感摄百灵，使之无有不成。 但以心生口声，祸福罪善，起念便成。 古人尊一，使之不动。 坐二，使之不行。 投三，使万兵卫我长生，余恶不行也。 心使万神，三元为首，六甲为并，能使也。 注：能用能使者，使之依道，不有损伤人物之事，即为之使，使之有益也，善功之着。 使之损者，恶贯之盈，不可妄也。 能用立通神灵，可以长生。 三匝，讫，方始立纲步也。 老君曰：夫欲使三元将军，先存太一、天一、心一等神，步太一、心一等纲，配衣即勑，依法存使之，如将使兵也。 后圣君曰：心一能存，君告天师使於太一、天一。 太一能使收摄百邪，天一能使通达神仙，心一能使 注：能使者忠直解用，正心修行是也。 白日升天。 注：天师依言，举家得道。 步太一法，次步太一纲，先以左行三匝，讫，即立纲也。 老君曰：夫欲步太一纲，使三将军令应心口者，常欲使之时，先吞告命三官符三道，后可步此纲，使三将军唐将军为首，存使之，捻诀。 注：诀在左手第三指第二节，欲使之时，可以五色线缚之，即行有验。 后圣君告张道陵曰：子欲求长生，须作太一之行。 注：太一纲也。 欲得不死，存入天一纲裹。 注：天一者，正一三五步纲是也，正 一之法，存神步蹑之道也。 欲便飞仙，心一起，在众法之前。 注：心一存，一身之内，起在心也。 □ 夫修至道之人，先以心起念在众一之前，皆心作王，既知心为修行之主，即用心行正法，於太一之前，即得正一之性，与心一俱司天仙也。 常行心於三，一不失身，得神仙。 又告东海小童君曰：本命日步心一，上元甲子日步太一，中元甲子日、下元甲子日步正一。 往往如此，九年仙道成，三一备矣。 又告西山老女生， 注：一云香女生是也。 步三元将军元法，寅时用上元唐将军为首，午时午后用葛将军为首，申时向后用周将军为首。
chunks.translated_text:
---

The Dao of the Six Jia is known to me; one who can guard the spirit and regulate the body attains communion with the Three Elements. The Three Elements, when harnessed, can guard and save humanity. Regulating the body leads to communion with the True, and seizing the True of the Seven Stars grants mastery over ghosts and communion with spirits, establishing control over malevolent *qi*.

Through prolonged cultivation—*(Note: "修" refers to the method of measured steps and attuned clothing; "求" denotes the ritual techniques of exorcism, invocation, and talismans.)*—the immortal method is secured. The Daoist adept, Madame Fan, would, on the day of her birth, often perform exorcism rituals. Ten years later, the Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper descended, teaching her the method of measured steps. Upon completion, she ascended in broad daylight. Only her old wedding garments remained, and the villagers buried them; to this day, people speak of the tomb of Fan and Liu’s ancient garments.

Thus, one attains longevity. All must first pass through the Three Elements and then the Seven Stars, relying upon them to begin practice. Knowing this, one becomes a Daoist adept.

Keep it secret; do not recklessly impart it to others.

Therefore, I begin with One, establish Two, command Three, harmonize Four, transform Five, don Five, command Six, point to Seven, and preserve Nine—the method of attaining immortality.

I teach the Dao of entering the True and communing with the spirit, all achieved through the Three Elements Generals. The initial method is One: the *yuanqi* (original *qi*), the elder spirit within the body, thus named *yuanqi*, as One. *(Note: The spirit within the body is the "神," residing in the *nìwán* (brain marrow). The "太一" is also this.)*

One has two categories: the first, external to the body, is Heaven—the spirit of the *Taiyi*. One can command the second, which is the Earth spirit. *(Note: The Earth spirit within the body is the spirit of the kidneys and spleen, also called the Dragon God’s commander, the *Dìzhuì*.)*

The second category, within the body, is the heart—the spirit of *Zhèngyī* (Upright One) can command the second, which is the spirit of the kidneys and spleen. Adding the left and right kidneys *(Note: Left kidney for men, right for women.)*—this is Three.

The method states: Two can command Three—namely, the Generals Tang, Ge, and Zhou. Three can subdue a hundred spirits, heal a hundred ailments, disperse a thousand calamities, and eliminate ten thousand poisons. *(Note: Poisons and malevolent afflictions of this kind.)*

All these methods are supreme; they are the workings of One *qi*.

The method of One begins with the principle of the first step, the "One" character, which governs the heart. *(Note: "One" refers to *yuanqi* (original *qi*), the brain spirit *Taiyi*, which enters the body and governs the heart.)*

The later sage-king said to Lord Wang: "One spirit enters the Five Phases—this is the way. When the heart generates a thought, it is the principle of the method’s discipline and order. Once discipline and order are established, the hundred spirits respond, and nothing fails to succeed.

But if one speaks from the heart, invoking blessings or curses, the consequences of fortune or misfortune, guilt or virtue, arise with a single thought. The ancients honored One, keeping it undisturbed. Sit upon Two, making it inactive. Invest in Three, so that ten thousand soldiers guard my longevity, and no evil may act.

The heart commands all spirits; the Three Elements are the leaders, and the Six Jia are the assistants. One can command them. *(Note: Commanding and using them means guiding them to follow the Dao, without harming people or things; this is to make them beneficial, ensuring good deeds take root. Using them to harm is the accumulation of evil karmic deeds, which must not be done recklessly.)*

One can command and establish communion with the spirits, thereby achieving longevity. Three circuits complete, and then the discipline of the steps begins.

Laozi said: "If one wishes to command the Three Elements Generals, first preserve the spirits of *Taiyi*, *Tiānyī* (Heavenly One), and *Xīnyī* (Heart One). Then step the discipline of *Taiyi* and *Xīnyī*, attune the clothing, and issue the command according to the method, as if commanding soldiers.

The later sage-king told Zhang Daoling: 'You wish to seek longevity; you must practice the steps of *Taiyi*.' *(Note: The discipline of *Taiyi*.)* 'To attain immortality, preserve and enter the steps of *Tiānyī*.' *(Note: *Tiānyī* refers to the Upright One’s Three-Five steps of discipline, the method of preserving the spirit and measured steps.)* 'To swiftly ascend as an immortal, the *Xīnyī* must first arise, surpassing all other methods.' *(Note: When *Xīnyī* is preserved, it is within the body, arising from the heart.)*

---

For those who cultivate the Supreme Dao, the heart must first generate a thought before all the Ones. The heart reigns over the body; once one knows the heart is the sovereign of cultivation, one practices the correct method before *Taiyi*, attaining the nature of *Zhèngyī*, and together with *Xīnyī*, they govern all immortals.

The heart must always be steadfast in the Three Ones, never losing the body, and thus attains the Dao of immortality.

Again, he told the Young Lord of the Eastern Sea: "On the day of your birth, practice the steps of *Xīnyī*; on the *jiǎzǐ* day of Upper Element, practice the steps of *Taiyi*; on the *jiǎzǐ* day of Middle Element, and on the *jiǎzǐ* day of Lower Element, practice the steps of *Zhèngyī*. Often do this, and in nine years, the Dao of immortality will be complete; the Three Ones will be fulfilled.

Again, he told the Old Woman of the Western Mountain: *(Note: Some say this is the Fragrant Maiden.)* "Practice the method of the Three Elements Generals: use General Tang as the leader during the *yín* hour, use General Ge as the leader during the *wǔ* hour and its aftermath, and use General Zhou as the leader during the *shēn* hour and beyond."

chunks.original_text: 此老女每五日一为之，七年，反老，为少容三十许。 十年，道成，年可十八女子形貌也。 老君告黄帝 注：为广成子时，教帝步上元上部纲也，非中元唐将军也。 上元自有上中下三部，上元上部唐将军。 中部李将军。 下部徐将军是也。 曰：三元将军，统领五德，而出五行。 知此之道，可学长生。 帝因学之。 教帝从上元太一步纲法，起於上元甲子日步。 次即中元，是取中元甲子日步。 次即下元，取下元甲子日步。 上元步太一，中元步正一，下元步心一。 上元太一唐将军，主领天官天曹官吏之事，皆此神将管约之，通於上元上部唐将军也。 修道志人，切欲得知也。 中元天一将军。 主领地司，五岳四读，北酆都神灵，冥司之任管，通於上元中部李将军也。 修道之人不知，被北冥之记录。 知之常行，存三将军击伐，皆以葛将军为道也。 下元心一将军，主水府，及北方元极大荒之地，四海九江，千江万渎，溪源湖济之灵，悉皆主领管约，用以击伐收管，皆以周将军为首也。 上以应上元下部徐将军也。 步天一， 注：天一，是正一盟威法之步也，以纲常以与身勿伤骨。 亦先左脚前步。 步毕，都使三元，得三十六部散，三遍。 老君曰：欲步正一者，足未起而心存念正一之中，三大将军吏兵等。 毕，以步纲。 步纲毕，一即捻诀，作於正法，配衣七斗，或四斗。 注：俱有图，在於《流珠》之中也。 成以左右配衣如法，随意使用也。 老君授黄帝 注：帝时老君为广成子，或为无上先生，或尧舜时为务犹子也。 曰：帝欲求真，去病先求其修身法，守神术，去病 注：术，今之符箓是也。 上古呼箓 为道术，经文之事。 符坚体炁运津，能行三者，自得天真，此是修三一之道。 后圣君曰：三将者，人身三元之神也。 又是人之三魂，能以通神。 上神通天，中神通地，下神通水。 此三神名曰三将军，朱衣，赤帻，大冠，手持器仗旌节，或持刀剑，能制鬼贼邪魅，通真。 人若知其长存，以步驱使，令取仙道长生，立能救人病差。 人知之，令以辟害报人外谋，及相害种种，能知报人也。 老君曰：奉道之人，有小疾厄者，常存箓三将军，早朝入左右肾及心中，治身中疾病痛若之处。 先呼吸入病痛之处，然后闭炁，随左右心等将军，往痛处攻击，往往如此，五日当自差退，神验。 更加纳口闭炁，存使炁随将军，往痛疾之处，同攻击疾病，三日内消差。 又忽有恶人时口毒舌者，当取压口舌符，下书名姓，以式加临。 讫，使三将军往击之，此人自伏心休。 彼更不相犯，即休，勿苦用心相伐。 又相损无益。 后圣君告天师曰：道生於一，一是心也。 记录道如记食道，自合同心神，便与此三神将，同心力之通也。 兼授别诀，令三将军同心。 上元将军诀，存在心上。 中元将军诀，在心下一寸。 元将军诀，在心正中。 是三诀也。 但以存之，如图出一出，一出又入。 如子下杀上毕此长行之，一十四年，通神仙也。 老君曰：上元三将军在於额，中元三将军在於五藏心肾，下元三将军在於脾藏，诀在手心应於。 捻左手大指第二节心，应於额。 捻左手第三指中节，应於脾。 存使七斗法图 老君告韩逍子
chunks.translated_text:
「This Old Woman performs this practice every five days, and after seven years, she reverses her aging, becoming a youthful maiden of about thirty. After ten years, the Dao is complete, and she appears as a woman of eighteen in form and visage.

The Celestial Master told the Yellow Emperor—*(Note: At this time, the Celestial Master was Broad Success Child, or else the Peerless Sage, or during the time of Yao and Shun, he was the Attendant of the Numinous.)*—"The Three Elements Generals' method: the Upper Element has its own three divisions—Upper, Middle, and Lower. The Upper Division is led by General Tang. The Middle Division is led by General Li. The Lower Division is led by General Zhou.

He said: 'The Three Elements Generals oversee the Five *Dé* and manifest the Five Phases. Knowing this Dao, one may learn longevity.' The Emperor thus studied it.

The Celestial Master taught the Emperor the method of the Upper Element's *Taiyi* steps, beginning with the *jiǎzǐ* day of Upper Element. Next, he took the *jiǎzǐ* day of Middle Element. Then, he took the *jiǎzǐ* day of Lower Element. The Upper Element steps of *Taiyi*, the Middle Element steps of *Zhèngyī*, and the Lower Element steps of *Xīnyī*.

The Upper Element's *Taiyi* General Tang leads the celestial officials and bureaucrats, all governed by this divine general, corresponding to the Upper Division's General Tang of Upper Element. Aspirants of the Dao earnestly seek to know this.

The Middle Element's *Taiyi* General—*(Note: *Taiyi* refers to the *Zhèngyī* Alliance's ritual steps, which must be practiced with due reverence to avoid harming the body. One begins by advancing the left foot first.)*—leads the earthly mandates, the Five Sacred Mountains and Four Seas, as well as the spirits of the Northern Du Capital, overseeing the netherworld's affairs. This corresponds to the Upper Element's Middle Division General Li. Those who practice the Dao but do not know this are recorded by the Northern Netherworld.

If one knows and practices it often, the Three Generals' assaults are invoked, all led by General Ge.

The Lower Element's *Xīnyī* General leads the Water Palaces, the Northern expanse of the Primordial Wastes, the Four Seas and Nine Rivers, the myriad streams and lakes, and all the spirits of their sources. chunks.original_text: 注：逍子是女仙也。 曰：夫言一斗成者，是魁星使也。 先步地纪天纲，讫次即三将军纲。 三纲讫，即存斗使击伐也。 经云：先步后使北斗七星摄杀也，此是第一成。 便回手指物，未即依口也。 须以久学习熟。 二者有功，北斗与随，口所欲意，用使指验也。 夫一斗自有图，存想成用。 待想成讫，祝曰： 一斗成，三五并，回天覆地，随吾使令。 急急如律令。 二斗成者，是□星使也。 亦存一斗成，即二斗成也。 世人存使之於身之，功成通灵，身能威物保生，救济摄，无有不成，此名二星之使威也。 二斗亦自有图，存想成用之，应验。 祝曰： 二斗成，三五灵，收摄鬼贼，凶恶伏听。 急急如律令。 三斗成者，是□星使也。 亦存二斗成，毕即三斗成也。 存使之身渐威灵，三曜流光，一身之上，赫烈斗之形。 三斗亦自有图，存想成，指用之验。 祝曰：三斗成，天地肃清，斗随我身，见者奔惊。 急急如律令。 四斗成者，是□星使也。 亦存三斗成，毕次即四斗成也。 使之人赫然火周回四斗，如斗之形，精鬼凶恶心死摧伏。 四斗亦自有图，存想成，使之得验也。 祝曰： 四斗成，三五盈，行周万里，风火无停，杀灭鬼贼，凶恶敢行。 急急如律令。 五斗成者，是□星使也。 亦存四斗成，讫即五斗成也。 使之人光炁浮天，如斗之形，光照四方，鬼贼凶恶自远去百里，百病自消，魔邪伏灭。 五斗亦自有图，存想成，使之有斗形，真影照千里外，鬼神降伏。 祝曰：五斗成，五行陈，五金秋浮，落灭木精。 注：精鬼之众也。 五木春茂，克伐土星。 五水流荡，断截火行。 五火兴隆，五金敢呜。 五土净镇，我与万物俱生。 急急如律令。 六斗成者，是□星使也。 亦存五斗成，讫即六斗成也。 使之人精光天地，照曜八方，鬼贼潜藏，凶恶并迹，身通灵炁，性合真仙，百鬼畏敬，千神卫护。 六斗亦自有图，存想成，使之应效。 祝曰： 六斗成，三五俱行，除恶并凶，万里流清。 我使六斗六甲，俱并卫我身家，尽得长生。 急急如律令。 七斗成者，是魒星使也。 亦存六斗成，讫即七斗成也。 使之周匝七星，身带七斗，光照十方，身同北斗，妖凶自慑，祥瑞随人，万里肃清，卫兵千万。 亦自有图，故全七斗使之。 今备七星，存使立验，应於心口，如电照身通，存斗成力，使神灵久久如此，存使身飞上清。 祝曰： 七斗成身，与六甲并，驱使三元，回转五行，位入神仙，太一同行，力制九天，九土自清，愿家俱仙，举宅同生。 急急如律令。 老君曰：六甲之精，化为七星。 七星变动，监察万灵。 注：万灵者，谓人神龙兽精鬼等。 但是天地之内，生育有灵通神之者，曰灵也。 万灵所畏，北斗七星。 故以学道之人，皆知有北斗七星，而常存思戴履者，降伏三官，断绝四司，落灭死籍，注上长生。 令我学者仙道自成，故号斗成。 注：一二三四五六七，皆同之成也。 立其北斗，是先天地之众象成立，以令纠察天地之内万灵，立使令其死生，皆是北斗所主也。 故以人知学道者，皆以存戴配着，如人之衣。 衣之好恶长短之殊，而蔽身一等，周遍不失。 欲令万灵畏敬，而苟欲取其命长生也。 乃以随功一二之斗，其功深浅大小，使成之力，不失分毫。 初学之人，须以日夜勤心，记此之法思存，勿失星名字，常给记在心。

**Note:** *Xiaoziji* is a female immortal.

It is said: The **One Dipper** (*Yīdǒu*) completion is the **Kui Star**’s envoy. First, walk the **Earthly Measure** (*Dìjì*) and the **Celestial Dipper’s Ropes** (*Tiāngāng*), until the sequence reaches the **Three Generals’ Ropes**. When the **Three Ropes** are complete, then store the **Dipper’s Envoys** to strike and subdue. The scripture states: *"First walk, then summon the North Dipper’s Seven Stars to seize and kill"*—this is the **First Completion**.

Then turn the fingers to point at objects, but do not yet rely on the mouth. One must practice diligently and grow thoroughly familiar through prolonged study.

When the two methods yield results, the North Dipper follows, and whatever the mouth desires in intent, the fingers shall verify.

The **One Dipper** has its own diagram; store and visualize it for completion.

When visualization is complete, recite the invocation:

> *"One Dipper complete, Three Five united,*
> *Heaven reversed, Earth overturned,*
> *Follow my commands as envoys.*
> *As it is, so it shall be done—just as the law decrees."*

The **Two Dippers** completion is the envoy of the **□ Star**. Also, store the **One Dipper** completion, then proceed to the **Two Dippers** completion.

When the envoys are stored within the body, the practice succeeds and one attains communion with spirits. The body can then awe and subdue objects, safeguard life, rescue and gather the lost, and achieve anything desired—this is called the **Two Stars’ Envoys’ Awe**.

The **Two Dippers** also have their own diagram; store and visualize it for completion, and it shall manifest.

Recite the invocation:

> *"Two Dippers complete, Three Five enlightened,*
> *Gather and subdue malevolent spirits,*
> *Wickedness and evil shall submit in fear.*
> *As it is, so it shall be done—just as the law decrees."*

The **Three Dippers** completion is the envoy of the **□ Star**. Also, store the **Two Dippers** completion, then proceed to the **Three Dippers** completion.

When the envoys are stored within the body, its spiritual power gradually grows awe-inspiring. The **Three Manifestations** (*Sānyào*) radiate like light, and the form of the Dipper blazes upon the body. The **Three Dippers** also have their own diagram; store and visualize it for completion, and the envoys shall manifest in effect.

Recite the invocation:

> *"Three Dippers complete,*
> *Heaven and Earth purified,*
> *The Dipper follows my body,*
> *Those who see it shall flee in terror.*
> *As it is, so it shall be done—just as the law decrees."*

The **Four Dippers** completion is the envoy of the **□ Star**. Also, store the **Three Dippers** completion, then proceed to the **Four Dippers** completion.

When the envoys are summoned, the practitioner blazes with fire encircling the **Four Dippers**, assuming the Dipper’s form. Malevolent spirits and wickedness shall tremble, their hearts crushed and subjugated.

The **Four Dippers** also have their own diagram; store and visualize it for completion, and the envoys shall manifest in effect.

Recite the invocation:

> *"Four Dippers complete,*
> *Three Five full,*
> *Traverse ten thousand miles,*
> *Wind and fire shall not cease,*
> *Slay and annihilate malevolent spirits,*
> *Wickedness and evil dare not act.*
> *As it is, so it shall be done—just as the law decrees."*

The **Five Dippers** completion is the envoy of the **□ Star**. Also, store the **Four Dippers** completion, then proceed to the **Five Dippers** completion.

When the envoys are summoned, the practitioner’s **refined light** (*Guāngqì*) ascends to Heaven, assuming the Dipper’s form, its radiance illuminating the four quarters. Malevolent spirits and wickedness retreat a hundred miles, a hundred ailments vanish, and demons and malevolent forces are crushed and extinguished.

The **Five Dippers** also have their own diagram; store and visualize it for completion, and the envoys shall manifest in the Dipper’s form. The true image shines a thousand miles distant, spirits and gods submit in awe.

Recite the invocation:

> *"Five Dippers complete,*
> *The Five Phases arrayed,*
> *The Five Metals rise like autumn clouds,*
> *The Wooden Spirits are extinguished.*
> **Note:** *Spirits* refers to the multitude of malevolent ghosts.
> *The Five Woods flourish in spring, subduing the Earth Star.*
> *The Five Waters flow and disperse, severing the Fire Phase.*
> *The Five Fires blaze fiercely, the Five Metals dare not howl.*
> *The Five Earths are purified and settled,*
> *I and all things are born together.*
> *As it is, so it shall be done—just as the law decrees."*

The **Six Dippers** completion is the envoy of the **□ Star**. Also, store the **Five Dippers** completion, then proceed to the **Six Dippers** completion.

When the envoys are summoned, the practitioner’s refined light illuminates Heaven and Earth, radiating in the eight directions. Malevolent spirits and wickedness hide and vanish, while the body attains communion with spiritual *qi* (*Língqì*), its nature merging with the True Immortals. A hundred ghosts shall fear and respect, a thousand spirits shall guard and protect.

The **Six Dippers** also have their own diagram; store and visualize it for completion, and the envoys shall manifest in effect.

Recite the invocation:

> *"Six Dippers complete,*
> *Three Five move in concert,*
> *Eliminate evil and wickedness,*
> *Purify ten thousand miles.*
> *I summon the Six Dippers and Six Hexagrams,*
> *All united to guard my body and home,*
> *Attaining eternal life.*
> *As it is, so it shall be done—just as the law decrees."*

The **Seven Dippers** completion is the envoy of the **□ Star**. Also, store the **Six Dippers** completion, then proceed to the **Seven Dippers** completion.

When the envoys are summoned, the practitioner encircles the **Seven Stars**, bearing the **Seven Dippers** upon their body, their radiance illuminating the ten directions. The body aligns with the North Dipper, and malevolent spirits are struck with awe. Auspicious omens follow the practitioner, ten thousand miles are purified, and countless guards attend.

There is also its own diagram; thus, the **Seven Dippers** envoys are fully stored. Now, when the seven stars are established, the envoys manifest instantly, responding at the heart and mouth like lightning illuminating the body. Store the Dipper’s completion power, and the spirits shall endure thus forever. When the envoys are stored, the body ascends to the **Upper Pure** (*Shàngqīng*).

Recite the invocation:

> *"Seven Dippers complete the body,*
> *United with the Six Hexagrams,*
> *Drive and command the Three Elements,*
> *Reverse and turn the Five Phases,*
> *Enter the ranks of the immortals,*
> *Walk with the Supreme Unity,*
> *Dominate the Nine Heavens,*
> *Purify the Nine Earths,*
> *May my household all become immortals,*
> *Every dwelling share in eternal life.*
> *As it is, so it shall be done—just as the law decrees."*

**Laozi** says: *"The essence of the Six Hexagrams transforms into the Seven Stars."* The Seven Stars shift and move, overseeing and inspecting all spiritual beings.

**Note:** *Spiritual beings* refers to humans, gods, dragons, beasts, spirits, and ghosts, etc. Those within Heaven and Earth who are born with spiritual vitality and divine communion are called *spiritual beings*.

All spiritual beings fear the North Dipper’s Seven Stars. Thus, those who study the Dao all know of the North Dipper’s Seven Stars and habitually store and contemplate them, donning them like garments. Though garments differ in quality, length, and style, they uniformly cover the body without fail.

If one desires that all spiritual beings fear and respect, and to secure one’s own longevity, then with the **One Dipper** to **Six Dippers** according to merit, the depth and magnitude of their efficacy shall not falter by a single measure.

For those who are beginners, they must diligently cultivate day and night, memorizing this method and storing it in thought. Do not lose the names of the stars, and always keep them firmly in mind.

chunks.original_text: 道不离心，心亦不须离道。 两不相离，计功立取神仙也。 金锁流珠引卷之六竟 金锁流珠引卷之七 中华总真大仙宰王方平张道陵赵升王长司命李仲甫茅盈许玉斧等系代撰述 中华仙人李淳风注 说中篇上部转身存用图 诸道士苦心修道，读经念真，朝暮朝礼上香，或一日三时，或一日六时，或一日两时之者。 如此用心，或十年，二十年，三十年，或毕一生，皆无所得，老病枯灭。 或即绝榖栖山，烧丹炼药，年数深远，都无神灵，何以凭托。 如此之子，灭渡至多。 若不的门，有何可据。 若凭於斋戒清高，绝妻弃子者又众，不论道释，此子更多，总无一人得延生延命，长生人世，何况觅於升云鴐龙，上为真人。 今释氏典云：今生修来生，所有所受，不可为凭。 注：佛经云：今生修，来生受者，非也。 我大道犹不许起念，要国王大臣之心，恐要永固其身，何必舍今生骄富之心，欢求来生重报。 此言妄极，不可信为。 须求受至道之门，修行至道之要，今生而见，为道君臣，岂不全於身心，在道今道在此，身心俱修，取不败坏之体，岂不妙也。 此说因缘，下教 注：佛经多说因缘，此下人及无知女子，多一说死生答报之因，诱於愚布施。 不可。 上人奉行，道说自然，天生地育。 既天生地育，水火而始成身，长成人身，乃至於老死，亦是天地水火而始灭。 故生灭之本，三界之中，事事皆在自然，非在修种。 注：佛经重修种之言，不受自然之教。 但以直於身心在道，道种因福，亦在此身心。 万行内修，岂关外种。 注：真人修身心，不修土木塔庙。 真人炼身心，不炼金石。 事事在自然之教也。 故上真用法诀，不出一身之内，弘弥天地之间。 注：舍弘图之说也。 后圣君告西王母小女曰：汝少读书，长大事人。 后数年，见人读《老君经》始学读，乃识文字。 既识文字，如身中神名遍知否。 因闻说知神，乃授此转身幽思结心印诀之法。 注：正是此流珠之内诀法也。 后大神通，却教王母。 注：母先但能长生，乘龙行天地，呼即可龙驽，不能自摄龙鹤师子。 今起念云龙满天，兵史暗地，母子俱得，今号仙王也。 又再下授天师，令以精思，兼考召之法，法成身受考召中正法之师。 此世天官，亦同大郡守主之任，身法不轻，百日一思巡。 注：巡检世之妖神祟鬼精邪，令不为人祟。 十日一存用。 注：用者，思存用法，观世界恐有恶精邪神龙鬼，妄为祟害於人，及天地中，常恐有毒炁，浊乱於人物。 又恐日月不明，星宿不行，风雨不时，神　鬼欺人，如此等事，是其一。 其二即自理身，常令三魂七魄俱正，正炁常行，精魄分明，可以长生。 生之如图，日月分明，星宿内照。 注：存七星俱入五脏之内，镇守身神。 欲存出道父之形状如图也。 或在军阵，或在山草，或作大禁之所住止，闭炁一息，禹步十二迹。 注：此禹步十二迹，四步十二迹，主十二支，并十二月是。 太上老君授禹，禹因传世，谓之禹步。 左手持道父， 注：父者，阳也。 男以左手持忽起，起讫，便思存之，如人，头戴莲华冠，紫服，在左手中，渐渐上头心前，如自身。 存长短自身，存长九丈，紫衣，四边兵将执戈戟，左青龙，右白虎，玄武朱雀，罗列五云容。 即右捻鬼目，神目，虎狼目，恶人刀支目，以朱涂之。
chunks.translated_text:
The Dao does not depart from the heart, nor does the heart need to depart from the Dao.
When the two are inseparable, divine efficacy is established, and immortality is attained.

**The Sixth and Seventh Scrolls of *Jin Suo Liu Zhu* (Golden Lock Flowing Pearl)**

Composed by the Great True Ones of Zhonghua:
Zai Wang Fang Ping, Zhang Daoling, Zhao Sheng, Wang Chang, Si Ming, Li Zhongfu, Mao Ying, Xu Yu Fu, and others of successive generations.
Commentary by the Daoist Immortal Li Chunfeng.

**Explanation of the Upper Section: *Zhuan Shen Cun Yong Tu* (Diagram of Transforming the Body and Storing Its Use)**

All Daoist practitioners who diligently cultivate with earnest devotion—reciting scriptures, chanting the True, offering morning and evening incense, whether three times a day, six times a day, or twice a day—
yet after ten years, twenty years, thirty years, or even their entire life, gain nothing, only to perish from old age or disease.

Some abandon food and dwell in mountains, burning elixirs and refining medicines for years without divine response—what then can they rely upon?
Such disciples perish in great numbers.

If one does not grasp the true path, what foundation can they have?
Those who rely solely on fasting, purity, and abandoning wife and child—whether Daoists or Buddhists—are even more numerous, yet none have prolonged life or extended their years, let alone ascended as dragons and phoenixes to become True Persons.

Now, the Buddhist scriptures say:
*"What one cultivates in this life will be received in the next"*—this is false.
**Note:** The Buddhist scriptures claim, *"What one cultivates in this life will be received in the next,"* but this is incorrect.

Our Great Dao does not even permit such thoughts. If kings and ministers seek to preserve their bodies eternally, why would they abandon the pride and wealth of this life to seek rewards in the next?
These words are utterly baseless and unworthy of trust.

One must seek the gate of the Supreme Dao and grasp its essential practice—realizing it in this life, becoming the Dao’s sovereign and minister. How could this not perfect body and heart?
The Dao is here, in this life. Body and heart must be cultivated together, attaining an indestructible form—how wondrous is this?

This is the explanation of cause and effect.
**Note:** The Buddhist scriptures often speak of cause and effect, yet ignorant people—especially foolish women—are deceived into believing in karmic retribution and induced to make empty offerings. This is wrong.

The enlightened follow the Dao naturally, as heaven nurtures and earth sustains.
Since heaven nurtures and earth sustains, water and fire first form the body, and when the body matures into humanity, it is again water and fire that bring about old age and death.
Thus, the origin of birth and death lies within the Three Realms, all governed by natural law, not by cultivation of seeds.
**Note:** The Buddhist scriptures emphasize the cultivation of seeds, ignoring the teaching of natural law.

Yet true alignment with body and heart lies within the Dao. The seed of the Dao and its blessings reside in body and heart itself.
All internal cultivation is complete—external seeds are irrelevant.
**Note:** True Persons cultivate body and heart, not earthen structures or temples.
True Persons refine body and heart, not metals and stones.
All is governed by the natural teaching of the Dao.

Thus, the Supreme True Ones employ methods and incantations that never leave the body, yet their influence permeates heaven and earth.
**Note:** This rejects the notion of grand diagrams.

Later, the Sage Emperor instructed the young daughter of Xi Wangmu:
*"Though you were young and read little, you will serve others well when grown."*
After several years, she saw someone reading the *Lao Jun Jing* and began learning the characters.
Once she recognized the script, she asked: *"Do you know the names of the gods within the body?"*
Hearing this, she was taught the method of *Zhuan Shen You Si Jie Xin Yin* (Transforming the Body, Silent Contemplation, and Sealing the Heart’s Seal).
**Note:** This is the inner method of the *Liu Zhu* (Flowing Pearl).

Later, with great spiritual power, she taught Xi Wangmu in return.
**Note:** Initially, Xi Wangmu could only prolong life, ride dragons across heaven and earth, and summon them at will—but she could not herself master dragons, cranes, lions, or tigers.
Now, by invoking clouds and dragons in thought, and summoning armies unseen, mother and daughter both attained it, and she is now called the Immortal King.

Again, she passed this down to the Heavenly Master, commanding him to refine his thoughts and combine the method of summoning.
When the method was perfected, he became the central teacher of the Orthodox Dao, a celestial official akin to a great prefect, his status unassailable.
He must meditate once every hundred days.
**Note:** To inspect and suppress malevolent spirits, ghosts, and evil *jing* (precise entities) that harm humanity.

He must store and apply the method once every ten days.
**Note:** *"Apply"* means to contemplate and store the method, observing the world for malevolent *jing*, evil spirits, dragons, and ghosts that might harm humanity—or for poisonous *qi* disrupting humanity and the cosmos.
He must also fear that the sun and moon may dim, stars may cease their courses, winds and rains may fail, and spirits may deceive people.
These are the first concerns.

The second concern is self-cultivation: keeping the Three Souls and Seven Spirits aligned, ensuring *qi* flows correctly, and distinguishing essence and spirit—thus attaining longevity.
Life is as depicted in the diagram: the sun and moon are clear, the stars shine within.
**Note:** Store the Seven Stars so they enter and govern the five viscera, guarding the body’s spirits.

One may also assume the form of the Dao Father as depicted in the diagram—
whether in battle, in the wilderness, or in a grand sealed retreat—
holding one’s breath, stepping in the Twelve Paces of Yu.
**Note:** The Twelve Paces of Yu, four steps in twelve paces, correspond to the Twelve Branches and the Twelve Months. The Supreme Lord Lao transmitted this to Yu, who passed it to the world, calling it the *Yu Bu* (Yu’s Steps).

With the left hand, hold the Dao Father.
**Note:** *"Father"* refers to the Yang. Men should use the left hand to grasp *Hu Qi* (Sudden Breath), and upon completion, contemplate it as a figure—
wearing a lotus-crowned headdress, clad in purple robes—
gradually rising until it stands before the heart, as if part of oneself.

Store its height as one’s own: nine *zhang* tall, in purple robes, surrounded by soldiers bearing spears and halberds—
the Azure Dragon to the left, the White Tiger to the right, the Black Tortoise and Vermilion Bird arrayed in the five clouds.

Then, with the right hand, trace:
the Ghost’s Eye,
the Spirit’s Eye,
the Tiger’s and Wolf’s Eyes,
and the Evil Man’s Knife-Supporting Eye,
marking them all in red.

chunks.translated_text:
「With both hands clasped before the heart, strike the teeth thirty-six times, then open the eyes and recite the invocation.

Store the self as the **Examiner-Invoker** (考召法师)—
**Note:** This is the modern term for the **Examiner-Invoker** when petitioned in official documents.
In ancient times, the Dao Father (太上老君) served as **Yu You Zi** (务犹子) during the reigns of Yao and Shun.
After two hundred and fifty years in the Western Realm (西国), he internally transformed the **Illuminated King** (明王) **Dali** (达利) into a Buddha (佛), and appointed **Wuji Zi** (无极子) as the **Examiner-Invoker** (考召法师).
That one was called **Guanyin** (观音), who attends to the sufferings and diseases of all beings,
so that none perish prematurely or are harmed by calamity (夭伤).
The soldiers and generals are arrayed on both sides as per the diagram.
**Note:** The diagram appears in the *Jin Suo Liu Zhu Jing* (金锁流珠经).

According to the method, traverse the world (世界), and from the mouth emit great winds and clouds (大风云),
filling all of heaven and earth—
this is the mandate of the Dao (行道之命).
Recite the incantation (捻诀咒) thus:

*"Heaven is luminous, Earth is responsive.
I am the Examiner-Invoker, born before Heaven and Earth.
I traverse as Heaven and Earth’s envoy, standing as their soldiers.
Misfortune and calamity meet their own destruction, virtue and power appear of their own accord.
Not only do I restrain the Tiger and Wolf (虎狼),
but I also command the Five Armies (五兵).
Divine Dragons dare not act divine, demons dare not act responsive.
I point to mountains, and mountains collapse;
I point to waters, and waters dry up.
I point to stones, and stones roll away;
I point to the sun, and it shines brightly.
My body guards me in both movement and rest,
with three hundred and sixty thousand soldiers following.
At my hand’s command,
winds, fires, thunder, and lightning arise immediately.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the **imperative decree** (如律令)."*

Upon finishing the incantation, trace the **secret formula** (捻诀).
**Note:** The secret formula is on the first joint of the left hand’s index finger,
covering the **Ghost’s Eye** (游鬼目) and the **Five Armies’ Commanding Eye** (都监).
The **Ghost’s Eye** is on the first joint of the fourth finger.

The Dao Father (太上老君) transmitted the **Twelve Manifestations of Yu’s Step** (十二迹禹步) to the Yellow Emperor (黄帝).
**Note:** This was when **Guang Cheng Zi** (广成子) instructed the Emperor.
During the reigns of Yao and Shun, he passed it to **Yu** (禹),
and **Yu** then transmitted it to the people of the world.

The Dao Father said:
*"To seek the Dao of longevity (求长生之道),
one must first align the **Step Framework** (步纲) and trace the **secret formula** (捻诀),
and also master the methods of saving others and subduing ghosts,
controlling divine Dragons, Tigers, and Leopards (神龙虎豹),
as well as averting plagues and epidemics (瘟毒疫疠).
Within the Five Armies (五兵),
one can emerge unscathed alone.
One can also restrain them,
or command them to withdraw from harm.
This method is profound and subtle (微妙),
and cannot be easily heard."*

Those who have seen and heard the **Manifestations of the Dao** attain communion with the divine, and the divine protect them as their guardians.

Those who attain this method must first receive instruction from a **Clear Teacher** (明师). Only after being transmitted the **Scriptures, Laws, and Talismans** (经法箓) may they, after three years or two years, then be granted this method’s **secret formula**. This formula is transmitted orally, strictly following prescribed rites and measures. It cannot be hastily passed in batches of three or five volumes at once. Instead, unrelated matters must be discussed, and the transmission day must be broken into three or two separate sessions of oral instruction.

Following the **precepts of past and future sages**, one cultivates the **Great Dao’s reverence for the Most Exalted Sovereign**. Knowing not to recklessly divulge the teachings, both master and disciple attain true immortality. How could this not be the master’s restraint in transmission and the disciple’s sincere resolve to receive it?

To seek the **Supreme Dao**, one must devote heart and soul, bowing in earnest and sincere petition—never casually requesting a teacher and expecting immediate instruction. In this world, ordinary teachers, yielding to human desires, recklessly transmit and lightly divulge the Dao’s methods.

**Note:** In ancient times, great immortals would transmit the Scriptures, Laws, and Talismans, then require three thousand days of cultivation before passing on the essential **secret formulas**. This was to prevent people from forgetting their cultivation, for life is fleeting. Thus, they would petition for instruction and warnings, testing the disciple through three or five matters. Only if their resolve was unshaken, their aspiration for longevity genuine, and their desire to benefit the world sincere—without leaking the teachings to the unworthy—would they grant oral transmission.

Originally, this method was not recorded in writing, for those who seek the Dao often suffer from forgetfulness, and written records would go unmastered. The **Celestial Tribunals** of the **Three Officials** (三官) and the **Divine Sovereigns of Heaven, Earth, and Water** (天曹上帝道君及后圣君) were informed, lest true immortals and holy masters be disgraced. If the transmission is not passed orally, the disciple will not attain immortality. The blame falls upon the **Three Officials**, who would then harm and kill them. This is not because the unworthy rejected the formula, but because they lacked the path to cultivation, hence failing to become immortals.

Thus, the **Ancient Sage Laozi** commanded the **True Person Light Resonance** (光妙音) to compile and practice the **secret formulas**, integrating them into the Dao’s gate. He then structured **Fifteen Volumes** and transmitted them to **Mu Tianzi** and the **Sages**, opening the path to cultivation. In the prosperous era, when the **Later Sage Sovereign** (后圣君) was known, he ordered **Wang Fangping** to compile **Thirty Volumes**, transmitting them to the **Heavenly Hosts** and **Cavernous Heavens**.

Among those who left the world and received transmission were:
**Zhang Tian Shi**, **Zhang Chongxu**, **Li Yanni**, **Li Shaojun**, **Li Babai**, **Li Jingyou**, **Li Fazhou**, **Li Changxian**, **Li Zhongfu**, the **three Teach brothers**, **Yuan Shaokang**, **True Yuanzi**, **Wei Zhongkuan**, **Zhu Shaoyang**, **Le Yi**, **Dongfang Shuo**, **Yin Xi**, **Xu Jia**, **Xu Cha**, **Xu Hui**, **Shi Jiazi**, **Jie Xiang**, **Li Buji**, and hundreds more—all who practiced this method and became **True Persons**, passing it down in succession. They compiled **Fifteen Volumes of Dao Lectures**.

From the ancient **Pan Gu era** to the present, this method has been compiled and transmitted through successive generations. **The crimes of neglecting this are grave.**

**Translation:**

**Note:** In ancient times, **Huáng Lú Zǐ Gé Yuè** resided in **Mount Shàoshì**. Suddenly, a devoted seeker of the **Dao** appeared, but he did not meet a master. **Yuè** then suddenly communicated with him, agreeing to take him as a disciple. The seeker returned home, gathered gold and silk, and eagerly sought instruction. **Yuè** warned him, saying, *"Your haste is a grave offense. The **Dao** first transmits the **fa** of the **luóshu** (scrolls), then imparts the secrets of the **ling** scriptures. You press too urgently—your guilt extends even to me."* Thus, he refused to instruct him. The man departed.

Later, a divine being descended to inform **Yuè**, *"You have mastered the **Dao**-heart profoundly; never reveal it lightly."* **Lǎozǐ**, the **Tàishàng**, spoke to **Huángdì**, saying: *"When the mind is deeply focused and the body transformed, the **Dao**-command reaches all spirits."* **Note:** *To command all spirits means to follow the twelve steps of **yōusī zhuǎnshēn**—the pivoting of the body’s framework. This summons the spirits within the body: the **three souls and seven spirits**, the **five viscera and hundred vessels**, the **thousand tendons and myriad subtle essences**, ordering each to its proper station—**Zhèngdìng** and **Wáng**—to circulate **qi** and vitalize **fa**. When the **fa** is activated and prohibitions moved, it harmonizes with the spirits of **Heaven and Earth**, **Yin and Yang**, the **Sun, Moon, and stellar deities**, merging into one. Thus, on **Jiǎzǐ Days** or **Liùjiǎ Days**, in the first year, the **Dao**-spirits command armies. In the second year, they dispel a thousand poisons and subdue ten thousand soldiers. In the third year, the **Xian Dao** is fulfilled.

If you but focus your mind—whether walking, standing, sitting, or lying—constantly preserving the original master, you will naturally attain communion with the **Dao**. Merging with **Heaven and Earth**, you will spontaneously become **True**. Your **běnmìng** (natal destiny) shall be the first to transform. **Note:** *Always meditate on the **běnmìng** as depicted; in one year, you will commune with spirits, and spirits and ghosts will revere you in awe.* After one year, the spirits of **Heaven and Earth** will all respond to your will and speech, granting no wish unfulfilled. Each passing year, your merit grows.

Practice for one year and gain the **Five Spirits**. In two years, the **fa** is complete, and you become a **True Person**. In three or four years, the **Shàngqīng** will draw near, the **Yùnǚ** will descend in response, divine beings will appear, and all spirits will follow. Those who practice this **fa** will inevitably become **True**.

Later, the **Sage Monarch** instructed the **Shàngyuán True Person Lǐ Fāngqī**, saying: *"You wish to accumulate merit and receive divine summons."* **Note:** *The **kǎozhào fa**—healing one person’s illness counts as one merit. Three thousand people healed equal three thousand merits.* *"To attain communion with the **yōu** (mystic depths), you must cultivate stillness and transform the body."* **Note:** *The steps of **bùgāng** require bodily transformation. When the ancients spoke of **zhuǎnshēn**, they referred to the modern **bùgāng**.* *"To become **True**, quicken your steps and hasten your pace. If your **Dao**-practice is earnest and your body fails, yet your mind never ceases, you will still attain it. It is like practicing the **bù** steps—its efficacy is verified by its results."* **Note:** *The ancient **Xianren** all relied on mental cultivation.*

When a person’s practice is profound and enduring, the **Dao** naturally imprints upon the mind. A single thought suffices—no difficulty remains. If you persistently uphold this practice, your descendants will inherit it, and your merit will extend to your six relations.

chunks.original_text: 本姓盘，名体。 注：上古上元将军一人，姓名。 至三皇天皇之世，太上老君为太上大道君，万道之主之时。 迁盘将军一人，入大真人位。 以唐短替上元上部大将军之位，因兹始也。 用法思本师在身之前。 注：传此法师，即可存之。 如不传此法，不可妄存，反损存用之人。 昔地皇民不受妄存，忽一旦将军见。 身长九千万丈。 声似天雷，呼地皇为地氏之子，子师何人，摄呼我身。 於是地皇对曰：臣师是五灵老君。 将军又曰：子缘不师於五灵老君，若师老君，我更见身。 责子将作何也。 子师束来子为师，且束来子身受经法，玉录不足，金录全无。 口诀云：我受道於东夏子，夏子是来子父。 虽父在之日，传於经法，从来不曾简写。 妄言授简道於灵山，是何山上。 妄言妄语，殃及子身。 容子　三年理人，后当代责子之罪。 於是地皇日夜忧惧恐死，即登山涉水，寻求五灵老君，五灵老君见来，遥知被责，便言曰：大皇奉道不真，骂道不神，今被天神所责，怨在何人。 於是地皇氏再拜老君，唯称死罪。 鄙性好道，修求不真。 自身本是愚人，今逢愚匠，今某妄修行，天官责罚。 敢望人身。 伏乞大道大恩，赐纳驱使，免得三年之外，天官责罚其罪，恐失人身，何敢更受皇位。 老君即变大神道，闭炁，捻诀，西土人谓之结印是也。 须臾之问，唐、李、徐三将一时俱下，与地皇氏为保奉，度大道金录玉箓八十余阶，天皇、地皇、人皇《三皇内文》内箓等经四十九卷，修行十四年，得道，理世八万九千年后，而升玄丘之台。 自身在本师后，捻诀。 更存思上元上部唐将军一人，姓唐，名短。 注：小低声呼之。 此神是太一尊神之上将也，不可妄呼。 身长九千万丈，上五纲神功曹一人，姓姜，名毒。 身亦长九百丈。 领朱衣百千万重人，朱衣，赤帻，手把金符，带龙洲之剑，领兵百万众，在三十二天之上，太清之极，总领天宿星斗之神， 注：太上老君告盘古王曰：天宿者，二十八宿是也。 星斗者，中斗九星九精也。 应是天上九野星斗，皆属此神管领也。 号曰功曹，如国中宰相之位也。 上元将军，如天子之位也。 故曰巡检三清之极也。 大罗四方之中，一切生死，皆由注落，注生落死也。 王须知之，则长生。 不知则短寿。

The surname **Pán**, given name **Tǐ**.

*Note: The name of the ancient Upper Primordial General.*

In the age of the **Three Sovereigns**, the **Heavenly Sovereign**, the **Tàishàng Lǎojūn**—**Supreme Dao Lord**—as **Tàishàng Dàdàojūn**—**Supreme Lord of Ten Thousand Ways**—transferred the **Pán General** into the position of **Dàzhēnrén**—**Great True Person**.

Thus began the succession of the **Táng Duǎn**—**Tang Short**—as **Upper Primordial Upper Division Great General**, replacing the former.

*Use the method of the original teacher before oneself.*

*Note: If this method is transmitted, it may be preserved. If not transmitted, it must not be recklessly kept, lest it harm those who store it.*

In ancient times, the **Dìhuáng**—**Earthly Sovereign**—did not receive the reckless preservation of the Dao. Suddenly, the General appeared, his body nine hundred million *zhàng* in length. His voice like heavenly thunder, he called out to the Earthly Sovereign: *"Earthly Son, who is your teacher? Why do you summon me?"*

The Earthly Sovereign replied: *"My teacher is the Five Spirits Lord."*

The General said: *"Because you did not study under the Five Spirits Lord, if you had studied under the Lord, I would not have appeared. I now accuse you—what will you do? Bind yourself to him as your teacher! Bind yourself to receive the scriptures and methods. The Jade Registers are insufficient, the Golden Registers are entirely lacking. The oral transmission says: 'I received the Dao from the Eastern Xia Child. The Xia Child is your father. Though he lived, he transmitted the scriptures fully, never abridged. To claim you received the abbreviated Dao from Ling Mountain—what mountain is this? False words, false speech, will bring calamity upon your body. Give you three years to govern, then I will hold you accountable for your crimes."*

Thus, the Earthly Sovereign feared death day and night, ascending mountains and crossing waters to seek the Five Spirits Lord. When the Lord saw him, he knew he was being accused and said: *"Great Sovereign, your adherence to the Dao is not sincere, your reviling of the Dao is not divine. Now you are punished by the Heavenly Officials—who is to blame?"*

The Earthly Sovereign knelt twice before the Lord, declaring his guilt. *"I am of base nature, fond of the Dao but my practice is insincere. I am a foolish man, now encountering a foolish artisan. I have recklessly cultivated, and the Heavenly Officials punish me. How dare I hope to retain my human form? I beg the Great Dao’s great mercy, to accept and command me, lest beyond three years the Heavenly Officials punish my crimes, and I lose my human form. How dare I still receive the Sovereign’s position?"*

The Lord then transformed into a great divine method, closed his *qi*, and performed the *niǎnjué*—*muttered incantation*—which Westerners call *structuring the seal*. In an instant, the three generals—Táng, Lǐ, and Xú—descended together, acting as guarantors for the Earthly Sovereign. They transmitted the **Great Dao Golden Registers and Jade Talismans** in over eighty stages, the **Three Sovereigns’ Inner Texts**—*Heavenly, Earthly, and Human*—and forty-nine volumes of scriptures. After fourteen years of cultivation, he attained the Dao, governed the world for eighty-nine thousand years, and ascended to the **Xuánqiū Platform**.

In the presence of the original teacher, he performed the *niǎnjué* once more.

He then preserved the thought of the **Upper Primordial Upper Division Táng General**, surnamed **Táng**, named **Duǎn**.

*Note: Call him softly.*

This deity is the **Tàiyī**—**Supreme Unity**—Emperor’s general. Do not call him recklessly. His body is nine hundred million *zhàng* in length. Below him is the **Five Halters Divine Functionary**, surnamed **Jiāng**, named **Dú**. His body is also nine hundred *zhàng* long. He commands a hundred thousand million layers of red-clad attendants—red-clad, with crimson headbands, holding golden talismans and wielding the **Lóngzhōu Sword**—leading a hundred thousand soldiers. Above the **thirty-two heavens**, at the **extreme of Tàiqīng**—**Supreme Clarity**—he oversees all the **heavenly lodges and star clusters**.

*Note: The Supreme Lord told Pángǔ King: "The heavenly lodges are the Twenty-Eight Constellations. The star clusters are the Nine Stars of the Central Dipper and the Nine Spirits. All the stars and clusters of the nine celestial regions above belong to this deity’s jurisdiction."*

He is called the **Functionary**, like a prime minister in the realm. The Upper Primordial General is like the Emperor’s position. Hence, he is said to **inspect the extremes of the Three Pure Ones**.

Within the **Great Luo’s** four directions, all life and death stem from **registration and fall**—registered to be born, fallen to die.

O King, you must know this, then you will **long-live**. If you do not know, your lifespan will be short.

chunks.original_text: 盘古王知，长存於眉山之上，出入左肾之中，如此十四年，得道，理国八万九千年，而升太极，一国男女同升。 从天而下。 存见郁郁从云中下，皆在人泥丸 注：泥丸，是身脑之宫，名曰上元，上部将军所止之宫，住也。 与左肾神相应相通。 人常存之止泥丸，镇於左肾，女人镇右肾是也。 如若不能知辩者，看於含影图，即思存，得天地万神，与身神通镇一身之内。 更捻司命之诀，即能立取长生。 不虚也。 此是后圣君告命於五岳灵山修行之人，葛越、彭寿等二十八仙，所记於修行灵山。 述记叙录，不传世人。 之宫。 注：《金锁流珠》云：泥丸之中，后圣君告云宫。 藏在左肾裹。 注：夜卧常存镇於左肾，女右肾。 白日有事，或冲出，从左眉上而出也。 逼满天入来覆人。 忽思用，冲出左眉上，从天门双出也。 注：《金锁流珠》中无双字，后圣君告命浮丘公有双字是也。 何以知也。 夫人修道，更身得道，亦象天地，故合相应。

Pángǔ King knew that the **Eternal Essence** abides atop **Mèishān**, entering and exiting within the **left kidney**. Thus, for fourteen years, he cultivated and attained the **Way**, governing the realm for eighty-nine thousand years before ascending to the **Supreme Ultimate**. All the people of his realm ascended together with him.

From the heavens above, the **Eternal Essence** descended in a dense, cloudlike form—all converging in the **Níhuán** of mortals.
*Note: The Níhuán is the palace of the mind, named Upper Primordial, the abode of the Upper Primordial General.*

It resonates and communicates with the spirit of the left kidney. Mortals must cultivate and anchor the **Eternal Essence** in the Níhuán, where it stabilizes within the left kidney—women anchor it in the right kidney.

Further, by mastering the **Thumbscrews of the Fate-Bearers**, one can immediately attain **long-life**—this is not empty doctrine.

This is what the **Later Sage-King** revealed to those who cultivated on the **Five Sacred Peaks of Ling Mountain**, including the Twenty-Eight Immortals—**Gěyuè, Péngshòu**, and others—recording their practices on Ling Mountain. These accounts were not passed down to the common world.

*Note: The* Golden Lock, Flowing Pearl *states: The Later Sage-King revealed the Cloud Palace within the Níhuán, concealed within the left kidney.*
*Note: At night, one should cultivate and anchor the Eternal Essence in the left kidney; women anchor it in the right. By day, if engaged in affairs, it may surge forth, exiting through the left eyebrow and ascending to the heavens, enveloping the body. When needed, it surges from the left eyebrow, emerging through the **Heavenly Gate** in pairs.*

chunks.original_text: 且上元将军是天神大仙官，虽通人，人以箓强录在左肾肾中者，是人神与天神通灵相应。 故人身神出，从左肾而出天上。 上元将军即从天门出，同於人身。 人身亦存眉为天门之状，如奏章存图　也。 团团云中转来，覆人身家也。 注：《金锁流珠》无此三字。 后圣君告命浮丘公有此三字。 至如修道之人，得道之后，济家助国救人，何况只一身一家，而能济无极他方世界之人。 若身家 及他人亦得。 有急事，向北斗呼之，即有降下。 与卿 注：《金锁流珠》元三字，后圣君告命中有。 解灭灾祸，囚神龙鬼。 注：亦无此八字，是告命中出。 即身转天关，於手结法印於指。 注：是捻诀也，诀在左手第一指甲下。 以右手就捻之少时。 禹步十二迹，或九迹。 注：大禹步九迹，小禹步十二迹，此是后圣君言大小禹步。 若太上老君言，十二迹是大禹步。 举天关，指有祟之方。 注：或兵官，或病人所住之方是也。 或恶人鬼来处之方也。 即自消灭，速於水火。 注：言此法急速之应，立能通灵。 无事轻唤，身心家灭亡 注：《金锁流珠》并无无事家三字，亦是告命中出，注上引。 太上老君告黄帝曰：身家国无事，妄存身家灭门，不可轻唤为。 金箓云：轻唤北斗及上元上部将军，身心灭亡。 太上又告安和子 注：安和子是神农之弟，学道於恒山，遇太上老君，降授於上清三五飞步天纲地纪之法。 常存三五之要诀引，感得三元神降下，教授修行之道，白日上升，炎火南极之天世界，火炼金石，而为根之地。 曰：三元之中，上元上部为贵尊，如世天子之位，甚能令人得道。 存用有日，不可妄为。 除本命日、甲子日、上元日， 注：甲子是上元，甲子日是除此日之外不可妄行损人。 存修行用为之。 如忽有身家急疾事，被人谋害，重病垂死，兵贼，存呼之，立即灭亡，极验。 不在此日，亦得。 后圣君告天师道陵曰：卿欲教人求出灾害，入长生之道，取彼人上元 注：甲子中有上中下三元历日中取。 本命之日夜，於北斗下烧香，思存本师。 讫，存见上元上部将军，下入泥丸宫，次入左肾。 次中元、下元， 注：中元入右肾，下元入心中。 夫思神先令止於泥丸，入於心肾，安镇五藏。 即捻诀，禹步四步十二迹。 讫，思存之出覆身，如含弘之图，周备三元五行，雷公五雷，八卦日月星宿。 周毕，即诵五行十八咒一遍，求长生。 一年，便入不死之道。 二年，名入长生，辟兵出厄，通灵，感动天地，心欲便成。 俱入泥丸。 后各依入心肾中。 少时安镇身神定，即出之，如含弘图。 毕，捻诀，闭炁，禹步十二迹，求生出厄。 一年之内，神验立成，甚能佐天纲地纪之道。 卿其勿妄传非人。 此法三元内五法，能以直径入大道之门，秘之吉，泄之凶。 老君告上古三元神君曰：夫修三元，皆从上元本命起。 次即中元，次即下元，三元周备。 修之一年之中，或得五度。 注：上元甲子六十日中，有本命一度。 中元甲子中，有本命日二度。 下元甲子中，有本命日三度。 以次到上元，周而复始，取本命为之，二年之内得十日，修行即得其不死之道。 后圣君授上元上部将军符一道，与张道陵吞。 吞毕，即存使之，无不如意。 并勑令系代相传志人。
chunks.translated_text:
The **Supreme General of the Upper Primordial** is a celestial deity and great immortal official. Though he communicates with mortals, when humans, through sacred writs, register him within the left kidney, it is as though the human spirit and celestial deity resonate in harmony.

Thus, when the human spirit emerges, it ascends from the left kidney to the heavens above. The Supreme General of the Upper Primordial then descends through the **Heavenly Gate**, aligning with the human body. The human body likewise retains the brow as the form of the **Heavenly Gate**, like an inscribed petition with its diagram.

The **clustered clouds** revolve and descend, enveloping the body and household.

*Note: The* Golden Lock, Flowing Pearl *omits these three characters. The Later Sage-King’s revelation to Fúqiū Gōng included them.*

As for those who cultivate the **Way**, after attaining it, they can benefit families, aid nations, and rescue people—how much more so if they can save the boundless worlds beyond their own body and household? If the body and household, or others, also attain it, in times of urgency, one may call upon the **Northern Dipper**, and it will descend immediately.

With the **coastal marshal**, *Note: The* Golden Lock, Flowing Pearl *omits the three characters "元" (Primordial), which appear in the Later Sage-King’s revelation,* one may dispel calamities and disasters, subdue spirits, dragons, and ghosts.

*Note: These eight characters are also absent; they appear in the revelation.*

Then, one turns the **Heavenly Pivot**, forms the **seal of the finger** with the hand, *Note: This is the "twisting of the incantation." The incantation is hidden beneath the first fingernail of the left hand.* and with the right hand, twists it for a short while.

One takes **Yǔ’s Steps**—twelve strides, or nine. *Note: The Great Yǔ’s Step has nine strides; the Lesser Yǔ’s Step has twelve. This is the Later Sage-King’s distinction between the Great and Lesser Yǔ’s Steps. If the Most High Laozi speaks, the twelve-stride step is the Great Yǔ’s Step.*

One raises the **Heavenly Pivot**, pointing toward the direction of the malevolent force—*Note: This may be where soldiers or the sick reside, or where evil men and ghosts gather.*—and it vanishes instantly, faster than fire or water. *Note: This speaks to the swift response of the method, which can instantly manifest its efficacy. Calling without cause will bring ruin to oneself and one’s household.*

*Note: The* Golden Lock, Flowing Pearl *lacks the three characters "无事家" (without cause, household); these are from the revelation, as cited above.*

The Most High Laozi told the Yellow Emperor:
*"If one’s body, household, and nation are at peace, recklessly invoking them will bring annihilation to one’s clan. Do not call upon them lightly."*

The **Golden Writ** states:
*"Lightly invoking the Northern Dipper and the Supreme General of the Upper Primordial will bring ruin to one’s body and spirit."*

The Most High Laozi further told **Ānhé Zǐ**—*Note: Ānhé Zǐ was the younger brother of Shénnóng, who studied the Way at Hángshān and encountered the Most High Laozi, who descended to teach him the Upper Clarity Three-Five Flying Steps of Heavenly Restraint and Earthly Measure.*—that one should always retain the essential incantation of the Three-Five, thereby summoning the Three Primordial spirits to descend and instruct in cultivation. By day, one ascends to the **Southern Extreme Fire World** of the heavens, refining gold and stone as the foundation of the earth, and declares:

*"Among the Three Primordials, the Supreme General of the Upper Primordial is the most noble and exalted—like the position of a sovereign emperor in the world. It is greatly capable of helping one attain the Way. When using it, one must not act recklessly. Only on one’s natal day, **Jiazi days**, or **Upper Primordial days**—*Note: Jiazi is the Upper Primordial; one must not act recklessly on Jiazi days outside of these specified occasions.*—should one cultivate and employ it. If suddenly there is an urgent matter in one’s body or household—being plotted against, a grave illness on the verge of death, or bandits—one may call upon it, and it will vanish instantly. This is highly efficacious. Even if not on these days, it will still work.*

The Later Sage-King told the **Celestial Master Dàolíng**:
*"You wish to teach others to escape calamity and enter the path of longevity. Take the **Upper Primordial day**—*Note: From the Jiazi cycle, select the Upper, Middle, or Lower Primordial days.*—of that person’s natal hour, day or night, and beneath the Northern Dipper, burn incense while focusing on one’s original teacher. Upon completion, visualize the Supreme General of the Upper Primordial descending into the **Níhuán Palace**, then entering the left kidney. Next, the Middle Primordial, then the Lower Primordial—*Note: The Middle Primordial enters the right kidney; the Lower Primordial enters the heart.*—first stopping the spirit at the Níhuán, then entering the heart and kidneys to stabilize the five viscera.

Then, twist the incantation, take **Yǔ’s Steps**—four steps, twelve strides—and upon completion, visualize it emerging to envelop the body, like the **Encompassing Diagram**, fully encompassing the Three Primordials and Five Phases, the **Thunder Lord’s Five Thunders**, and the Eight Trigrams, sun, moon, and stars. When complete, recite the **Five Phases Eighteen Incantations** once to seek longevity. Within a year, one will enter the path of immortality. In two years, one will be named **Long-lived**, avoiding soldiers and escaping calamities, attaining spirit efficacy, moving heaven and earth by will, and achieving fulfillment of the heart. All will enter the Níhuán. Later, they will respectively enter the heart and kidneys. After a short while, when the body’s spirit is settled and still, one may summon it forth again, like the Encompassing Diagram. Upon completion, twist the incantation, close the **qi**, and take **Yǔ’s Steps**—twelve strides—to seek life and escape calamity. Within a year, the spiritual efficacy will manifest instantly, greatly aiding the **Heavenly Restraint and Earthly Measure**.

You must not recklessly transmit this to unworthy individuals. This method of the Three Primordials’ five techniques can directly lead one into the Great Way’s gate. Keep it secret for good fortune; reveal it for misfortune.*

The Most High Laozi told the **Three Primordial Deities of Antiquity**:
*"Cultivating the Three Primordials begins with the Upper Primordial’s natal day. Next is the Middle Primordial, then the Lower Primordial, completing the cycle. Within a year of cultivation, one may attain five degrees.* *Note: Within the sixty Jiazi days of the Upper Primordial, there is one natal degree. In the Jiazi days of the Middle Primordial, there are two natal degrees. In the Jiazi days of the Lower Primordial, there are three natal degrees. Following this cycle back to the Upper Primordial, one selects the natal day for practice. Within two years, ten days of cultivation will lead to the path of immortality.*

The Later Sage-King bestowed a **talisman of the Supreme General of the Upper Primordial** upon **Zhāng Dàolíng**, instructing him to swallow it. After swallowing, one should visualize its deployment—nothing will remain unfulfilled. He also commanded that it be passed down secretly among worthy disciples."
