chunks.original_text: 注：仁人，是其志人。 志道之士。 令得真人之道。 后圣君授上元中部将军符一道，与道陵吞。 吞讫，行中部事，并令系代传其志人，令同得真道。 后圣君授上元下部将军符一道，与道陵吞。 吞毕，行下部事，并令传志人，代代相继，同称至真之道。 后圣君授三符，一一吞之，主告命上元三部将军，令佐助受太玄三五正法之人。 修行思存，呼召立到，依口顺心，直使令应心口。 急急如律令。 三符并朱书。 又告善行子： 注：行子是李少君之孙，承祖之福德得道，升西岳洞天中，自称善行子。 因而为名。 卿好道学虽功勤，不得其理，理从三元，而修从五行而入。 子可师道陵。 於是行子入蜀，投受上三部之法，五行之要。 修十四年满，升西灵仙掌洞天。 兹后有数百人，承此三五之法，皆得为真人。 太上老君告人皇曰：王求至道，欲得真性。 真性在於三五三五之力，是为道祖。 如水出泉，得其流源。 如人出穴，得其门户。
chunks.translated_text:
The Later Sage-King instructed those of **virtue/power** (志人): *Note: "Worthy disciples" (志人) are those who share his noble aspirations.* The **adepts of the Dao/Way** (志道之士), saying: "Thus, one may attain the **Way of the True Person** (真人之道)."

The Later Sage-King then bestowed the **talisman of the Supreme General of the Middle Primordial** (上元中部将军符) upon **Zhāng Dàolíng**, commanding him to swallow it. Upon swallowing, one should perform the rites of the Middle Primordial (行中部事), and he was also instructed to pass it down secretly among worthy disciples (志人), so that all may attain the **True Dao** (真道).

Next, the Later Sage-King bestowed the **talisman of the Supreme General of the Lower Primordial** (上元下部将军符) upon **Zhāng Dàolíng**, commanding him to swallow it. After swallowing, one should perform the rites of the Lower Primordial (行下部事), and he was instructed to transmit it to worthy disciples (志人) in succession through the generations, so that all may proclaim the **Way of Supreme Truth** (至真之道).

The Later Sage-King bestowed these three talismans (三符), each to be swallowed in turn, and declared to the **Supreme Generals of the Three Primordials** (命上元三部将军): "Let them aid and assist those who receive the **Three Five Primordial Rectification Laws** (太玄三五正法)." When practicing, one should meditate upon and visualize them—calling them forth, they will manifest according to one’s words and desires, and one’s intentions will be fulfilled. *Swiftly, swiftly, as the command is decreed!* (急急如律令) These three talismans are inscribed in **cinnabar** (朱书).

Again, he instructed **Shànxíngzǐ** (善行子): *Note: "Shànxíngzǐ" is the grandson of Lǐ Shàojūn, who attained the Dao/Way through his ancestral **virtue/power** (福德) and ascended to the **West Peak Cavern of the Primordial** (洞天) in the Western Mountains, where he took the name "Shànxíngzǐ."* Though you are devoted to the Dao/Way and your efforts are diligent, you have not grasped its principles. The principles derive from the **Three Primordials** (三元), yet cultivation begins through the **Five Phases** (五行). You may take **Zhāng Dàolíng** as your teacher.

Thus, **Shànxíngzǐ** entered **Shù** (蜀), seeking to receive the **Three Primordial Laws** (上三部之法) and the **essentials of the Five Phases** (五行之要). After fourteen years of cultivation, he ascended to the **West Peak Cavern of the Spirit-Master’s Palm** (西灵仙掌洞天). Thereafter, there were hundreds of disciples who followed this **Three-Five Law** (三五之法), all attaining the **Way of the True Person** (真人).

The **Supreme Elderly Lord** (太上老君) instructed **Rénhuáng** (人皇): "The king seeks the **Supreme Dao** (至道), desiring to attain the **True Nature** (真性). The **True Nature** lies within the **Three-Five Primordial Power** (三五三五之力), which is the **Dao Ancestor** (道祖). As water emerges from its spring, one attains its flowing source. As a person emerges from their cave, one attains their entrance and abode."

chunks.original_text: 注：上古穴居，故言出穴。 王受之，寿极天地。 注：人皇受之。 果得长生，在位八万九千年。 后全宫室上升太极。 亦留文於世，今传《人皇文》。 老君曰：大道有千门万户，其要甚少。 前叙三五始生引，亦说三元，犹未尽其根本。 今一一具件於卷后。 纲诀咒符存用等，为少言语，径引直入重门见道。 注：此卷说三将军毕，说步纲正诀符存用咒术等，应是上元三部中之事尽说，一一具件题目。 次思上元中部李将军一人，姓李，名拒。 注：低小声呼之，是太一之尊神中将也。 身长七千万丈，领 注：《 金锁流珠》 总不言领字，前圣君受引书上中下皆有领字，多应有此字。 《流珠》出世年月深远，世书写人漏失之故。 必非先无，必有。 今行用依引言得。
chunks.translated_text:
The **Supreme Elderly Lord** further expounds:

*"In ancient times, people dwelled in caves, hence the saying ‘emerging from the cave.’ The king received [the Dao], and his lifespan matched the extremes of Heaven and Earth. **Annotation:** The **Rénhuáng** received it. Indeed, he attained immortality, ruling for eighty-nine thousand years. Later, his entire palace ascended to the **Supreme Ultimate** (太极). chunks.original_text: 五刚 注：据洞天中本作此纲字，前圣君授引此刚字。 后圣君因教松子，言五刚功曹，即是此刚字定也。 风为《流珠》本是《金箓》，前圣后圣犹不赐改易，风未敢便改。 功曹，姓张，名李。 注：一云：季字是也。 身长七百丈。 注：《流珠》本无身长七百丈，此五字前圣引有五字。 百千万重人， 注：按《流珠》说不周细，其事并不显。 若按后圣君告命东海小童君言，上元中部将军一人，姓李，名拒，身长七千万丈，领五刚功曹一人，姓张，名季。 领天兵百十万重人，莫知其数。 此说即是二人，是将军功曹也。 其余百千万重，即兵吏也。 赤帻，右手持戟，腰带消魔之剑， 注：《流珠》云：上部唐将军，腰带龙浓之剑。 中部将军，阙字无名。 太上老君授引消魔之剑名也。 后圣君授东海小童君云：三部将军三人，腰带命魔之剑，是上部也。 消魔之剑，中部也。 按天师言多有失处，盖从古如此，非近代人书失。 在太清之中，上清之下。 注：老君告韩义子是太皇曰：天之孙，太清是太极之号也。 上清是大罗之中，是三清之中之号也。 中天之上。 常降入人泥丸宫右中， 具前言。 少时入右肾之内，镇按事毕，须臾出於右眉上，如含弘。 讫上应天门出来， 注：后圣君告天师曰：卿出上元三部神将，本存从上三清，之下人身泥九中，少时又存入右肾中，镇身藏讫。 即思从肾中上右眉头出，如出天门是也。 此谓从天而降我身，受我之使，使巡天检地，灭凶恶之故，命三官见我身，与天地大道通。 诵之通神我身，则千神万鬼，百灵千邪，万精人龙，畏敬於我。 我则身无为之德，便得长生之道也。 存之如图。 注：含弘图存在右眉头出，出渐渐高长，身亦随之长大，高十二千万丈。 讫即收手，捻三元将军诀，即步上部、中部二部，并步步讫，叩齿三十六通。 即开目，咒曰： 前圣后圣，教臣一云称名长生，飞步三元，九将万营，行御六甲，配衣七星，吞六使七， 注：六，六甲符也。 七，七星也。 凶恶斩形，金木相顺，水火相成，人无干犯，鬼无妖精，若有犯我者，天关灭汝生。 注：即转天关，指之即消灭也。 咒讫，即步上元将军纲三遍。 次即中元，次即下元。 三部各有纲图，一一各三遍。 步纲一遍，步匝皆云摄摄， 注：童言亦三遍。 叱叱。 注：若有凶人恶鬼徒，即云叱叱三遍。 若治凶人，捻恶人刀支。 注：人刀支在右手第五指第三节上右边。 左，主杀。 右，主放。 放摄皆得其理，不可妄行。 行之切须依道。 治恶鬼，捻鬼刀支。 注：鬼刀支在左手五指第三节上边，总是鬼刀支，具一一言其某鬼，即依捻之。 金锁流珠引卷之八竟 金锁流珠引卷之九

「Five [Divine] Generals of Rigidity
**Annotation:** According to the *Tóngtiān Zhōngbù* (《洞天中本》), the term *gāng* (纲) is used, while the *Ancient Sovereign* (前圣君) transmitted the term *jiāng* (将). The *Later Sovereign* (后圣君) instructed the *Sōngzǐ* (松子), naming them the **Five Generals of Rigidity** (五刚功曹), confirming the use of *jiāng* (将).

The *Liúzhū* (《流珠》) originally was the *Jīnluó* (《金箓》). The *Ancient Sovereign* and *Later Sovereign* did not grant permission to alter it, so I dare not change it. The **Functionary of Rigidity** (功曹), surnamed **Zhāng**, named **Lǐ**.
**Annotation:** Another account says his personal name is **Jì** (季).

His stature measures seven hundred *zhang*. **Annotation:** The *Liúzhū* (《流珠》) does not record his stature as seven hundred *zhang*, but the *Ancient Sovereign*’s transmission includes these five characters.

The **Hundred-Thousands-and-Tens-of-Thousands of Troops** (百千万重人), **Annotation:** According to the *Liúzhū* (《流珠》), the account is not detailed, and their affairs are not explicitly revealed. However, if we follow the *Later Sovereign*’s instruction to the *Dōnghǎi Xiǎotóng Jūn* (东海小童君), the **Upper Primordial Law’s** (上元) middle division has one general, surnamed **Lǐ**, named **Jù** (拒), with a stature of seven hundred million *zhang*, who commands one **Functionary of Rigidity** (五刚功曹), surnamed **Zhāng**, named **Jì** (季). The **Hundred-Thousands-and-Tens-of-Thousands of Troops** (百十万重人), their number unknown, are under his command. This refers to two individuals: the general and the functionary. The remaining hundred-thousands-and-tens-of-thousands of troops are the **divine officers and soldiers** (兵吏).

They wear **crimson headgear** (赤帻), and with their **right hand hold a spear** (右手持戟), their **waist sash bears the Sword of Subduing Demons** (腰带消魔之剑).
**Annotation:** The *Liúzhū* (《流珠》) states: The general of the upper division, **Táng Jiāngjūn** (唐将军), wears a waist sash with the **Dragon-Scented Sword** (龙浓之剑). The middle division general lacks a name in the text. The **Sword of Subduing Demons** (消魔之剑) is the name given by the **Supreme Venerable Lord Lǎojūn** (太上老君). The *Later Sovereign* instructed the *Dōnghǎi Xiǎotóng Jūn* (东海小童君) that the three generals of the three divisions wear the **Sword of Commanding Demons** (命魔之剑), which belongs to the upper division. The **Sword of Subduing Demons** (消魔之剑) is for the middle division. According to the Master’s words, there are many omissions, as it has been this way since ancient times—not a recent loss in transmission. They reside within the **Tàiqīng** (太清), beneath the **Shàngqīng** (上清).
**Annotation:** The **Supreme Venerable Lord Lǎojūn** (太上老君) told **Hán Yìzǐ** (韩义子), the **Tàihuáng** (太皇), saying: “The Heavenly Grandson (天之孙), *Tàiqīng* (太清) is the designation of *Tàijī* (太极). *Shàngqīng* (上清) is the designation of *Dàluó* (大罗), within the **Three Purities** (三清).” They are positioned above the **Middle Heaven** (中天).

They often descend into the **right middle chamber of the Mudan Palace** (泥丸宫右中) within a human body, as previously described. In youth, they enter the **right kidney** (右肾) to subdue and control affairs, then shortly emerge at the **right eyebrow** (右眉上), like a contained **Great Expansion** (含弘). When they exit through the **Upper Celestial Gate** (上应天门),
**Annotation:** The *Later Sovereign* instructed the Master: “When you summon the three divine generals from the *Upper Primordial Law* (上元), they originally reside above the **Three Purities** (上三清), descending into the **Nine Chambers of the Human Body** (人身泥九中). In youth, they again enter the **right kidney** (右肾中), subduing and concealing themselves within the body. Then, you think of them ascending from the kidney to the **right eyebrow** (右眉头), emerging as if from the **Celestial Gate** (天门).”

This is said to mean: “From Heaven descending into my body, receiving my command to patrol the heavens and inspect the earth, annihilating malevolent forces, ordering the **Three Officials** (三官) to manifest my form, and aligning with the **Great Dao of Heaven and Earth** (天地大道). When I chant to commune with the divine, then ten-thousands of gods and spirits, hundreds of spirits and thousands of malevolent forces, tens of thousands of **precise essences** (精) and human-shaped dragons (人龙) will revere me. Thus, with the **virtue of non-action** (无为之德), I attain the **Dao of longevity** (长生之道).

Their manifestation follows the diagram. **Annotation:** The diagram of **Great Expansion** (含弘) exists at the **right eyebrow** (右眉头), emerging gradually higher and longer, and the body grows accordingly, reaching a height of twelve hundred million *zhang*.

Upon completion, the hands are withdrawn, and the **Incantation of the Three Primordial Generals** (三元将军诀) is recited. Then, ascending the **upper division** (上部) and **middle division** (中部) of the *Primordial Law*, step by step, the teeth are struck thirty-six times.

The eyes are then opened, and the incantation is recited:
*“Ancient Sovereign and Later Sovereign, teach me—another account says to invoke by name for longevity—
to stride through the Three Primordial [Divisions],
commanding the Nine Generals and Ten-Thousands of Troops,
to govern the Six *Jia* (甲),
align with the Seven Stars,
and swallow the Six Officials and Seven [Entities].
Annotation: Six refers to the Six *Jia* talismans (六甲符). Seven refers to the Seven Stars (七星).
Malevolent forces are beheaded,
Metal and Wood harmonize,
Water and Fire balance,
Humans dare not offend me,
Ghosts dare not conjure malevolent forces.
If any dare offend me,
the **Celestial Barrier** (天关) will extinguish your life.”
Annotation: This refers to invoking the **Celestial Barrier** (天关), pointing to it to bring about annihilation.

The incantation concluded, the **Incantation of the Upper Primordial General’s Diagram** (上元将军纲) is recited three times. Next, the **Middle Primordial Law** (中元), then the **Lower Primordial Law** (下元). Each division has its own diagram and incantation, recited three times each.

For each recitation of the diagram incantation, the steps are accompanied by the words *“sè sè”* (摄摄).
**Annotation:** The youth’s words are also recited three times.
If malevolent humans or ghosts appear, the words *“chì chì”* (叱叱) are recited three times.
**Annotation:** If treating malevolent humans, the **Knife Support of the Malevolent** (恶人刀支) is pinched.
**Annotation:** The **Knife Support of the Malevolent** (人刀支) is located on the right side of the **third node of the fifth finger on the right hand** (右手第五指第三节). Left governs killing; right governs release. Both release and subjugation must be applied with proper reason and not recklessly.

In practice, it must strictly adhere to the Dao.

If treating malevolent ghosts, the **Knife Support of the Ghosts** (鬼刀支) is pinched.
**Annotation:** The **Knife Support of the Ghosts** (鬼刀支) is located on the upper side of the **third node of the fifth finger on the left hand** (左手五指第三节). It is the **Knife Support of the Ghosts** in total. When addressing a specific ghost, the appropriate pinch is applied as described.

The eighth volume of the *Jīnsuǒ Liúzhū* (《金锁流珠》) transmission concludes. The ninth volume begins.

chunks.original_text: 中华总真大仙宰王方平张道陵赵升王长司命李仲甫茅盈许玉斧等系代撰述 中华仙人李淳风注 上元上部将军步纲图 前圣老君授禹， 注：禹受三等禹步，一三步九迹，二十二迹，三二十八迹，今此三五大法通，其禹步不传，世世绝此步。 后圣君再授方诸童君，及尹喜真人王君，及张天师等，因此朱书者，皆后圣君再授也。 右脚蹈地，左转一转，即随事所言。 老君授黄帝，求长生等法诀七条。 一，求长生於世为荣贵法诀，捻司命目，诵五行祝一遍。 金木水火土祝云云。 二，追召天狐法，捻兽目，言请上部功曹，追限某日到。 三，召龙捻龙诀。 四，召天神司命，与上长生，捻司命目。 五，召杀天上妖魅，捻天鬼刀支。 六，欲召请日月星辰神，捻日月星宿诀。 注：左手甲下是也。 七，欲升天，及思自身神上天，欲追天魔妖精龙兽，天狗天豹等祟，祟人合死者。 前思本师，承后出诸部，如含弘兵共寻追斩之，捻都监诀。 后圣君曰：步讫，即捻上元上部将军诀。 注：诀在左手第一指甲下，又在中节二处。 都欲上仙籍，及修行出灾害。 注：如有灾衰恶疾，一一具为辞状言之。 或为人求福德，收祟去灾厄，亦具辞状言之，一切悉能消灭。 老君曰：上元本命日求长生，先从上部将军起，次中部，次下部。 其中元上部同。 注：中部、下部，总同用之得。 上元本命，步上部三遍，捻诀。 讫存上元上部唐将军 注：坎中元上部唐将军，同从上元上部入泥丸宫。 等，入泥丸宫，少时即入臣则玄左肾中。 注：思存如含影图，此名正魂魄也。 行之二年，神仙不死之验，上部事毕。 上元中部将军步纲图 禹受前圣步纲之道，以於中部， 注：中部属人，上部属天，下部属地。 三部之内，中部、下部事多过於上部数条，中人中事，下地中事。 甚精。 或使效功，或收捕有德，驱役人鬼，决水开山，制鬼助人，使龙使虎，分变九迹，成卫万端，积德累仁，飞身太极。 留其中部，教授有心。 注：上部将军步传世，世号之曰大禹步，亦一十五步，典折而行，故稍难於上部。 而下欲有相似，若通者亦不为难。 志道之人，役使蛟龙虎豹，济助世人，兼令得道，乘龙御虎豹也。 左脚踏一转讫，但依心愿言之。 此中部李将军行禁，五行六甲，七星九精五斗，散此禹步，依之如衣，使之如仆，随心顺口。 后圣君告命，祝初起纲，又祝曰： 太一是吾身，吾是天中仙祖。 头为太一府，足为天柱，五藏为六甲，主守天关，驱使北斗。 叱喝一下，千神万灵，俱随口走。 急急如律令。

The **Great True Master of the Central Plain** (中华总真大仙), **Lord of the Netherworld** (宰王) **Fāng Píng**, **Zhāng Dàolíng**, **Zhào Shēng**, **Lord of the Netherworld** (司命) **Wáng Cháng**, **Lǐ Zhòngfǔ**, **Máo Yíng**, **Xǔ Yùfǔ**, and others, are the successive authors of this text.
The **Daoist Sage** (仙人) **Lǐ Chúnfēng** provided the annotations.
The **General Step Diagram of the Upper Primordial** (上元上部将军步纲图) follows.

The **Pre-Eminent Sage** (前圣老君) instructed **Yǔ** (禹) with the **Step Diagram** (步纲).
**Annotation:** **Yǔ** received three grades of **Yǔ’s Step** (禹步): the first, three steps with nine traces; the second, twenty-two traces; the third, twenty-eight traces. Now, this **Great Daoist Method of the Three Five** (三五大法) is universal, and **Yǔ’s Step** is no longer transmitted, forever ceasing in the world.

The **Post-Eminent Sage** (后圣君) then instructed **Fāng Zhūtóng** (方诸童君), **Yǐn Xǐ** (尹喜), **True Person of the Netherworld Lord** (真人王君), and **Zhang Tiānshī** (张天师) and others. Those who recorded in **crimson script** (朱书) were all instructed by the **Post-Eminent Sage**.

With the **right foot stamping the ground** (右脚蹈地) and the **left foot turning once** (左转一转), one proceeds according to the matter at hand.

The **Pre-Eminent Sage** (老君) instructed **Huángdì** (黄帝) with seven **Daoist Secrets for Seeking Longevity** (求长生等法诀):

1. **Secret for Seeking Longevity and Honor** (求长生於世为荣贵法诀): Pinch the **Netherworld Lord’s Eye** (司命目) and recite the **Five Elements Incantation** (五行祝) once.
   The incantation reads: *"Gold, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth, blessings be upon you."*

2. **Secret for Summoning the Celestial Fox** (追召天狐法): Pinch the **Beast’s Eye** (兽目) and say, *"I request the Upper Primordial General* (上部功曹) *to summon and limit [the fox] to arrive by a certain day."*

3. **Secret for Summoning the Dragon** (召龙捻龙诀): Pinch the **Dragon Secret**.

4. **Secret for Summoning the Celestial Netherworld Lord** (召天神司命): To summon the **Netherworld Lord** (司命) and grant longevity, pinch the **Netherworld Lord’s Eye**.

5. **Secret for Summoning and Slaying Celestial Demons** (召杀天上妖魅): Pinch the **Knife Support of the Celestial Ghosts** (天鬼刀支).

6. **Secret for Summoning the Gods of the Sun, Moon, and Stars** (召请日月星辰神): Pinch the **Sun-Moon-Star Host Secret**.
   **Annotation:** This is located beneath the **left hand’s fingernail** (左手甲下).

7. **Secret for Ascending to Heaven** (欲升天): To ascend to heaven, or to think of one’s own spirit ascending to heaven, or to pursue celestial demons, ghosts, dragons, beasts, such as **Heavenly Dogs** (天狗) and **Heavenly Leopards** (天豹), or when the **spirits of the deceased** (祟人合死者) are summoned—before contemplating the original master, and after emerging from all departments, like **Hán Hóngbīng** (含弘兵) in joint pursuit and slaying—one pinches the **General Overseer Secret** (都监诀).

The **Post-Eminent Sage** (后圣君) said: *"After completing the steps, pinch the Upper Primordial General Secret"* (上元上部将军诀).
**Annotation:** The secret is located beneath the **left hand’s first finger’s nail** (左手第一指甲下) and also at two places on the **middle node** (中节).

To seek entry into the **Celestial Register** (仙籍) or to practice the Dao while avoiding calamities:
**Annotation:** If one encounters misfortune, decline, or malevolent illnesses, one must compose a petition in detail.

Or if one seeks **virtue and power** (福德) for another, or to dispel spirits and remove disasters and calamities, one must also compose a petition in detail. All such matters can be resolved.

The **Pre-Eminent Sage** (老君) said: *"The Upper Primordial’s original fate-day is for seeking longevity. Begin with the Upper Primordial General, then proceed to the Middle Primordial, and finally to the Lower Primordial."*

Within the **Upper Primordial**, the steps are the same.
**Annotation:** The **Middle Primordial** and **Lower Primordial** are also used in total, though their applications vary.

For the **Upper Primordial’s original fate-day**, recite the **Upper Primordial steps** three times and pinch the secret. Upon completion, **store the Upper Primordial General** (存上元上部唐将军).
**Annotation:** The **Upper Primordial General** (坎中元上部唐将军) is stored in the **Marrow Palace** (泥丸宫), entering through the **Upper Primordial General** (上元上部).

Afterward, it is directed to the **left kidney’s center** (臣则玄左肾中).
**Annotation:** When contemplating the stored image, as in **Hán Hóngbīng’s Diagram** (含影图), this is called the **True Spirit and Soul** (正魂魄).

After two years, the **verification of immortality** (神仙不死之验) is achieved, and the **Upper Primordial matters are concluded**.

---

The **General Step Diagram of the Middle Primordial** (上元中部将军步纲图) follows.
**Yǔ** (禹) received the **Step Diagram’s Dao** (步纲之道) from the **Pre-Eminent Sage** and applied it to the **Middle Primordial**.
**Annotation:** The **Middle Primordial** pertains to humanity (属人), the **Upper Primordial** to heaven (属天), and the **Lower Primordial** to earth (属地). Within the three departments, the **Middle Primordial** and **Lower Primordial** contain far more techniques than the **Upper Primordial**. The **Middle Primordial** handles human affairs, and the **Lower Primordial** handles earthly affairs. These methods are highly refined.

One may **dispatch tasks** (效功), **collect and bind those of virtue** (收捕有德), **conscript human and ghostly spirits** (驱役人鬼), **part the waters and open mountains** (决水开山), **control ghosts and aid humans** (制鬼助人), **command dragons and tigers** (使龙使虎), **manifest the nine traces** (分变九迹), **establish the myriad protections** (成卫万端), **accumulate virtue and goodness** (积德累仁), and **ascend to the Great Polarity** (飞身太极).

The **Middle Primordial** is retained to teach those with sincere intent.
**Annotation:** The **Upper Primordial General’s Step** (上部将军步) is transmitted in the world, known as the **Great Yǔ’s Step** (大禹步), also consisting of **fifteen steps** (一十五步). Its practice is intricate, hence slightly more difficult than the **Upper Primordial**. The **Lower Primordial** has similar techniques, but if one is proficient, it will not be difficult.

Those who **aspire to the Dao** (志道之人) can **conscript dragons, tigers, and leopards** (役使蛟龙虎豹), **save and assist the world’s people** (济助世人), and **simultaneously enable others to attain the Dao** (兼令得道), **riding dragons and taming tigers and leopards** (乘龙御虎豹).

With the **left foot stamping once** (左脚踏一转讫), one proceeds according to one’s heart’s wish.

This is the **prohibition of the Middle Primordial General** (中部李将军行禁), involving the **Five Elements** (五行), **Six Palaces** (六甲), **Seven Stars** (七星), **Nine Refined Essences** (九精), and **Five Battles** (五斗). When practiced, these steps are as **easy as wearing a garment** (依之如衣), and their power is as **obedient as a servant** (使之如仆), all in accordance with one’s heart and tongue.

The **Post-Eminent Sage** (后圣君) instructed the **Netherworld Lord** (命), and the incantation began with the **initial step** (初起纲), which also included:

*"The **Great Unity** (太一) is my body,
I am the **Celestial Ancestor** (天中仙祖).
My head is the **Great Unity Palace** (太一府),
My feet are the **Celestial Pillars** (天柱).
My five **viscera** (五藏) are the **Six Palaces** (六甲),
Guarding the **Celestial Pass** (天关),
Driving the **Big Dipper** (北斗).
With a single command,
Ten thousand gods and myriad spirits
All follow my words and move.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the **precepts decree** (如律令)."*

If treating malevolent ghosts, the **Knife Support of the Ghosts** (鬼刀支) is pinched.
**Annotation:** The **Knife Support of the Ghosts** (鬼刀支) is located on the upper side of the **third node of the fifth finger on the left hand** (左手五指第三节). It is the **Knife Support of the Ghosts** in total. When addressing a specific ghost, the appropriate pinch is applied as described.

chunks.original_text: 即思将军入心肾中。 老君告黄帝及方诸童君曰：此法一十六条，是中部将军合管使部，行用步纲三遍，毕即捻中部将军诀。 注：诀在左手第一指中节是。 第一法中部虽是上元主人，人是中部，中部自有三将军。 注：亦上中下三元。 此中部将军，能与人求正仙道，可以中元本命日，行此十六条事，总人间用要之法即行，不要但步纲。 一，自身中元本命日，步中部李将军纲，起三遍，正魂镇魄。 祝曰：李将军入臣右肾中，葛将军为副使，令臣则玄长生，人世久视，无畏无惧。 注：便存入右肾中，存之如含影图，肾中坐镇肾也。 祝讫，叩齿十二通，捻中部诀。 注：诀在左手第一指中节。 此法行之一年，便长生久视，百法立验成。 二，自身出灾害厄疾，还取中元本命日，从自身五苦地起，步纲一遍，出王相 注：王相算命，具在上五行引中注。 祝曰：出死入生， 注：夫修行文书及章表，有死字在上行，其生字不合於下书。 忌。 生生无极，得见太平。 君位毕，捻水火土刀支。 金命人捻火刀支，木命人捻金刀支，水命人捻土刀支，火命人捻水刀支，土命人捻木刀支，随命，各自有破五苦八难九厄百病刀支，步纲於三五法中消之。 一年之中，未便消灭，灾厄不克，己身长生。 其五刀支具掌图中。 三，自身坐宅及院不安，即取中元甲子日，步纲绕宅，取三市，或长禹步，不论迹数，以遍为极。 讫三遍，即祝曰： 乾尊耀灵，坤顺内荣。 云云。 在《金锁流珠》上巷中，祝讫便安定。 四，自家宅中男女多病，人口不安。 取中元甲午日、甲申、庚申、壬寅日，於中庭步上中下三部将军纲，各一遍，捻明堂诀， 注：诀在左手第二指第二节捻之。 噀水四方，存出三将军，各领吏兵三千万人，绕宅三匝，出火水狮子蛇兵等，趁除鬼祟妖气，流清荡浊。 讫即书镇宅符，帖门户上。 注：其镇宅符在三部杂符文中。 即祝曰： 符制百鬼，伏灭邪精，玄武息盗，白虎云云。 五，自身被兵围绕，或行兵，心中存作中部禹步一十五迹，次下部十五迹，转天关，指之，存三部 注：上中下三元总都部九将军掣击之，立即走冲破，便出，即捻刀支诀。 诀在左手第五指弟二节右边，是刀支诀急捻之，欲血出即得。 以配五斗衣，五度指之，所指之处破，乃领兵冲之，立见倒过出后，即解刀支，彼人不死。 不解即死。 祝曰： 出死入生，立到天庭。 青龙扶我出，白虎卫我行。 我是天使使天关，冲破汝五兵。 急急急急急急破。 急急如律令。

The **Venerable Master** (老君) instructed the **Yellow Emperor** (黄帝) and the **Young Lords of the Four Directions** (方诸童君), saying:

*"This method consists of sixteen precepts. It is the **Central Department General** (中部将军) who governs and commands the troops. When practicing, recite the **Step Framework** (步纲) three times, then pinch the **Central Department General’s Secret** (中部将军诀).
**Note:** The Secret is found in the middle joint of the left hand’s first finger.

The first precept: Though the Central Department is the **Lord of the Upper Primordial** (上元主人), humans belong to the Central Department, which itself contains **Three Generals**.
**Note:** These correspond to the **Upper, Middle, and Lower Primordials** (上中下三元).

This **Central Department General** can guide a person toward the **True Dao/Way of Immortality** (正仙道). On one’s **Middle Primordial natal day** (中元本命日), perform these sixteen precepts—these are the essential methods for all worldly applications, not merely the Step Framework.

**First Method:**
On one’s **Middle Primordial natal day**, recite the **Central Department Li General Framework** (中部李将军纲) three times to stabilize the **True Spirit** (正魂) and subdue the **Ephemeral Soul** (魄).

Recite:
*"Li General, enter my right kidney,
Ge General serves as your deputy.
May you grant me **Mysterious Longevity** (玄长生),
Long life in this world,
Fearless and without dread."
**Note:** The General is stored in the right kidney, preserved like an **Image Diagram** (含影图), seated and guarding the kidney.

After reciting, strike the teeth twelve times, then pinch the **Central Department Secret** (中部诀).
**Note:** The Secret is in the middle joint of the left hand’s first finger.

Practice this method for one year, and **Mysterious Longevity** and prolonged vision will manifest. All hundred methods will verify its efficacy.

**Second Method:**
When facing **calamity, misfortune, or illness**, return to one’s **Middle Primordial natal day**. Begin from the **Five Torments of the Body** (自身五苦地), recite the Framework once, and exit the **Royal Constellation** (出王相).
**Note:** The Royal Constellation is calculated in the **Five Phases divination** (上五行引中注).

Recite:
*"From death to life,
**Note:** In ritual texts and petitions, if the word *death* (死) appears in the upper line, the word *life* (生) must not align below it—this is taboo.
Endless regeneration,
Attaining the **Great Peace** (太平)."*

After completing the **Five Phases**, pinch the **Water-Fire-Earth Knife Supports** (水火土刀支) according to one’s **natal element**:
- **Metal-natal** (金命) individuals pinch **Fire Knife Support** (火刀支),
- **Wood-natal** (木命) individuals pinch **Metal Knife Support** (金刀支),
- **Water-natal** (水命) individuals pinch **Earth Knife Support** (土刀支),
- **Fire-natal** (火命) individuals pinch **Water Knife Support** (水刀支),
- **Earth-natal** (土命) individuals pinch **Wood Knife Support** (木刀支).

Each natal element has its own **Knife Supports** to break the **Five Torments, Eight Hardships, Nine Calamities, and Hundred Illnesses** (五苦八难九厄百病). Recite the Framework within the **Three-Five Methods** (三五法) to dissipate them. If misfortunes are not eliminated within a year, they will not prevail, and the practitioner will achieve **longevity**.

The **Five Knife Supports** are detailed in the **Palm Diagram** (掌图).

**Third Method:**
If one’s **residence or courtyard is restless**, select a **Middle Primordial day of the Jiazi cycle** (中元甲子日), recite the Framework while circling the dwelling three times, or take **long strides** (长禹步)—the number of steps is irrelevant; completion of the circuit is paramount.

After three circuits, recite:
*"The **Supreme Male** (乾尊) radiates with spirit,
The **Supreme Female** (坤) harmonizes within.
Thus it is." (云云).*

As recorded in *The Golden Lock and Flowing Pearl* (《金锁流珠》), within the **Upper Alley** (上巷), the dwelling will then stabilize.

**Fourth Method:**
If **family members suffer illness** or the household is restless, select a **Middle Primordial day of Jiawu, Jiaxu, Gengshen, or Renyin** (中元甲午日、甲申、庚申、壬寅日). In the courtyard, recite the **Upper, Middle, and Lower Department Generals’ Frameworks** (上中下三部将军纲), one circuit each, then pinch the **Bright Hall Secret** (明堂诀).
**Note:** The Secret is pinched on the second joint of the left hand’s second finger.

Spit **saliva in the four directions**, storing the **Three Generals**—each commanding **three million soldiers**—to encircle the residence three times. Drive out **fire, water, lion, and serpent soldiers**, banishing **ghostly and demonic qi**, purifying the clear and dispelling the turbid.

Afterward, inscribe a **Residence-Suppressing Talisman** (镇宅符) and affix it to the doors.
**Note:** The Residence-Suppressing Talisman is found in the **Miscellaneous Talismans of the Three Departments** (三部杂符文).

Recite:
*"The talisman subjugates a hundred ghosts,
The evil spirits are vanquished and suppressed.
The **Mysterious Tortoise** (玄武) ceases theft,
The **White Tiger**... (白虎云云)."

**Fifth Method:**
If **besieged by armies** or engaged in battle, mentally perform **fifteen strides of the Central Department’s Great Step** (中部禹步一十五迹), followed by **fifteen strides of the Lower Department** (下部十五迹), then **turn the Celestial Pass** (转天关), pointing as you go, while storing the **Three Departments**.
**Note:** The **Upper, Middle, and Lower Primordials** (上中下三元) command the **Nine Generals** (总都部九将军) to strike and disperse the enemy. The practitioner will then **break through and escape**; pinch the **Knife Support Secret** (刀支诀) immediately.
**Note:** The Secret is on the right side of the second joint of the left hand’s fifth finger. Pinch urgently until blood appears.

Use this to align with the **Five Battles Garment** (五斗衣), pointing five times. Where pointed, the enemy will break. Then lead the troops to charge, and the enemy will collapse and retreat. Release the Knife Support immediately—otherwise, they will die.

Recite:
*"From death to life,
Swiftly ascending to the **Celestial Court** (天庭).
The **Azure Dragon** (青龙) supports my escape,
The **White Tiger** (白虎) guards my path.
I am the **Celestial Envoy** (天使) of the **Celestial Pass** (天关),
Breaking through your five armies.
**Swiftly, swiftly break!** (急急急急急急破).
As the precepts decree." (急急如律令)."

Raise the flag, charge with horses, strike the drums, and break through—then depart immediately.

**Sixth Method:** When traveling far and passing through mountains or grasslands, fearing bandits, wild beasts, or venomous creatures—whether malevolent humans or poisonous beasts—seize a treeless spot. Walk the **Three Generals’ *Yubu* Steps** (禹步) in the upper, middle, and lower sections, each three times. Then pinch the throat and eyes of a living person, the **Knife Support**, and the eyes of snakes and tigers. Upon completion, ascend to the **Nine Heavens above**—*i.e.*, the **Alone-Empty Void** (孤虚). Should you encounter malevolent or venomous beings, strike the Void alone; even one woman can defeat nine men without fear. You will never again meet such creatures. If encountered, they will flee in terror and never harm you again.

**Incantation:**
*"Lofty and pure, you wicked one—you die, I return.
I press the Three Elements, sealing water and mountain.
Bandits and beasts flee far—no need for paths between.
The earth’s axis binds you without effort.
If you refuse to leave, bind you swiftly, bind you swiftly, bind you swiftly.
As the precepts decree."*

**Note:** Before setting out, practice the **Heavenly Halter Steps** (天纲) at home. While walking, no bandits or beasts will dare approach you—those that do will die.

---

**Seventh Method:** If a relative or Daoist associate in another prefecture falls ill—or if there is no barrier separating you—*i.e.*, parents, uncles, brothers, cousins, or even non-blood kin like Daoist friends or disciples (but not outsiders without righteous intent)—begin with the **Middle Section**.

**Note:** The **Heavenly Halter** (天纲) is walked in the middle section first, then the Upper and Lower Sections, each three times. The **Celestial Sovereign** then instructs the **Heavenly Master**:
*"You must also tread the **Celestial Pass** (天关) and **Earthly Measure** (地纪), each once—or reverse and return three times. Then summon the **Middle Element’s Tang General** (唐将军), one figure, eighty-one *zhang* tall, with a red headband, a **Heaven-Piercing Crown**, a sword at his side, and a spear in hand, commanding a million troops. He proceeds to the sick person’s home, sets it ablaze to drive away ghosts, thrusts his sword into the door, and roars three to five times. Lions, dragons, and serpents enter the house—above the bed, below the bed, within the walls, before the door, behind the door, left and right—slaying all malevolent, poisonous, or afflicting spirits. Let the sand collapse and tiles shatter; let the deer flee a thousand *li*. Purge and exterminate all evil. When done, the illness will swiftly abate, and the enemy’s forces will be defeated. Report thus."*

**Note:** Compose the ritual words and pinch the **Upper Element Secret**. Next, summon the **Middle Element’s Ge General** (葛将军), seventy-two *zhang* tall, with a red headband, a **Heaven-Piercing Crown**, a sword at his side, and a scepter in hand, commanding thirty million troops to the sick person’s home in such-and-such prefecture, county, village, and household. *Note:* Adjust according to the illness—fearing harm from malevolent ghosts or spirits. Burn the house with fire and water, drive away ghostly bandits, thrust the sword into the door, and roar three to five times, as before.

Next, summon the **Middle Element’s Zhou General** (周将军), ninety-six *zhang* tall, with a red headband, a **Heaven-Piercing Crown**, a sword at his side, a scepter, and a talisman, commanding thirty million troops to the specified location. Proceed as before. Then pinch the **Secret**.

**Note:** The **Secret** is on the first joint of the left hand’s thumb. Pinch urgently, and the three generals’ formation will fly to the sky, obscuring the sun. Upon arrival, they will slaughter poisonous and disease-causing ghosts and bandits. Follow the **Three Elements, Three Generals’ Method** as illustrated in *The Golden Lock, Flowing Pearl* (金锁流珠), using visualization.

---
**Eighth Method:** If you or your six relatives or Daoist associates are slandered, defamed, or plotted against, walk the **Heavenly Halter** and **Earthly Measure** once each. Then disperse your steps outward, leaving fifteen footprints in a wide arc. Walk the **Middle Element’s *Yubu* Steps** three times, then pinch the **Knife Support** of the offending person.

**Note:** Pinch the **Knife Support** briefly—it will not harm the previous target. If pinched for too long, the person will weaken and die within ten or five days. Observe the signs carefully; do not harm others recklessly. Within a month or half, the matter will resolve as before.

chunks.original_text: 注：《金锁流珠》上无领字。 下五刚神功曹一人，姓温，名舒。 注：按《流珠》只言功，不言人字。 言姓温名舒，即合是一人而已。 言百千万重人赤衣，应是兵士，必非功曹也。 按后圣君告天师曰：上元上部将军一人，五刚功曹九人，主事功曹九千人，上元中部将军一人，五刚功曹七人，主事功曹七千人。 上元下部将军一人，五刚功曹五人，主事功曹五千人，兵士各百千万重人。 并莫知其万数也。 按此是后圣君授，即是真数，上元五刚功曹九人定， 上真、中真、下真、上仙，依此数也。 百千万重训多也人，赤衣赤帻。 大将军右手持玉阳之节，腰带龙渊莫耶之剑。 注：按《老君传》云：斩邪之剑。 大罗天之上游检，下入人身心中、右肾中。 存思右眉天门中出。 具用依前上中部将军用也。 后圣君授天师拔宅升天诀云：此三元大将军，上元三部是也。 并天皇代前圣大道君，封补其上仙将军之位也。 注：其《流珠》云：并是三皇向前，太易之代非也。 中元三部，即后圣君置也。 其下部徐将军事修行用法，一一依上部中部修用也。 大约下部主地水心行之事，悉皆起念，便是用法。 一一皆主地水神龙鬼之物也。 后圣君告方诸童君及诸大真言：上元三部将军，步纲以正镇三魂，北斗步纲 注：是飞步天纲。 以定七魄， 注：不论天钢地纪之法，皆同制於七魄之法也。 夫人学仙道，皆须先正三魂，后制七魄，令定是法之具，入仙道之门，功满上升。 禹步之纲，以治万神，万神正定，五藏坚牢，法成身真。 故曰：真人其行，修下部步纲，皆以下元甲子中本名日修行，步三遍 注：三遍一从初起闲两迹上迹步上，至十五迹是也。 即诵地纪十八篇祝一篇，天纲祝十二篇，一遍。 讫即捻都监诀，少时即毕。 别行用，并依前用。 金锁流珠引卷之九竟 金锁流珠引卷之十

---

**Annotations:**
*《金锁流珠》* (Jīn Suǒ Liú Zhū) – *"Golden Lock, Flowing Pearl"* (a Daoist scripture)

---

**Commentary:**
The *Golden Lock, Flowing Pearl* omits the character **领** (*lǐng*, "command").
The **Five Rigid Dao-Functionaries** (*Wǔ Gāng Shén Gōngcáo*)—one person, surname **Wēn**, given name **Shū**.
*Annotation:* According to *Liú Zhū*, only **"Dao-Functionary"** (*Gōng*) is mentioned, omitting **"person"** (*rén*). Thus, **"surname Wēn, given name Shū"** refers to this single individual alone.
The phrase **"hundred thousand million layers of men in red robes"** (*Bǎi Qiān Wàn Chéng Rén Zhī Chìyī*) should be interpreted as soldiers, not Dao-Functionaries.

According to the **Later Sage Emperor’s** (*Hòu Shèngjūn*) instruction to the **Celestial Master** (*Tiānshī*):
- **Upper Elemental General’s Upper Division** (*Shàng Yuán Shàng Bù*)—one general, **Five Rigid Dao-Functionaries** nine in number, **Administrative Dao-Functionaries** nine thousand.
- **Upper Elemental General’s Central Division** (*Shàng Yuán Zhōng Bù*)—one general, **Five Rigid Dao-Functionaries** seven in number, **Administrative Dao-Functionaries** seven thousand.
- **Upper Elemental General’s Lower Division** (*Shàng Yuán Xià Bù*)—one general, **Five Rigid Dao-Functionaries** five in number, **Administrative Dao-Functionaries** five thousand, with soldiers numbering **hundreds of thousands of layers** (*Bǎi Qiān Wàn Chéng*).

None know their exact multitude.
This is the **Later Sage Emperor’s** revelation—**true numbers**—where the **Five Rigid Dao-Functionaries** of the **Upper Elemental** are fixed at nine.
This applies to **Upper True Ones** (*Shàng Zhēn*), **Middle True Ones** (*Zhōng Zhēn*), **Lower True Ones** (*Xià Zhēn*), and **Upper Immortals** (*Shàng Xiān*).

The **"hundred thousand million layers"** refers to multitudes of **red-robed, red-headbanded** (*Chìyī Chìfù*) soldiers.

The **Grand General** holds in his right hand the **Jade Yang Scepter** (*Yù Yáng Zhī Jié*), and at his waist, the **Dragon Spring Mo-Ye Sword** (*Lóng Yuān Mòyé Zhī Jiàn*).
*Annotation:* According to *The Transmission of the Laozi*, it is the **"Sword that Beheads Evil"** (*Zhǎn Xié Zhī Jiàn*).

The **Great Luo Heaven’s** (*Dà Luò Tiān*) **Upper Inspection Ropes** (*Shàng Yóu Jiǎn*) descend into the **human heart-mind** (*rén xīnzhōng*), entering the **right kidney** (*yòu shèn*).
**Cultivation through contemplation** (*Cúnsī*) emerges from the **right eyebrow’s Heavenly Gate** (*Yántmén Zhōng*).
All methods follow those previously established for the **Upper and Central Division Generals**.

The **Later Sage Emperor** instructs the **Celestial Master** on the **Method of Extracting the Residence and Ascending to Heaven** (*Bá Zhái Shēng Tiān Jué*), stating:
These are the **Three Elemental Generals** (*Sān Yuán Dà Jiāngjūn*)—the **three divisions of the Upper Elemental** (*Shàng Yuán Sān Bù*).
They are also the **Celestial Sovereign’s** (*Tiān Huáng*) **decree**, appointed by the **Former Sage Dao-Lord** (*Xiān Shèng Dà Dàojūn*), to fill the **Upper Immortal General’s** (*Shàng Xiān Jiāngjūn*) position.
*Annotation:* *Liú Zhū* states: These are the **Three Sovereigns** (*Sān Huáng*) of antiquity, not the **Taiyi Era** (*Tàiyì Shídài*).

The **Three Divisions of the Middle Elemental** (*Zhōng Yuán Sān Bù*) were established by the **Later Sage Emperor**.
The **Lower Division Xu General’s** (*Xià Bù Xú Jiāngjūn*) methods of cultivation and practice follow those of the **Upper and Central Divisions**.

chunks.original_text: 故以有道心孝顺师父之人，可以口传九名。 如非人，不可妄传。 殃及七祖，非一身也。 第八星名太上真君，一名同玉，二名天枢，三名戢应天蓬。 下应坎宫，正镇冀州，在天为外部，隐形不出，知水官之事。 第九星正是高上玉皇帝。 注：高上玉皇帝者，北斗九官之主也。 非大道太上玉皇帝。 此是天司，纠察七政九宫中，百司君官，司吏万兵，高上玉皇帝，主判万象星官内禁杀伐之事，兼主人物，皆总列属也。 外察生死之时，无不先知，以奏大道太上玉皇帝知，不得有非妄也。 内名□，二名天正，三名摄提，四名益阴。 事内不见人世，人有见者，益寿三百岁。 后圣君告玄洲二十九真人曰：夫欲知其内道者，先诵中斗九名。 注：即今之北斗是也。 时人不识，呼为北斗，是中斗也。 太上老君传教，亦呼为中斗，令求道之人但自知之，不用教授凡愚之人。 即得除死籍，上生名。 心存身着， 注：心存尊帝二星之名，入五藏，长日夜存诵之，在心不休。 身着是一斗二斗成，是着为衣。 一十四载，使入长生。 法诀授二十九真人法曰：但以本命日，及甲子日、庚申日旦一暮， 注：白日午时为上，次巳时，中申时，下夜亥时为上，子时为中，丑时下。 存一斗二斗成法全，至七斗□、□、□、□、□、□、□，数足，各诵咒遍。 讫更诵地纪天纲咒遍，即毕。 得之，一年无灾，二年不死。 三年得地仙，四年入不死，五年功力甚通天地，救济人物，皆得应顺心口，六年神通长生，自在之验力。 不可妄为之，秘之吉，泄之凶。 注：此是太上后圣真言教授，不可妄行之也。 老君曰：夫作一斗二斗成者，各须先捻本诀，然后存履使， 注：使者，存魁斗或时使左肩为□，或为□，心为□，或手为□之使，谓之履使存用。 步成斗，方有神验，可使使也。 乃从一斗，至於七斗，皆本文正诀，捻之而用。 第一□星文，在左手第二指中节上，第二□星文，在左手第二指第一节中。 上节是也。 第三□星文，在左手第三指第一节是。 第四□星文，在左手第三指第二节中是也。 第五□星文，在左手第四指第二节是。 第六□星文，在左手第五指第二节是也。 第七□星文，大在手第五指第一节是也。 老君曰：夫配衣成斗，皆须前知有七星本诀，即可存步之於身，身即通神。 欲使通神，捻此诀，遍七星文，其斗中二尊帝神，三妃二夫人，二娇女大君官，遥以敬贵於子，与子注上生名，下落死籍。 后来至学之士，谨节孝师供道赍金玉宝重之帛，纳师玄房宝座之下，请受此诀后，方始依《流珠》上存用之，乃可进入仙阶，名书玉箓。 北斗之君官，与司命司录，度名青简之书，句落黑簿之历。 此皆道力使摄文诀，使使即得，身心通於天地之神，神力可用也。 若不知此诀，依经存一百年，存用无益一分也。 此法诀得之行用，得知其元，一年便通神使灵，二年去死辟兵，三年仙官矣，一十四年要升即升，要住即住，太平金阙帝晨后圣君，补子为世仙官，必任去住。 此法秘之，切勿传非人。 直是七百年三传，一传只三人。 过此师被大考，师退仙阶，弟子盗行，灭身杀族，切禁。 后圣君告张天师曰：夫欲行纲，履衣北斗，取成一二三四五六七，用济身助国安家，救人急疾，兵疫水火者，先须知识手上文诀，此便是得道之力也。

Only those with a Daoist heart, filial piety, and devotion to their master may orally transmit the Nine Names. If not a worthy person, one must not recklessly spread them. Misuse will bring calamity upon the seven ancestral generations—not just oneself.

The eighth star is named **Tàishàng Zhēnjūn** (Great Supreme True Lord), also called **Tóngyù** (Same as Jade), **Tiāngǔ** (Celestial Pivot), and **Jìyìng Tiānpéng** (Subduing Response, Heavenly Phoenix). It governs the **Kàn Palace** below, steadfastly presiding over **Jìzhōu** (Sufficiency State). In Heaven, it serves as the **Outer Department**, hidden in form and unseen, overseeing the affairs of the Water Official.

The ninth star is **Gāoshàng Yùhuángdì** (Highest Supreme Jade Emperor).
*Annotation:* The Highest Supreme Jade Emperor is the sovereign of the Nine Officials of the Northern Dipper. He is not the **Great Dao Supreme Jade Emperor**. Instead, he is a **Celestial Overseer**, inspecting the Seven Governments and Nine Palaces, along with all ministers and clerks, and the myriad soldiers. The Highest Supreme Jade Emperor judges all matters within the **Ten Thousand Symbols and Star Officials**, prohibiting unjust killings and warfare. He also oversees all beings, commanding their registration and classification. Externally, he foreknows the times of life and death, reporting them to the **Great Dao Supreme Jade Emperor** without error. Internally, he is named **□** (missing), **Tiānzhèng** (Celestial Rectification), **Shètí** (Concealing Submission), and **Yìyīn** (Augmenting Darkness). His affairs remain unseen in the human world, but if a mortal witnesses him, their lifespan extends by three hundred years.

The **Later Sage Emperor** instructed the **Twenty-Nine True Persons of Xuānzhōu**:
*"To know the inner Dao, one must first recite the Nine Names of the Central Dipper."*
*Annotation:* This refers to the Northern Dipper of today. At the time, people did not recognize it, calling it the Northern Dipper, but it is the Central Dipper. The **Supreme Venerable Lord** taught, also calling it the Central Dipper, commanding seekers of the Dao to know it themselves without instructing the ignorant masses. Thus, one may be removed from the **Death Register** and granted a **Heavenly Birth Name**. Keep it in mind and embody it:
*Annotation:* Keep the names of the two august stars in mind, internalizing them into the five viscera, reciting them day and night without ceasing.

The **clothing** is formed by the **One Dipper and Two Dippers**. After fourteen years, one attains longevity. The **method** was transmitted to the Twenty-Nine True Persons:
*"On your natal day, or on days of the **Jiǎzǐ** (Gengshen) cycle—at dawn or dusk—
*Annotation:* The best time is **midday** (upper), followed by **sì hour** (second), **yǒu hour** (mid), and **night hài hour** (upper), **zǐ hour** (middle), and **chǒu hour** (lower).
—recite the **One Dipper and Two Dippers** fully. Then, through the **Seven Dippers** (missing characters), each recitation must be completed. Afterward, recite the **Earthly Records and Heavenly Halter Charms** once more, and the practice is finished. Those who attain this will have no calamities for one year, no death for two years, become an **Earthly Immortal** in three years, enter **Non-Death** in four, and by five years, their power will be thoroughly attuned to Heaven and Earth, enabling them to rescue beings according to their will. By six years, their **spiritual penetration and longevity** will be self-sufficient—this is the verified power. Do not act recklessly; secrecy brings fortune, while disclosure brings misfortune.
*Annotation:* This is the **Supreme Later Sage’s True Speech instruction**; do not act rashly.

The **Supreme Venerable Lord** said:
*"When forming the **One Dipper and Two Dippers**, one must first grasp the original incantation of the seven stars, then internalize and embody them.
*Annotation:* **Embodying** means keeping the Dipper’s leader or, at the proper time, using the **left shoulder as □**, or **□**, the **mind as □**, or the **hand as □**—this is called **embodying and applying**. Only when the Dipper is formed does it have divine efficacy, allowing one to send forth [spiritual agents].

From the **One Dipper** to the **Seven Dippers**, all follow the original, correct incantation, which must be grasped and applied. The **first □ star’s incantation** is on the **second phalanx of the left second finger**. The **second □ star’s incantation** is on the **first phalanx of the left second finger**. The **third □ star’s incantation** is on the **first phalanx of the left third finger**. The **fourth □ star’s incantation** is on the **second phalanx of the left third finger**. The **fifth □ star’s incantation** is on the **second phalanx of the left fourth finger**. The **sixth □ star’s incantation** is on the **second phalanx of the left fifth finger**. The **seventh □ star’s incantation** is on the **first phalanx of the left fifth finger**.

The **Supreme Venerable Lord** said:
*"When forming the Dipper’s clothing, one must first know the seven stars’ original incantations. Only then can one internalize and embody them on the body, thus attaining spiritual communion. To make the Dipper’s power manifest, grasp this incantation, traversing all seven star-forms. Within the Dipper, the two august imperial stars, the three consorts, and the two ladies—along with the two beloved daughters and great officials—must be reverently honored. They register your **Heavenly Birth Name** above and remove you from the **Death Register** below.

Later scholars, if they practice filial piety, reverence for their master, and offer gold, jade, and silk to the **master’s sacred chamber**, may request this incantation beneath the **precious seat**. Only then should they follow the *Liúzhū* [scroll] to internalize and apply it, thus entering the **Immortal Register** and having their names inscribed on the **Jade Ledger**.

The officials of the Northern Dipper, along with the **Record-Keepers and Registrars**, oversee the **Green Tablets of Destiny** and the **Black Registers of Sentences**. These are all achieved through Daoist power, using the **scribed incantations**. Once applied, the body and mind commune with the **Heavenly and Earthly Spirits**, and their spiritual power becomes effective. If one does not know this incantation, even if they follow the scripture for a hundred years, their practice will yield no benefit.

When this method is obtained and applied, one understands its essence. In one year, they will attain spiritual communion; in two years, they will avoid death and warfare; in three years, they will become an **Immortal Official**. In fourteen years, if they wish to ascend, they ascend; if they wish to remain, they remain. The **Emperor of the Golden Summit of Great Peace** and the **Later Sage Emperor** will appoint them as **Worldly Immortal Officials**, commanding their departures and residences. This method must be kept secret—never transmit it to the unworthy. It is passed down only every seven hundred years, with each transmission limited to three persons. Beyond this, the master will face **Great Judgment**, descend from the **Immortal Rank**, and the disciple, if they steal and misuse it, will suffer **self-annihilation and clan destruction**. This is strictly forbidden.

The **Later Sage Emperor** instructed **Zhang the Heavenly Master**:
*"To practice the **Heavenly Halter and Dipper Clothing**, forming the sequence **One, Two, Three, Four, Five, Six, Seven**, and using it to benefit oneself, aid the nation, stabilize the family, and rescue those in urgent distress from **war, epidemics, fire, and water calamities**, one must first know the **hand incantations**. This is the true power of attaining the Dao."*

chunks.original_text: 闻见凶恶之徒来， 注：闻者犹远，可得存一斗二斗，见者立到，不可更存。 斗成，便以捻文急指之，即走避之，得元人之地稍宽，即存斗成，止杀之。 便捻一星、二星之文，直到七星之文，足。 心急配衣，左手存魁魒止之，立住自伏。 且休少时，急去。 后到稍无人宽处，捻诀，存斗成，更止之，凶恶魔难之徒伏心而退，不肯退而死。 此法大验，不可妄行，慎之。 又告王君曰：诀云一斗成收魄，二斗收魂，三斗收神，四斗收身， 注：罪重便信法得也。 五斗饮血， 饮血，是禁诀之别名也。 六斗诛神， 是考责人魂魄别名也。 七斗止身。 注：止之不住斩，大约止是斩之别名。 又云：志人常修行，长存一斗成者定魄，二斗成者炼魂，三斗成者调神， 注：神是炁之精物，形脉之神，因炁而动。 四斗成治病，五斗成去贼坚身，六斗成神灵卫人，七斗成道备通神，行之七年，上为天真。 注：名入天真之位，未得上升之法，一十四年上升天，得云龙凤鹤，笙歌鼓吹，玉童玉女，夫人卫兵，千万俱下迎，或全家拔宅而去。 老君曰：修至道之士，欲使北斗司命，取长生者，法诀在手法经左肘。 注：经是灵书之经，法诀印式之要，符文行用，内秘之诀，是短巷子，锦袋盛，系肘后也。 其行纲步，在经图。 注：纲是天纲，纪是地纪也。 老君曰：修行之者，常存斗不离身，夜思斗在头，盖身如被周遍。 白日思在额之上，小形方寸之斗， 注：白日思在额上悬之，逐建时转，长一寸，已下轮之，於天中之间，印堂之侧，令鬼精见而常畏，降伏毒心也。 不离於额。 祝曰：额悬七星，毒鬼奔惊。 敢有祟害，反视斩形。 急急如律令。 说存使四斗法图 老君曰：四斗图者，是一身之上，存作四斗形也。 以举左手额上，如斗之势，曲仰如图。 掌中仰托□星，左肘□，左肩下胸上为□，心为□，直从左下左脚内阴视为□，左膝为□，左足内踝为□。 右亦如左边算相似，各皆成斗之形。 又倒存，亦如之算。 注：倒数即左足内踝为魁，向上算取七星数足，即此名四斗之法。 依图用无失也。 又左手向上托魁星，下至左足内踝为魒星，为左斗成。 又右手向上托魁星，下至右足内踝为魒星，为右斗成。 此说前面一斗，背后亦存如面前。 左右为斗。 则有四斗成矣。 注：老君法即呼前面为阳斗，背后为阴斗，左右有两斗，故曰四斗成。 此斗能去万灾。 此四斗能消四杀，落灭凶恶灾害，兵甲鬼妖，立能消 消兵甲。 伏。 伏鬼妖之祟也。 经云：七斗消天上灾凶，六曹祟鬼。 四斗消地下灾杀，太岁土官，地狱四司祟鬼。 五斗能消五行，金水木火土之灾害也。 皆存斗而二等，制伏凶恶 凶亚心具上秩注。 五兵，瘟毒蛇虫等兽。 诀在五刀支。 注：五刀支金水木火土刀支，具掌诀中。 说倚配衣存行法图 老君曰：配衣者将斗为衣，如人着衣也。 亦有左右，男子左。 注：男左边先起，女右边先起是。 男子起倚配衣法，先是四斗成图，讫即捻诀， 注：都监诀是也。 少时便存□星，存左肩下胸上， 注：案图在左肩下，胸左边，近项，是名胸胁头，又腋堂是其正名。 名左右胁堂。 □星居心，□星居左足伏鼠，□星居左手腕中，□星居左手掌中， 注：申五指是大掌，当好好乘取。
chunks.translated_text:
When encountering malevolent and wicked individuals approaching,

*Note: When they are still distant (heard but not seen), one may preserve [the power of] one or two *dou*—when they are near (seen), it is too late to preserve any more. Once the* dou *is formed, swiftly pinch the incantation and point at them, then flee to a wider space where an ancient immortal might dwell. There, preserve the* dou *again to halt their killing intent. Then pinch the patterns of one star, two stars, up to seven stars—this suffices.

With urgency, align with the *Clothing of the Dipper*, using the left hand to preserve the *Kui* and *Wei* to subdue [them]. Stand firm and they will submit on their own. Rest for a short while, then depart swiftly. Later, in a wider place with few people, pinch the incantation, preserve the *dou* again, and the malevolent and demonic will retreat in fear, unwilling to leave—if they refuse, they will die. This method is highly effective; do not practice it recklessly—be cautious.

Furthermore, the Sage instructed **Wang Jun**:
*"The incantation states: One* dou *preserves the soul, two* dou *preserve the spirit, three* dou *preserve the essence, four* dou *preserve the body.
*Note: For grave crimes, trust in the method to act accordingly.*
Five* dou *drink blood—
*Note: Drinking blood is another name for the prohibitive incantation.*
Six* dou *execute the spirit—
*Note: This is another name for the judgment of one’s soul and spirit.*
Seven* dou *halt the body.
*Note: If halting does not work, it means beheading—halt is another name for beheading.*

It is also said: Those who constantly practice and refine themselves—preserving one* dou *stabilizes the soul, two* dou *refines the spirit, three* dou *harmonizes the essence,
*Note: Essence is the refined substance of* qi*, the vital force of the form and meridians, moving through* qi*.*
Four* dou *heals illness, five* dou *repels bandits and strengthens the body, six* dou *invokes divine spirits to protect, seven* dou *completes the Dao and attains divine communion. Practicing this for seven years grants the title of *Tian Zhen* [Celestial Purity].
*Note: This means entering the rank of Tian Zhen, though one has not yet attained the method of ascending. After fourteen years, one ascends to heaven, receiving cloud dragons, phoenixes, cranes, music, and dancing. Immortal boys and girls, consorts, and guards—thousands and tens of thousands descend to welcome [them], or the entire family is lifted from their home to depart.*

**Laozi** said: *"Those who cultivate the Dao wish to have the North Dipper govern their lifespan and attain immortality. The incantation and method are found in the *Left Elbow Classic*.
*Note: The Classic is the sacred text of the Daoist scriptures, containing the essential seals and incantation patterns. The talismans are used internally, and the secret method is kept in a short silk pouch tied to the elbow.*

The method of the *Heavenly Halter* is detailed in the Classic diagram.
*Note: The Halter is the Heavenly Halter, the Memoir is the Earthly Memoir.*

**Laozi** said: *"Those who practice must always preserve the Dipper near their body. At night, meditate on the Dipper above the head, as if it envelops the body. By day, visualize it suspended over the forehead—a small, square *dou* of an inch.
*Note: By day, visualize it hanging over the forehead, shifting with each hour. It is one inch long, then cycles downward in the center of the heavens, beside the *Yintang* [third eye], so that malevolent spirits see it and are constantly in awe, subduing their poisonous hearts.*

Recite the invocation:
*'Forehead-suspended Seven Stars—malevolent ghosts flee in terror.
If any dare to harm, they will be beheaded upon turning back.
Swiftly, as the law commands.'*

**Explanation of the Four-Dou Diagram Method**
**Laozi** said: *"The Four-Dou Diagram is the formation of four* dou *across the body. Lift the left hand to the forehead in the shape of a* dou*, curving upward as in the diagram. The palm supports [the star] □, the left elbow [supports] □, the left shoulder to the chest [supports] □, the heart [supports] □, the left inner ankle [seen] from the left inner groin [supports] □, the left knee [supports] □, and the left inner ankle [supports] □. The right side mirrors the left, each forming a* dou *shape.*

Again, reverse the preservation—counting upward from the left inner ankle as *Kui* to the seven stars suffices. This is the method of the Four-Dou.
*Note: Laozi’s method calls the front* dou *the Yang Dipper, the back the Yin Dipper, with two Dipper formations on each side—thus, the Four-Dou. This Dipper dispels ten thousand calamities. The Four-Dou can eliminate the Four Killers, extinguishing malevolent disasters, warfare, ghosts, and demons, instantly dissolving them.
*Note: Dissolving warfare and ghosts means subduing their malevolent influence.*

The Classic states: Seven* dou *dispel celestial calamities and the five departments of malevolent ghosts. Four* dou *dispel earthly disasters and killings, including the Year Pillar, Earthly Officials, and the four departments of hellish ghosts. Five* dou *can dispel the five phases—calamities of metal, water, wood, fire, and earth.

All are preserved in two ranks, subduing malevolent and wicked beings—
*Note: Malevolent beings of the upper ranks.*
Five armies, plagues, poisons, snakes, insects, and beasts. The incantation lies in the Five Knife Supports.
*Note: The Five Knife Supports correspond to the metal, water, wood, fire, and earth phases, all contained within the palm incantation.*

**Explanation of the Dipper-Clothing Alignment Method**
**Laozi** said: *"The Clothing of the Dipper is like wearing the Dipper as garments, with left and right sides—men use the left.
*Note: Men begin with the left side, women with the right.*

For men practicing the Dipper-Clothing Alignment, first form the Four-Dou Diagram, then pinch the incantation,
*Note: The General Supervisory Incantation.*
After a short while, preserve [the star] □ on the left shoulder to the chest,
*Note: Referring to the diagram, the left shoulder to the chest, near the nape, is called the chest-below-head, or more accurately, the axillary chamber. This is named the left and right axillary chambers.*
□ resides in the heart, □ in the left foot’s *Fusu* [hidden mouse point], □ in the left wrist, □ in the left palm.
*Note: The five fingers of the hand are the great palm—grasp them firmly and apply accordingly."*

chunks.original_text: □星居左足膝上，□星居左足内踝右边。 女思之并同，左边思存呼用也。 此法男女常行之，以辟凶殃灾祸。 修行人要若欲收凶恶，先用倚配衣也。 又修行人入山林深谷之中，恐蛇虎者，先存之为上。 后圣君曰：此法从三元将军存使，至七斗。 七斗至四斗。 四斗至倚配衣，倚配衣至立配衣，立配衣 注：此法同倚配衣也。 倚配衣，面南立，即男回面向东，女向西是也。 图中有名而无画，应是同，故不着。 本《流珠》中无也。 至眠配衣，眠配衣至坐配衣。 坐了，即存使击，捻凶恶刀支诀，而自消。 后圣君再勑天师，此法不得妄传，妄传则招祸咎，秘之，真人也。 老君授此法，与黄帝伐蚩尤，与禹治水，与周伐纣，乃以伐恶救民，令民为善也。 老君常念其善恶不分，故令人君人臣，伐恶取善，以安万姓，令行天道，济助国土，及得身安，修生有益。 注：史书记历代相承，皆是天命。 天使神人，下授兵法，即此驱役。 引书云：代代皆是老君下应号而出，人口知其姓名有改易，不知身是一也，而应时改姓名也。 说立配衣存行法图 老君曰：立配衣者，立即成也。 案上古真人行用此书此图，兼掌诀受本师付受口诀，修行精熟，立思立念，便是立成，俱使应心顺口，无不得者。 说眠配衣存法图 老君告西山胡王达利曰：我得天法，教吾眠斗，召兵百千亿万，而下围吾师，而来摄汝，过度灾厄，不被彼害，吾师摄食。 吾师畏我天兵，合当救得。 汝胡王怕急，唯投老君。 老君一念，卧斗少间，百千亿万，而下围吾师兵马。 吾师知老君意，退而散去。 吾师 注：吾师是老君弟子，故假变化形，佐助化胡，乃飞身从天下。 领天兵欲伐杀胡王兵众。 胡王畏急，乃投老君为计，急求生路，奴仆敢辞。 老君即申脚着床，卧存四斗救之。 因此胡人大王伏而乞教道，舍位从道，以因眠斗之法。 骂胡王曰：我之大众，有百万人，皆欲食汝眷属为饱。 今有上天大真仙尊，与汝思眠斗之法，以隔我天兵。 我以未能便食汝，后日当下来食汝众。 言讫，当领神兵而去天上。 於是胡王以头首叩地，以石自搏，乞大真仙尊教我王众等，作思眠斗之法。 於是老君遂作诫二百五十条，诚胡王。 王依诫不违，其吾师便不下。 经数月日，胡王告徒众，此老道人甚有眠斗之法，能断绝得吾师不下，吾徒众故当合学。 於是胡王领徒众，礼老君三拜，长跪前问，请我徒众非道士所护，皆被天魔吾师杀食。 我今叩头请受，取此法以御此魔怪鬼贼，侵食我等。 是时老君受与眠斗之法，胡王精思不退，更请进受道法，后便得正成佛法，皆因卧斗之法，而获阴仙。 注：阴仙是佛也。 卧斗法 右以左手盖头把□，□居左肘，□居左胸， 胸左边是也。 □居心，□居脐，右手案脐， 注：脐不合受星之炁，故将右手以覆脐上。 存星居手背之上，如法每夜卧皆如之，长存之长生不死也。 □居左膝，□居左足内踝。 左右同思存。 又右同用。 用以左手□同，存用右肩为□，□同在胸，□在心，以次同用。 又外盖身者，左即从足魁星，建向头。 次排□、□、□、□、□、□、□，七□之头也。 右即从头魁星，建至足。 注：同前也。 说坐配衣存法图 老君曰：坐配衣者，以斗星左右算存用也。
chunks.translated_text:
「□ star resides above the left knee, □ star resides to the right of the left ankle’s inner malleolus.
Women’s practice mirrors this, storing and invoking with the left side first.

This method is to be practiced by both men and women constantly, to avert calamity, disaster, and misfortune.
Those cultivating must first employ the Dipper-Clothing Alignment if they wish to repel malevolence.
Furthermore, cultivators entering deep mountains or valleys, fearing snakes and tigers, should first store [the stars] as a priority.

The Later Sage Emperor declared: This method originates from the Three Element Generals’ stored deployment, extending to the Seven Dou.
From Seven Dou to Four Dou.
From Four Dou to Dipper-Clothing Alignment, from Dipper-Clothing Alignment to Standing-Clothing Alignment—
*Note: This method is identical to Dipper-Clothing Alignment.*
Standing-Clothing Alignment: face south while standing; men turn to face east, women to face west.
The diagram names but does not depict [the stars], so it is omitted accordingly. This is absent in *The Flowing Pearl* [text].

Proceeding to Sleep-Clothing Alignment, then to Sitting-Clothing Alignment.
Once seated, store and deploy the incantation to strike away malevolent blades, and they will self-dissolve.
The Later Sage Emperor again admonished the Celestial Master: This method must not be recklessly transmitted, for reckless transmission invites misfortune and blame. Keep it secret—this is the way of the True Person.

Laozi imparted this method to aid Yellow Emperor in subduing Chi You, to help Yu control the floods, and to assist the Zhou in overthrowing Jie—all to vanquish evil and save the people, guiding them toward goodness.
Laozi often pondered the undiscriminating mix of good and evil, thus commanding rulers and subjects to subdue evil and embrace goodness, to pacify the common folk, to uphold the Dao of Heaven, and to aid the nation’s prosperity, ensuring personal safety and benefiting longevity.
*Note: Historical records show that successive generations inherited this as Heaven’s mandate. Heavenly messengers and divine men descended to impart martial arts, which were then deployed accordingly.*
Scripture states: Each generation’s figures were Laozi’s incarnations, though their names changed with the times, unknown to the populace as the same being adapting names to the era.

**Explanation of the Standing-Clothing Alignment Storage Method Diagram**
Laozi said: Standing-Clothing Alignment is to stand and immediately complete [the alignment].
Ancient True Persons practiced this text and diagram, mastering the incantations passed orally by their teachers. With refined cultivation, standing and thinking, speaking in unison with the heart—nothing is unattained.

**Explanation of the Sleep-Clothing Alignment Storage Method Diagram**
Laozi instructed the Western Mountain Hu King, Da Li: *"I have obtained Heaven’s method, teaching me to sleep in the Dipper [formation], summoning countless armies to encircle my teacher below, yet I endured their calamities unharmed while my teacher was seized for sustenance.
My teacher feared my Heavenly troops, so I saved him.
The Hu King, desperate, sought Laozi.
With a single thought, I lay in the Dipper formation for a short while, and countless armies encircled my teacher’s forces.
My teacher, sensing my intent, retreated and dispersed.
My teacher—
*Note: My teacher refers to Laozi’s disciple, who assumed a transformed guise to assist in subjugating the Hu, then descended from Heaven.*
—led Heaven’s armies to slaughter the Hu King’s forces.
The Hu King, terrified, turned to Laozi for salvation, seeking life with no hesitation.
Laozi immediately stretched out his feet on the bed, lying in the Four Dou formation to rescue him.
Thus, the Hu King’s great sovereign prostrated himself, begging for Daoist instruction, abandoning his throne to follow the Way, adopting the Sleep-Dipper method.
Laozi cursed the Hu King: ‘My multitude—hundreds of thousands—all wish to devour your kin to satiate themselves.
Now, a lofty Celestial True Immortal exists, teaching you the Sleep-Dipper method to repel my Heavenly troops.
Because I cannot yet consume you, I will return later to devour your people.’
Having spoken, he led his divine armies back to Heaven.
The Hu King then struck his head against the ground, beating himself with stones, beseeching the Celestial True Immortal to teach his subjects the Sleep-Dipper method.
Thus, Laozi composed *Two Hundred and Fifty Precepts*, instructing the Hu King.
The King adhered without deviation, and my teacher did not descend again.
After several months, the Hu King announced to his followers: ‘This old Daoist possesses the Sleep-Dipper method, capable of severing my teacher’s descent. My people must learn it together.’
Thus, the Hu King led his followers in three prostrations before Laozi, kneeling to ask: ‘My subjects, unprotected by Daoists, are all slain and devoured by the Heavenly Demon, my teacher.
I now kneel to receive this method to repel these malevolent spirits and ghosts who prey on us.’
At this, Laozi imparted the Sleep-Dipper method. The Hu King cultivated it with unwavering focus, further requesting advanced Daoist teachings, eventually attaining true Buddhahood—all through the Sleep-Dipper method, gaining the Obscure Immortal [status].
*Note: Obscure Immortal refers to Buddhahood.*

**Sleep-Dipper Method**
With the right hand, cover the head and grasp □.
□ resides at the left elbow, □ at the left chest—
the left side of the chest, specifically.
□ resides in the heart, □ in the navel, with the right hand pressed over the navel.

The method of wearing the true hidden names has its own prescribed rites, found in the *Jīnsuǒ Liúzhū* ["Golden Lock, Flowing Pearl"] section.

The celestial beings will proclaim one’s merits and vouch for one’s name, earning the reverence of the Highest Immortals—these are the true hidden names and true names.

In ancient times, the Yellow Emperor obtained the teachings of Guangchéng Jun, who instructed him to wear these nine earthly true hidden names. Wherever he passed, spirits and numinous beings would appear, bowing and escorting him, daring not to cause harm, and instead submitting to his command.

Wearing them on his person, Gāoqīu Zi abstained from meat for one hundred days, then began to travel with them.

One day, as he reached Xiányáng and the sun was setting, he suddenly saw forty-nine men in crimson robes and black caps coming to greet him. Gāoqīu Zi asked why, and they replied: "Because you bear upon your person the true speech, hidden name, true name, surname, and lineage of [a certain] ancestor, we are compelled to serve you. chunks.original_text: 后帝常行蹑纪，得升云天。 又说西山赵芮，向上七代，佩天地之讳及名，皆代代能驱使鬼神，救人疾病，累代着功，前后得道者计三十余人，得长生，或尸解之道，或洞府之仙，唯赵升为天仙，白日拔宅，俱随身举。 至孙芮甚能炁禁，非法杀害鬼神太多，所被谪仙，令为考召书吏。 注：今之典名。 二千年后，方得大仙。 注：按《九州地纪》云：西山古荆州地分，即今西山，名洪州是也。 拔宅上升天宫 太上老君曰：吾受元始真言正法，太上道君为保举，制伏天魔地灵，方始得身白日上升。 唯一身而上游，谒诸天，朝拜太上道君，后方得朝元始天尊，而不得拔宅上升。 今余以志心精思，撰述众法经文秘诀，及诸天隐文真言等，得太上金箓之要，众文中撰出，拔宅全家，男女得道，鸡犬一时俱升云天。 从此之后，始出拔宅。 注：向前无拔宅流行，时人不知，将作药成服，得升云天，俱家拔宅，鸡犬俱得同行。 拔宅上升，始於太上老君也。 注：向前无拔宅流行，今时得者，往往有之，皆是行此法，计数十家也，见在上天。 李王张许彭韩等数家，俱以拔宅也。 李是后圣君，於西域竺乾国，化胡王成佛。 后拔广慈道场，宅院一百余间屋俱升，今紫微上宫，后圣君旧宅是也。 后圣更添奴婢鸡犬，赐与俱升， 注：案此是后圣大慈大悲，恩流赐言功，功大积着多者，便许及妻子子弟子奴婢鸡犬，同得俱升。 拔宅正法。 老君告五帝 注：五帝是五方大帝君也。 前圣上清，言素奏丹符，后圣君告真文中五帝亦是。 若据前后圣人所说，及天尊说经中言五帝，是一等五大帝，别无五帝位也。 自有真名姓，於真文及老君秘符。 叙上云：是儒书所云五帝配位，非正五帝之位也。 曰：卿欲全家拔宅，上升天仙，为五方帝之位者。 先须变五星，出五行，竖五藏，超五灵，可以力摄五精，驱役万兵，妻子俱仙，奴婢宫阙居舍，拔宅上升天庭，位号一方之帝，统领群灵日月星， 注：日出皆照四方中央，五帝之界，皆有日月星，三光俱照，皆是五帝随方统领者，亦随方属於五帝。 天地水三官。 有魂魄，有形， 注：有魂魄，有形曰精。 有炁无炁，有声无声，皆属五帝之功，生成含育之道。 是卿所行 行令也。
chunks.translated_text:
「Thus, the Later Emperor [常行蹑纪] often practiced the secret steps of the Dao, attaining ascension to the Cloud Celestial [天]. He further spoke of the Western Mountain’s Zhao Rui [赵芮], who for seven generations carried the hidden names of Heaven and Earth [天地之讳] and their sacred names [名], each lineage thus empowered to command ghosts and spirits [驱使鬼神], heal maladies [救人疾病], and accumulate merit [累代着功]. In total, over thirty individuals attained the Dao [得道者计三十余人], achieving longevity [得长生], or the methods of corpse dissolution [尸解之道], or the immortals dwelling in cave palaces [洞府之仙]. Only Zhao Rui’s seventh-generation descendant [赵升] ascended as a Celestial Immortal [天仙], rising in broad daylight [白日] with his entire household [拔宅], all lifted together [俱随身举].

When it came to Sun Rui [孙芮], he was skilled in restraining *qi* [炁禁], but his excessive unlawful slaughter of ghosts and spirits [非法杀害鬼神太多] incurred the wrath of the condemned immortals [被谪仙], who decreed him to serve as a scribe in the Bureau of Examinations [考召书吏]. *注：today’s bureaucratic officials.*

Two thousand years later, he would finally attain the rank of Great Immortal [大仙]. *注：According to the *Nine Provinces Geographical Record* [九州地纪], the Western Mountain was once part of the ancient Jingzhou [古荆州], which is today’s Western Mountain, known as Hongzhou [洪州].*

**Ascension by Household Removal [拔宅] to the Celestial Palace [上升天宫]**
The Most High Venerable Lord [太上老君] declared: *"I received the primordial Dao’s true speech [元始真言] and orthodox teachings [正法], and the Most High Dao Lord [太上道君] vouched for my ascension. Through my mastery of subduing Heavenly Demons [天魔] and Earthly Spirits [地灵], I was able to achieve my body’s transformation and rise in daylight [白日上升]. Only by ascending alone [唯一身而上游] could I pay homage to the Celestial Lords [谒诸天] and worship the Most High Dao Lord [朝拜太上道君]. Afterward, I was permitted to worship the Primordial Heavenly Venerable One [元始天尊], yet I still could not attain ascension by household removal [不得拔宅上升]."*

Now, I have, with unwavering resolve [志心] and focused meditation [精思], compiled the sacred texts and secret keys [秘诀] of various Daoist teachings [众法经文], as well as the hidden scriptures and true speech of the Celestial Lords [诸天隐文真言]. Through this, I have grasped the essence of the Most High’s Golden Talisman [太上金箓之要], extracted from the myriad scriptures [众文中撰出], and achieved ascension by household removal [拔宅], whereby my entire family—men, women, and all—attained the Dao [得道], and even chickens and dogs ascended together [鸡犬一时俱升] to the Cloud Celestial [云天]. From that point onward, I began to manifest ascension by household removal.

*注：Before this, there were no recorded instances of ascension by household removal. Those who prepared and ingested the elixir [将作药成服] would rise to the Cloud Celestial, their entire household lifted, even chickens and dogs attaining the same fate.*

The practice of ascension by household removal [拔宅上升] originated with the Most High Venerable Lord [太上老君]. *注：Before this, there were no recorded instances of ascension by household removal. Those who now attain it [今时得者] are quite common [往往有之], all practicing this method, numbering tens of households [计数十家], already present in the Celestial Courts [见在上天].*

Families such as Li, Wang, Zhang, Xu, Peng, and Han [李王张许彭韩等数家] all ascended by household removal [俱以拔宅]. Li was the Later Sage Lord [后圣君], who in the Western Domain of Zhuqian [竺乾] country transformed the King of Hu into a Buddha [化胡王成佛]. Later, he established the Broad Benevolence Daoist Hall [拔广慈道场], where over a hundred rooms of his residence ascended together [宅院一百余间屋俱升]. Today, it is the Purple Micro Celestial Palace [紫微上宫], the former residence of the Later Sage Lord [后圣君旧宅].

The Later Sage Lord further bestowed upon his servants, chickens, and dogs [更添奴婢鸡犬], granting them ascension as well. *注：This is the Later Sage Lord’s vast compassion and profound mercy [大慈大悲]. His blessings extend to those who have accumulated great merit and achieved profound attainments [恩流赐言功，功大积着多者]. Thus, he permits even their wives, children, disciples, servants, chickens, and dogs [及妻子子弟子奴婢鸡犬] to ascend together [同得俱升].*

The orthodox method of ascension by household removal [拔宅正法] was revealed to the Five Emperors [告五帝]. *注：The Five Emperors [五帝] are the Five Great Celestial Lords of the directions [五方大帝君]. The Former Sage of the Upper Clarity [前圣上清] spoke of offering white jade talismans [素奏丹符], and the Later Sage Lord also revealed the true scriptures to the Five Emperors [真文中五帝亦是].*

If we follow the accounts given by the Former and Later Sage Lords [前后圣人所说], as well as the Celestial Venerable One’s teachings in the scriptures [天尊说经中言五帝], the Five Emperors are the five supreme Celestial Lords [一等五大帝], with no other ranks of Five Emperors [别无五帝位].

Since possessing true names and lineages [有真名姓], in the true scriptures [真文] and the Venerable Lord’s secret talismans [老君秘符], it is said:

*"You wish to ascend your entire household [全家拔宅] and become a Celestial Immortal [上升天仙], attaining the rank of one of the Five Emperors of the directions [为五方帝之位者]. First, you must transform the Five Stars [变五星], manifest the Five Phases [出五行], erect the Five Viscera [竖五藏], transcend the Five Spirits [超五灵], and then you can harness the Five Essences [力摄五精] and command the ten thousand soldiers [驱役万兵]. Your wives and children will become immortals [妻子俱仙], and your servants and livestock will dwell in palaces and courtyards [奴婢宫阙居舍]. Ascending by household removal [拔宅上升] to the Celestial Courts [天庭], you will be titled as one of the Five Emperors of the directions [位号一方之帝], and lead all spirits under the sun, moon, and stars [统领群灵日月星].*
*注：The sun rises and illuminates all directions and the central realm [日出皆照四方中央]. The Five Emperors’ domains [五帝之界] each have their own sun, moon, and stars [皆有日月星], with the three luminaries [三光] shining upon them. All are under the Five Emperors’ directional governance [俱照，皆是五帝随方统领者], and also belong to the Five Emperors by direction [亦随方属於五帝].*

*The Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water [天地水三官], possess both soul and form [有魂魄，有形],*
*注：Those with soul and form [有魂魄，有形] are called *jing* [精].*

*and those with *qi* and without *qi*, with sound and without sound [有炁无炁，有声无声], all belong to the Five Emperors’ domain [皆属五帝之功], manifesting the Dao of nurturing and containing [生成含育之道].*
*This is the method you must practice [是卿所行]—the commandment [行令]."*

The **Dharma Key** [法诀]. The **Laozi** [老君] bestowed this key upon the Five Emperors [五帝], as well as the Three Sovereigns [三皇] and ten thousand **Daoist Immortals** [万仙人],*
*注：The **Laozi** was born before Heaven and Earth [老君先天地生], initially manifesting as the **Dao Master** [始生为道主], and through successive generations, the teachings were transmitted without interruption [代代传教不绝]. —on the method of **ascending the body and extracting the dwelling** [举身拔宅之法], cultivating the **Way of soaring through the heavens** [修行飞蹑].*
*注：The **Way of soaring through the heavens** [飞天纲] and the **Way of treading upon the earth** [蹑地纪].*

In fourteen years, when the **virtue/power** [功] is complete [欲功满], one should begin on the **Spring Day of the Heavenly Stem-Earthly Branch (甲子)** [取春甲子日起], invoking the **Six Ten Kings** [甲子王文卿等六十人], the **Decan Commanders** [旬将], along with the **Twelve Divine Generals** [神将一十二人], the **Sixty Jade Maidens of the Six Heavenly Stems** [六甲玉女六十人], the **Sixty Jade Maidens of the Six Earthly Branches** [六丁玉女六十人], and the **Nine Hundred and More Attendant Officials** [从官九百余人],*

Then, **one attains it** [即　得], **but it must not be spoken of** [亦不得言之].

chunks.original_text: 及从南方起，终於四维四正四定等言之，以传志道之士，非人勿传。 同升天庭。 急急如律令。 又北方壬癸亥子丑支干五神将，领吏兵二十五万人众，以禁步拔此宅，北方则玄宅外界，入地十丈和土拔，上令得上，随身及家口妻妾男女等， 注：上古亦无妻妾男女字，唯见后圣授天师拔宅法勑将吏，有妻妾及男女字，入在勑宅北方勑文中。 言妻妾三人。 及女四人，并儿一人。 所峡具於拔宅北方勑中。 以传志　人，明知学道功多，妻妾同升上天宫　仙真之位。 奴婢鸡犬，同升天庭。 急急如律令。 又四维 注：寅申巳亥，是四维神也。 又一云：是四孟神也。 又四正 注：子午卯酉，是四正之名也。 又四定 注：辰戌丑未，是四定也。 又一。 云：四季是地上名四定，以主人心也。 一定东南，二定西北，三定东北，四定西南，故称四定。 经云：一定之处，必有大灾，配以属土，故以土星所临之处，皆有大灾。 后圣君知，故制拔宅神通法，立名四定定之。 却祸除灾，灾不敢州犯。 大道神通，正定之力，大拔宅。 三四一十二神之力，共拔宅上升云天，金阙帝晨后圣上道君七宝玄台玉京上宫，罗天大城之内，空闲宝地之上，十亩之内，居宅得住宅，佐转后圣之宫，身得为小臣之数，长生久视，得事后圣乞如所愿，勑勒拔此住宅急急如律令。 又戊己六戊将军六人，六己将军六人，兵士各一十二万人，随臣则玄步禁，拔宅上升，天仙同心併力，与四方一十二神将兽士兵马等，俱拔宅结界，与人俱升天庭，金阙玉京之内。 急急如律令。 读诵。
chunks.translated_text:
And from the South, beginning and concluding with the Four Directions, Four Cardinal Points, and Four Fixations—this is transmitted only to those who uphold the Dao/Way, not to the common folk. Together, ascend to the Celestial Court. **Swiftly, as the decree commands.**

Again, the Northern Five Deities of *Geng-Xin-Shen-You-Xu* and *Ren-Gui-Hai-Zi-Chou* branches, commanding twenty-five ten-thousand officers and soldiers, to forbid trespass and uproot this dwelling. The North marks the *Mysterious Dwelling’s* outer boundary, penetrating ten *zhang* into the earth, blending with the soil to uproot. May the decree ascend—along with the household’s great and small, wives and concubines, male and female alike.
**Note:** The ancient texts also omit the terms "wives and concubines, male and female," but in *The Later Sage-King’s Transmission to the Heavenly Master on Dwelling-Uprooting*, the decree to officers and soldiers explicitly includes "wives and concubines" and "male and female." Within the Northern invocation, it specifies three wives, four concubines, and one child. All are detailed in the Northern Dwelling-Uprooting Decree. This is transmitted to those who uphold the Dao/Way, for they know that through great merit in cultivation, wives and concubines may ascend together to the Celestial Palaces of the Immortals. Slaves, maidservants, fowl, and canines ascend to the Celestial Court. **Swiftly, as the decree commands.**

Again, the Four Directions—
**Note:** *Yin, Shen, Wei, Hai* are the Four Directional Deities.
Also called the Four Seasonal Deities.
And the Four Cardinal Points—
**Note:** *Zi, Wu, Mao, You* are the names of the Four Cardinal Points.
And the Four Fixations—
**Note:** *Chen, Xiu, Chou, Wei* are the Four Fixations.
Also, it is said: The Four Seasons are the earthly names for the Four Fixations, aligned with the master’s intent. The first Fixation is Southeast, the second Northwest, the third Northeast, the fourth Southwest—hence the name Four Fixations. The scripture states: Where the Fixation is set, great calamity shall arise. Aligned with the earthly branch, thus where Saturn’s influence lingers, great calamity shall befall. The Later Sage-King knew this, so he established the Dwelling-Uprooting Divine Method, naming it the Four Fixations, to repel misfortune and avert disaster. No calamity dares to encroach. The great Dao’s divine power, the rectified Fixation’s force, uproots the dwelling. The combined power of the twelve gods of the third and fourth ranks lifts the dwelling to ascend to the clouds, to the Seven-Treasured Mysterious Platform of the Golden Gate, the Jade Capital’s Upper Palace within the Luohean Great City, upon the vacant sacred land within ten *mu*, where the dwelling may reside. As a minister aiding the Later Sage-King’s Palace, one attains the rank of lesser official, eternal life and longevity, and may serve the Later Sage-King as desired. The decree commands the uprooting of this dwelling—**swiftly, as the decree commands.**

Again, the six *Wu-Ji* Generals and six *Liu-Ji* Generals, each commanding twelve ten-thousand soldiers, with the *Xuanbu* officers forbidding trespass, uprooting the dwelling to ascend. The Heavenly Immortals unite in heart and strength, alongside the twelve gods of the Four Directions, their beasts, soldiers, horses, and all—together forming the dwelling’s boundary, ascending to the Celestial Court within the Golden Gate and Jade Capital. **Swiftly, as the decree commands.** Recite and chant.
