chunks.original_text: 注：故土行顺吉，亦顺凶。 是故云吉王顺吉凶，或顺凶。 我此之教，虽喻阴阳始生而作，回出阴阳炁，去吉凶之道，履斗步星，登上仙阙。 后圣君告尹喜真人曰：太上虚皇，传此五行符於火者。 火属夏热，能育成万物，又能火炼去尘灾， 注：金银炼去尘之染以出光，火炼去灾厄以出疾，是以火炼百功，故书火行。 所传於火行也。 太上道君告老君曰：卿何命人也。 老君对曰：臣木命人也。 道君曰：吾火命人也。 与卿俱已出於水火，已无忧 注：此二上真尊以身出於五行，身无败坏之期，故言者。 所以忧下真上仙，难离於水火，身虽有延驻，不过千岁，水火轮回，衰苦相临，自当败坏，所生所杀，非道不救。 故以师弟二尊，论於水火。 后圣君告天师曰：吾闻至真二大天尊，论於水火，何也。 缘其五行之中，水火相刑，甚多病疾败力，崩坏天地。 何况人身，有不败坏之身难。 且其火星精荧惑之星，顿散於阳炁，为火败毒。 大风吹水，水之精辰星，顿散炁阴，为雷雨二物，并行相攻相伐，故为天病。 受此狂风暴两，天被之崩石落星，地被之折树崩山，人被之败藏亡身。 为此能病三才，所以上真高尊论意，欲得下真上仙之人，受听此言，以受法於内心。 心须不受水火之灾败，兼身心令以得度，以得度出五行之路，求三清之心。 水火之性，自然无忧，不被水火之灾厄。 是故前圣三尊，将水火之喻，以诫下真上仙。 令得度水火之灾，入无为之性，自然成真，道身坚体，净天地也。 於身， 具前注。
chunks.translated_text:
「**Note:** Thus, Earth follows auspiciousness, yet also follows inauspiciousness.
Hence it is said that the Sage-King follows both auspicious and inauspicious patterns—or follows inauspiciousness.

My teaching, though likened to the origin of Yin and Yang,
returns to the **qi of Yin and Yang**,
abandoning the paths of auspiciousness and inauspiciousness,
treading the **Lunar Steps** and **Starry Paths**,
ascending to the **Celestial Immortal Gate**.

Later, the **Sage-Sovereign** instructed **Yinxi the True Person**:
*"The **Supreme Void Emperor** transmitted the **Five-Phase Talisman** to the one of Fire.
Fire belongs to the summer’s heat,
able to nurture and complete all things,
and also to refine through fire, dispelling calamities and dust.
**Note:** Gold and silver refine away the taint of dust to reveal their luster;
fire refines away misfortune and affliction to reveal vitality—
thus, fire’s hundred virtues are recorded, and the **Fire Phase** is inscribed.

What was transmitted was the **Fire Phase**.

The **Supreme Dao-Sovereign** told **Laozi**:
*"What Phase did you command?"*
Laozi replied:
*"I commanded the Phase of Wood."*
The Dao-Sovereign said:
*"I commanded the Phase of Fire."*
We both have emerged from Water and Fire,
and thus have no worries.
**Note:** These two Most High True Ones, with their bodies transcending the Five Phases,
have no term of decay or ruin—hence the saying.

Yet the lower True Ones of the Immortal Way struggle to depart from Water and Fire.
Though their bodies may linger, they do not exceed a thousand years.
Water and Fire cycle endlessly, with decay and suffering ever in attendance—
self-destruction and slaughter are inevitable unless the Dao intervenes.
Thus, the two Most High Teachers discussed Water and Fire.

Later, the **Sage-Sovereign** told the **Celestial Master**:
*"I have heard that the two Most High True Ones of Ultimate Reality discussed Water and Fire—why?"*
Because among the Five Phases,
Water and Fire **clash destructively**,
bringing countless illnesses, afflictions, and failures,
and even shatter Heaven and Earth.
How much more so for the human body,
which lacks an unbreakable form!

Moreover, the **Fire Star** and the **wandering Mars**,
suddenly dispersing into **Yang qi**,
become **Fire’s destructive poison**.
The great wind blows the Water,
and the **Water’s Star of Chen** suddenly disperses into **Yin qi**,
becoming **thunder and rain**—
both move in assault, striking and conquering each other,
thus creating **Heaven’s affliction**.
Suffering this **howling wind and violent storm**,
Heaven is struck by falling stars and shattered rocks,
Earth by snapped trees and crumbling mountains,
and humanity by ruined dwellings and lost lives.
This afflicts the **Three Realms**—
hence the Most High True Ones’ intent in their discourse,
desiring that the lower True Ones of the Immortal Way
receive these words within their hearts.
The heart must not suffer Water and Fire’s calamities and ruin,
nor must the body and mind fail to attain **transcendence**—
to transcend the Five Phases’ paths,
seeking the **Three Pure Ones’ essence**.
The nature of Water and Fire, when natural, is without worry,
unaffected by Water and Fire’s disasters and misfortunes.

Thus, the three Most High Saints of old
used the analogy of Water and Fire
to admonish the lower True Ones of the Immortal Way,
so that they might transcend Water and Fire’s calamities,
enter the **effortless nature**,
and naturally attain True Reality.
Their **Dao-bodies** become firm and pure,
cleansing Heaven and Earth.

As for the body,
refer to the previous notes.»

chunks.original_text: 有忧於人。 亦具前注。 卿为人天之师，可传水火之符，度下真入上仙，令出水火之病。 注：夫志人修道，皆无水火之性，栖宿山林，精诚恳志，香火诵经，不休之者。 或有烧炼金石服饵之者，或复绝壳服炁之者，数等之人，学道积有，岁年虔若，皆不出於水火，病衰老死，而无所得至多。 太上道君令老君，教度志心之人，出於身中水火病，及过度天地五行水火病，致祝诀注解《流珠》中五星法要，故出此书，并后圣君传天师法，三五《流珠》之经，制太上三五正一符箓，八十一阶，护卫身家，出水火之灾也。 第一水符。 注：符在《 灵宝五符》中。 大者云：是北帝符，墨笔书之，佩於背上。 其五行总有符，老君授与黄帝者是真本，禹於荆山及再修行者小本，非老君亲手书本。 即稍似，不如大本验灵。 第二火符。 注：此二符同在《五符》中，此不具书出。 老君告南极真公曰：卿年多少。 真公曰：年已一百一十七岁，须行即行，须走即走，炁力不退，须发白不再黑。 君曰：发白是闲，卿身未离水火。 云初不识，后自思量良久，方知。 顿首再拜求请，伏望太上大慈，恩济枯朽之骨，得见长生之道。 且崎常蒙师言，汝身未出水火之灾，岂得神仙之任。 不知将何出於水火，其水火皆称坏劫之年，复是何年即到。 老君笑良久，而言水火之劫，汝身也。 身若不出水火，即皆败坏，故谓之劫坏。 岂天地有坏崩之期。 乃告水火之义符诀，此卷与之。 行九年，道成，至今为南极真公。 郑子崎，字仁安。 《本行经》云：南方赤帝郑仁安是也。 至今犹佩此二符，并五符带佩。 第三金、木、土符。 注：此三符，志修行人，随季带佩服朝礼，月三为之。 又本命、庚申、甲子日为之。 余日不用带佩，谓之五行符。 其水火行者，常戴之头上，永不除，二年一换。 书皆本师亲署名，书皆有日。 后圣君告尹先生曰：五年，灵宝五符书各有日。 东方青符，以立春日，请本师书，带之於肘后。 南方赤符，以立夏日书。 西方白符，以立秋日书。 北方黑符，以立冬日书。 中央黄符，以冬至日书。 及春用清明日，夏以端午日书。 各以依节候正气日书。 不能依节修正炁日书，即五月五、九月九、十月十。 此三月书之，亦得。 夫书此符，本师书，清净，设斋素，方以日中时，授与弟子，应带佩是。 木符左肘后，火符戴头上，金符右肘后，水符扶肚中，土符佩於背上。 其五符上，须各以锦袋盛之。 一书五年换。 如无本师、老弱不解书者，即保举师书。 如无，即众中法箓高三五足者，代书。 得此人名，出五行之诀。 不可妄行，令不禀灵炁之人书，及知之，五星五帝不伏也。 各以本师，传五法五符之日书之，与箓同，各授唱弟子，唱授明度法。 如师不知五法是出五行之要诀，度大劫小劫之灵文，即应不别书符同度。 即以立春日起首， 具前注中。 请明师书之，随季带佩。 如恐五行灾有相临，即吉日书，或五月五日、九月九日，此二日是续命消灾之日，书得。 广成君五月五日，书水火二符，朝授黄帝。 日中又授金木土三符，帝再拜请问，对曰：前除水火，后出五行。 注：天下真上仙之人，身虽得神通自在，犹未出於水火。 心虽出得水火，身即未出。

「This also brings worry to mortals.
*(Also, refer to the previous notes.)*
You are the teacher of humanity and Heaven—
thus, you may transmit the **Water and Fire talismans**,
to guide the lower True Ones into the ranks of the Immortals,
and help them escape the **Water and Fire afflictions**.

**Note:** Those who cultivate the Way with sincere resolve,
all lack the Water and Fire **Dao-nature**,
dwelling in mountains and forests,
devoting their utmost sincerity and resolve,
burning incense and reciting scriptures without cease.
Some refine gold and stones, ingesting their elixirs,
others practice **shell-breaking** and **breath-work** (*xūqì* 服炁).
These ranks of practitioners,
through years of earnest Dao-cultivation,
remain trapped in Water and Fire’s afflictions,
succumbing to decay, aging, and death,
yet gain nothing—at most.

The **Most High Dao Lord** (*Tàishàng Dàojūn*) commands **Laozi**,
who teaches those of steadfast resolve
to escape the Water and Fire afflictions within the body,
and the Water and Fire calamities of the Five Phases,
thus bestowing the **Five Star Talismans** from the *Líu Zhū* (*Flowing Pearl*) scripture,
and issuing this book,
along with the **Later Saints’** talismans passed down by the **Celestial Master** (*Tiānshī*),
the **Three Five** (*Sānwǔ*) *Líu Zhū* scriptures,
and the **Most High Three Five Orthodoxy Talismans** (*Tàishàng Sānwǔ Zhèngyī Fúluò*),
the **Eighty-One Stages**,
to safeguard body and home,
and avert Water and Fire disasters.

**First Water Talisman.**
**Note:** The talisman is within the *Língbǎo Wǔ Fú* (*Soul Treasures Five Talismans*).
The great one declares:
*"This is the talisman of the Northern Emperor,
written in black ink,
to be worn upon the back."*
The Five Phases’ **master talisman**,
which **Laozi** bestowed upon **Yellow Emperor** (*Huángdì*),
is the true original.
**Yǔ**’s version from **Jīngshān** (*荆山*) and his later cultivation
is a lesser copy—
not personally inscribed by **Laozi**.
It is somewhat similar,
yet not as efficacious as the great original.

**Second Fire Talisman.**
**Note:** These two talismans appear together in the *Five Talismans*—
this one is not further detailed here.
**Laozi** instructed **True Lord of the Southern Pole** (*Nánjí Zhēngōng*):
*"How old are you?"*
The True Lord replied:
*"I am one hundred and seventeen years old.
When I must walk, I walk;
when I must run, I run.
My **qi-force** does not wane,
and my hair, once white, will never darken again."*
**Laozi** said:
*"White hair is trivial—
your body has yet to escape Water and Fire’s afflictions."*
The True Lord pondered this for a long time,
then realized its meaning.
He prostrated himself twice,
begging:
*"I humbly implore the Most High’s boundless compassion
to save my withered bones,
granting me the path of eternal life.
Moreover, I have always heeded your teachings,
yet you say my body has not escaped Water and Fire’s calamities—
how then can I attain the rank of the Immortals?
I do not know how to escape Water and Fire’s afflictions.
These Water and Fire afflictions are called **‘years of ruin’** (*huài jié* 坏劫),
and yet, what specific year will they arrive?"*

**Laozi** laughed for a long time,
then spoke:
*"The Water and Fire ruin—
that is your body.
If your body does not escape Water and Fire,
then all will be destroyed and ruined—
thus, it is called **‘ruin of the years’** (*huài jié*).
The heavens and earth have no set time for collapse.
Now, I reveal the **meaning and talismanic key** of Water and Fire.
This scroll contains them.
After nine years of practice,
the Dao will be perfected,
and you shall become the **True Lord of the Southern Pole**—
**Zhèng Rén’ān** (*郑仁安*), whose given name is **Zǐ Zāi** (*郑子崎*).
The *Běnxíng Jīng* (*Scripture of Original Conduct*) states:
*"The **Red Emperor of the South** (*Chìdì* 赤帝) is **Zhèng Rén’ān**."*
Even now, he still wears these two talismans,
along with the *Five Talismans* belt.

**Third Talismans of Metal, Wood, and Earth.**
**Note:** These three talismans
are worn by those of earnest resolve
according to the seasons,
and used in morning rituals.
They are also observed on **natal days**, **Gēngshēn days** (*庚申*), and **Jiǎzǐ days** (*甲子*).
On other days, they are not worn—
these are called the **Five Phases Talismans**.
For those practicing Water and Fire,
these talismans are always worn on the head,
never removed,
and changed every two years.
All are inscribed by the **original teacher**,
each bearing a specific date.
The **Later Saints’** talismans instructed **Yīn Xiānsheng** (*尹先生*):
*"The Five Talismans of the *Soul Treasures* are inscribed on different days.
The **eastern green talisman** (*Qīngfú* 青符) is written on **Spring Begins** (*Lìchūn* 立春),
requested from the original teacher,
and worn on the back of the left elbow.
The **southern red talisman** (*Chìfú* 赤符) is written on **Summer Begins** (*Lìxià* 立夏).
The **western white talisman** (*Báifú* 白符) is written on **Autumn Begins** (*Lìqiū* 立秋).
The **northern black talisman** (*Hēifú* 黑符) is written on **Winter Begins** (*Lìdōng* 立冬).
The **central yellow talisman** (*Huángfú* 黄符) is written on **Winter Solstice** (*Dōngzhì* 冬至).
And on **Pure Brightness Day** (*Qīngmíng* 清明) in spring,
and **Duanwu Day** (*Duānwǔ* 端午) in summer,
each is written on the day corresponding to the seasonal **pure qi** (*zhèngqì* 正气).
If one cannot adhere to the seasonal **rectification of qi** (*zhèngqì* 正气) days,
then on the **fifth of the fifth month** (*Wǔyuè wǔ* 五月五),
**ninth of the ninth month** (*Jiǔyuè jiǔ* 九月九),
or **tenth of the tenth month** (*Shíyuè shí* 十月十).
These three months’ days are also acceptable.
When writing these talismans,
the **original teacher** must inscribe them
in a state of purity,
after fasting and abstaining,
and at **midday** (*shízhōng* 日中),
before bestowing them upon the disciple,
who should then wear them.
The **wood talisman** is worn on the back of the left elbow,
the **fire talisman** on the head,
the **metal talisman** on the back of the right elbow,
the **water talisman** around the waist,
and the **earth talisman** upon the back.
For the **Five Talismans** above,
each must be stored in a **silken pouch** (*jǐnchuāi* 锦袋).
One inscription lasts five years.
If there is no original teacher,
or if the teacher is elderly and unable to inscribe,
then a **worthy disciple** (*bǎojǔ shī* 保举师) should write them.
If none is found,
then a **high-ranking adept** (*fǎluò gāozǔ* 法箓高三五足) from the assembly may inscribe.
When obtaining such a person’s name,
the **Five Phases’ keys** are revealed.
Do not recklessly practice—
let not one who cannot receive **efficacious qi** (*língqì* 灵炁) inscribe them,
nor one who knows not their meaning.
The **Five Stars and Five Emperors** will not submit to such.
Each must be inscribed by the original teacher,
on the days of the **Five Laws and Five Talismans**,
as with the **talismanic scriptures** (*luò* 箓),
and each must be transmitted to disciples who chant and recite,
teaching them the **method of enlightenment** (*míngdù fǎ* 明度法).
If the teacher does not know the **Five Laws** as the **keys to escaping the Five Phases**,
nor the **efficacious texts** (*língwén* 灵文) that avert great and small calamities,
then they should not separately inscribe the talismans along with the transmission.
Instead, from **Spring Begins** onward,
*(as noted previously)*
request a **clear teacher** (*míngshī* 明师) to inscribe them,
and wear them according to the seasons.
If fearing that the Five Phases’ calamities may approach,
then inscribe them on a **auspicious day** (*jí rì* 吉日),
or on **Duanwu Day** (*Wǔyuè wǔ* 五月五) or **Chóngyáng Day** (*Jiǔyuè jiǔ* 九月九)—
these two days are **‘days of extending life and dispelling calamities’** (*xùmìng xiāozāi* 续命消灾),
and thus are acceptable.

**Guāngchéng Jūn** inscribed the Water and Fire talismans
on **Duanwu Day** (*Wǔyuè wǔ* 五月五),
and at midday bestowed them upon **Yellow Emperor** (*Huángdì*).
**Yellow Emperor** then prostrated himself twice and asked:
*"First, you dispelled Water and Fire—
then, how do you escape the Five Phases?"*
**Note:** Though the **true Immortals of the Most High Way** possess
**spiritual mobility and freedom** (*shén tōng zìrán* 神通自在),
their bodies have yet to escape Water and Fire.
Though their hearts have escaped Water and Fire’s afflictions,
their bodies remain trapped within them.

chunks.original_text: 身心俱出天地，水火未出。 夫言水火之灾，身心与天地俱出者，谓除水火，离三界，即中真大仙也。 夫三界，金木土也。 金，俗儒依佛，喻金玉珍奇七宝可女音乐不受。 土，俗儒喻官爵荣贵、守土之骄富不受。 木，俗儒释喻楼合台殿不坐，心无所着爱，谓之心出三界之外。 此依道科，此名心出身犹未得出。 身失败后，当来世身，却受荣之贵，正在三界之中，五行所管着，谓之身不出五行之中内。 我得中真之要，除水火之灾，出五行之外，超三界之上，身心俱住，经天地水火，不能害及於身心。 行佩一年，五苦九厄自消。 二年，能去万毒，降伏五兵。 三年，却死来生。 四年，受职人世一名书玉京。 五年，得离水火。 注：离其灾非，是便不食水火之炁，其炁不能有毒，中於佩符之人。 太上老君告尹先生曰：佩水火符，五年，水火不能害。 佩金木土符，金木不能克，土木不能贼，五等离身，身坚久长生，不入下等神仙品位也。 六年、七年，渐更妙力。 二七年，白日上升。 注：五行总妙，水火为先，是主生成疾败之宗也。 老君告诸大真曰：水火二字，非但下界人物，所畏成败。 注：缘人有命信，食饮於水，故以出成除败为难，故以畏者也。 乃至高真大仙常修行，次亦用诀步，不休於本生。 注：生，命也。 道君寅生火命，常以丙寅，捻水，次火诀，以求取获长生。 何况世人，不求长生，须以本命日记为。 命日土行初起，世土是镇星散炁宫。 注：宫，地皇也。 姓宫，名风。 地皇以土德行世，积土为台，坚石为柱，筑土为穴室。 注：高筑土为山，百丈有余，四向穴孔为宫室居活，用此穴为宫字姓。 何以宫字重口。 故宫室筑土为之，高台作数重，掘穴以安养人口，重累义所作宫字，故重口也。 此台岁月久，上掘穴，崩坏损下。 人皇观之，知上崩下损宫室，故以书害字，如宫相近，故作上口破损势。 下口之所以用此字，行世记之，上克下也。 因此则世流行害字，上应土星，即多害克之炁，行损人物病死也。 室大号曰宫，宫而为姓也。 今人以宫姓为长，起地皇之意重人，故尊土姓而为长，五行之初也。 与征姓而通婚，生子六人。 长子改姓风，二子姓工，三子、四子、五子、六子，已上四姓风也。 征姓妻亡，又再与商姓子通婚，又生六子。 长子改姓公孙，二子改姓力，三子改姓飞， 注：今改姓湛任是也。 四子、五子、六子，总承宫姓。 且地皇有一十二子，以取土炁之盛。 与五姓而同居通婚，子孙甚至王，象土星之轮回，逆行周天之意。 故取土之寄王四季也。 常以此土害炁，周行四季不停，以人命被临者，被十日即有其病。 知之人捻木诀，步木斗， 注：东宿七星是木斗。 以消之即止。 故土偏畏木，木能克土。 土常扶木，木为之所畏。 修行人若是土命，即捻金诀，止木灾。 若木命人，即捻火诀，止金。 若是金命人，即捻水诀，止火。 若是火命人，即捻土诀，止水。 若水命人，即捻木诀，止土。 故立五行之中，唯土行最多刑害之炁。 故以五行相生相克，皆附土行之中。 又土星三十五年一周天，九野管五行。 今五音之中，皆宫为首。 若据飞步咒说，即金为首。 二说不同。 注：按《三才论》云：天地人，谓之三才。
chunks.translated_text:
The body and mind both transcend Heaven and Earth, yet Water and Fire remain unvanquished.

When speaking of the calamities of Water and Fire, those whose body and mind both transcend Heaven and Earth—meaning they have escaped Water and Fire, departed the Three Realms—are called **Middle True Great Immortals**. The Three Realms are Metal, Wood, and Earth.

Metal: The vulgar scholars, following the Buddha’s teachings, liken Metal to precious gems, jade, and treasures that do not attract women or music—unaffected by them.

Earth: The vulgar scholars liken Earth to official rank, honor, wealth, and the arrogance of territorial rule—unaffected by them.

Wood: The vulgar scholars interpret Wood as not sitting in pavilions, halls, or lofty structures, with no attachments of the heart—this is called the mind transcending the Three Realms. This, according to Daoist classification, is called the mind transcending, yet the body has not yet transcended.

When the body fails, the next life’s body will again suffer the afflictions of honor and nobility—still within the Three Realms, governed by the Five Phases—this is called the body not transcending the Five Phases.

I have grasped the essence of the **Middle True**, dispelling Water and Fire calamities, transcending the Five Phases, surpassing the Three Realms, and dwelling with body and mind intact, traversing Heaven, Earth, Water, and Fire without harm.

Wearing the talisman for one year dispels the Five Sorrows and Nine Calamities.
For two years, one can repel all poisons and subdue the Five Armies.
For three years, one avoids death and rebirth.
For four years, one receives a worldly appointment—named **Book of the Jade Capital**.
For five years, one escapes Water and Fire.
**Note:** To depart from their afflictions is to no longer consume the *qi* of Water and Fire; their *qi* cannot harm those who wear the talisman.

**Laozi, the Most High Venerable, told Mr. Yin:**
*"Wearing the Water and Fire talismans for five years renders Water and Fire powerless to harm.
Wearing the Metal, Wood, and Earth talismans renders Metal unable to conquer, Wood unable to harm, and Earth unable to injure. The Five Phases depart from the body, making it firm and enduring—long-lived, yet not attaining the rank of the lower-grade Immortals."*

In six and seven years, one gradually attains wondrous powers.
At forty-nine years, one ascends in broad daylight.
**Note:** The Five Phases’ ultimate subtlety lies in Water and Fire, which govern life, growth, sickness, and decay.

**Laozi told the Great True Ones:**
*"The characters Water and Fire are not merely feared by beings of the lower realms for their power over success and failure.
**Note:** Because humans have fate and rely on water for sustenance, escaping creation and avoiding decay is difficult—that is why they are feared.

Even the highest True Immortals, in their constant practice, still employ talismanic steps to avoid their original fate.
**Note:** *Fate* refers to one’s destiny.
The Dao Lord was born in the *yin* hour of the Fire Phase, always using the *bing* hour of the Water Phase to manipulate Water talismans, then the Fire talismans, to seek longevity. How much more so for worldly folk, who do not seek immortality, yet must observe their natal day’s talismans.

The natal day’s Earth Phase rises first; the worldly Earth corresponds to the *Zhen* star, dispersing *qi* from the Earthly Palace.
**Note:** *Palace* refers to **Di Huang** (地皇).
Surname: Palace; given name: Wind.
Di Huang ruled with Earth’s virtue, piling earth to form platforms, erecting stone pillars, and digging earthen chambers.
**Note:** High earthen mounds were built, over a hundred *zhang* tall, with four-directional cavities as palatial dwellings. These cavities were called the Palace surname.

Why is the character *Palace* (宮) written with a doubled mouth radical?
Because palaces were built of earth, with layered towers, and chambers dug to shelter people—*Palace* (宮) carries the meaning of layered accumulation, hence the doubled mouth radical. Over time, the upper layers collapsed, damaging the lower ones.

The **Human Sovereign** observed this, knowing that the upper collapse and lower damage of the Palace chambers were written as *harm* (害), resembling *Palace* (宮), thus depicting the destructive force of collapse. The lower mouth radical signifies the upper overcoming the lower.

Thus, the character *harm* (害) spread in the world, corresponding to the Earth star, bringing destructive *qi* that injures and kills people.

A large chamber is called a *Palace*, and Palace became a surname.
Today, those with the Palace surname are honored, reflecting Di Huang’s intention to elevate humanity—thus, the Earth surname is revered as the first of the Five Phases.

They intermarried with the Zheng surname, producing six sons.
The eldest changed his surname to Wind, the second to Gong, the third to Worker, the fourth, fifth, and sixth retained the Palace surname.

When the Zheng wife died, he again intermarried with a Shang surname descendant, producing another six sons.
The eldest changed his surname to Gongsun, the second to Li, the third to Fei,
**Note:** Today’s surnames Zhan and Ren are derived from this.
the fourth, fifth, and sixth retained the Palace surname.

Moreover, Di Huang had twelve sons, taking the abundant *qi* of Earth.
He intermarried with the five surnames, and their descendants became kings, mirroring the Earth star’s retrograde cycle through the four seasons.
Thus, Earth’s sovereign rule over the four seasons was established.
The Earth’s harmful *qi* constantly circulates through the seasons, and those whose fate aligns with it suffer illness within ten days.
Those who know this manipulate Wood talismans, step the Wood Array,
**Note:** The Eastern Host of Seven Stars is the Wood Array.
to disperse it and halt the affliction.
Thus, Earth fears Wood, for Wood can conquer Earth.
Earth constantly supports Wood, yet Wood fears it in return.

Practitioners with an Earth destiny should manipulate Metal talismans to stop Wood calamities.
Those with a Wood destiny should manipulate Fire talismans to stop Metal.
Those with a Metal destiny should manipulate Water talismans to stop Fire.
Those with a Fire destiny should manipulate Earth talismans to stop Water.
Those with a Water destiny should manipulate Wood talismans to stop Earth.

Thus, within the Five Phases, the Earth Phase harbors the most destructive *qi*.
All Five Phases’ mutual generation and conquest are subsumed within Earth’s influence.
Moreover, the Earth star completes a cycle every thirty-five years, governing the Nine Regions and the Five Phases.

Among the Five Tones, *Gong* (宮) is primary.
If following the *Fei* Step Talisman’s teachings, then Metal is primary.
The two accounts differ.
**Note:** According to the *San Cai Lun* (三才论), Heaven, Earth, and Human are called the Three Powers.

chunks.original_text: 从有天而即有地，地立之后，土是地生。 所生前土，而土生金，故合为首。 按《尹先生记》：《神灵具录》云：老君母金命，而生老君。 老君复上升，迁后圣天尊位，故告命三官北斗咒曰：金水火木土，亦理不失缘。 五行皆所以生，而以居地上，后圣君取金为首也。 夫土者，是三界之长也。 老君告诸帝君曰：吾常念下真上仙，学道不离於三界，何由可得不生不灭。 卿等既明三界，何不起心，度於后未晓之人，令得永达，度出三界，不为魔贼所障。 即出三界之上，三清之中，而为至真。 岂非慈力济度之功。 而益身无上之德也。 火是三界之男人，无火而命不全。 故须假炁以熟，生养身根长命之脉也。 水是三界之妻，人无水而即死，人得水而即生，生死且须得水，水能养万物，何况独是人乎。 后圣君符告命三界魔王言：卿部三界，人物皆归。 非三界不生，非三界不育，非三界不长。 长成生死轮回，而不知其返。 水火无停，生灭归土，无贵无贱，老少俱同，来去迷心，不知心从何，而出得我三界。 魔王众俱稽首再拜，乞求出於三界之上，而心俱爱，不知令去水火，此身即饿顿而死。 非水火而食不能熟，非土而水火不能居住相成。 故知某等之人，寸步不得离苦，何为出得三界。 后圣告曰：出三界有六等法，若能依行，身心自出三界。 何用禁食於水火。 夫水火是阴阳之真炁，土是五行之主，何用而即除之。 且上圣天仙，其用俱别。 我今一一示卿，须听受之。 一法，身心受教，离水除火。 注：水火二性也。 夫水火之性利人，人谓之德。 若起水火刑於人，谓之贼。 是名二法。 天即不能祸，地即不能灾。 注：心除水火之性，天不能害，地不能败，身安也。 二法，身心土镇锁津 注：喻身上仙者精也。 志人行房帷之事，闭精不泄，泄即损神，少津败身。 能存归神，溢津润身通多，且行不陈，自有经旨，而得天真。 三法，制金理火。 注：本命日从地纪一遍，后散为禹步，捻金诀，在左手甲为火，五指指金星三遍，讫即诵金木咒，咒金木相克，云云。 四法，制木理金。 注：本命日从天纲一遍，后化为禹步，捻木诀，在左手为金斧，指木星三遍，讫即蹑三度，诵五行祝，曰天纲中咒，金水木火土，金木相推，七星焕焕，天纲最威，云云。 已上四法，是消三界之灾害，五行之相人於难克。 若依此法，行之一年，身中五苦八，九厄百病，自能除之。 此即是顺。 本师履地纪，蹑斗，传度时受讫。 今即本命日修真，出三界五行之法也。 注：按《太平经□内品修真秘诀》云：上清大真人未升天以前，皆一一取本命之日，修行四等法诀，后步履斗星，镊地纪，升登天门。 便入金阙玉台，而后圣君也。 五法总制五行，於身之外，身出五行之上。 注：后圣君曰：授天师诀，制五行於身之外法。 六甲有六旬，六旬之中，皆有本命日。 先蹑地纪，讫即蹑三台，即履五星，各须五遍。 诵五行咒十八篇，《流珠》上卷是诀。 即步火纲三遍，顺、倒、反三遍是也。 亦诵顺倒、反三等咒。 讫即出东南地户上立，面西北，存思将军吏兵。 先存中元三将军，领吏兵如图。 中元主人。 次下元三将军，领吏兵，主地。 宫奏身有功，修行不阙。 次上元三将军，领史兵下迎。
chunks.translated_text:
From the moment Heaven arises, Earth immediately follows.
Earth is established, and then **Earth Phase** is born from Earth.
The Earth that comes before is **Metal**, and Earth produces Metal—so Metal is primary.

According to *Master Yin’s Record* (《尹先生记》), the *Divine Record of All Spirits* (《神灵具录》) states:
The **Venerable Laozi’s** mother was of **Metal destiny**, and from her arose the **Venerable Laozi**.
The **Venerable Laozi** then ascended and took the position of **Posterior Sage Celestial Sovereign** (后圣天尊).
Thus, when he proclaimed the talisman to the **Three Officials of the Northern Dipper** (命三官北斗咒),
he said: *"Metal, Water, Fire, Wood, Earth—
the Way’s principles never stray from their natural connections.*
All Five Phases are means of generation,
yet they dwell upon Earth.
The **Posterior Sage Sovereign** takes Metal as primary."

For Earth is the **longest of the Three Realms** (三界).
The **Venerable Laozi** declared to all **Imperial Sovereigns** (帝君):
*"I often ponder the **Lower Truth** and **Upper Immortals** (下真上仙),
those who seek the Dao without departing the Three Realms.
How can they attain imperishability and non-extinction?
You have mastered the Three Realms—
why not awaken and guide those who remain unenlightened,
so they may forever transcend and escape the Three Realms,
unobstructed by **demonic thieves** (魔贼).
Beyond the Three Realms lies the **Three Pure Ones** (三清),
where the **Supreme Truth** (至真) resides.
Is this not the **palace of compassionate efficacy** (慈力济度之功),
the **peerless virtue** (无上之德) of the body?"*

Fire is the **male of the Three Realms** (三界之男人).
Without Fire, one’s destiny is incomplete.
Thus, one must borrow **qi** to refine it,
nurturing the **vital roots** (身根) for longevity’s pulse.

Water is the **consort of the Three Realms** (三界之妻).
Without Water, humans perish;
with Water, humans live.
Life and death both depend on Water,
which nourishes all things—
how much more so the human body alone?

The **Posterior Sage Sovereign**’s talisman commands the **Three Realms’ Destructive King** (命三界魔王):
*"Your domain encompasses the Three Realms—
all beings and figures return to you.
Without the Three Realms, nothing is born;
without the Three Realms, nothing is nurtured;
without the Three Realms, nothing grows.
From birth to death, they cycle endlessly,
yet none know how to return.
Water and Fire never cease—
life and death return to Earth.
No high nor low, no old nor young—
all come and go, lost in delusion.
They do not know where their minds originate,
yet they seek escape from the Three Realms.
The **demonic kings** all kneel and bow twice,
begging to transcend the Three Realms,
but their minds cling—
they do not know to abandon Water and Fire,
and thus their bodies starve and die.
Without Water and Fire, food cannot be refined;
without Earth, Water and Fire cannot dwell and interact.
Thus, I know that such beings
cannot step away from suffering—
how can they escape the Three Realms?"*

The **Posterior Sage Sovereign** replied:
*"There are six methods to escape the Three Realms.
If one follows them, the body and mind naturally transcend the Three Realms.
Why restrict oneself from Water and Fire?"*

For Water and Fire are the **true qi of Yin and Yang** (阴阳之真炁),
and Earth is the **master of the Five Phases** (五行之主).
Why would one remove them?

Moreover, the **Supreme Celestial Immortals** (上圣天仙)
each employ distinct methods.
I shall now reveal them to you—
listen and receive them.

**First Method:** The body and mind receive instruction,
abandoning Water and excluding Fire.
**Note:** Water and Fire are two **natures** (二性).
The **nature of Water and Fire** benefits humans—
this is called **virtue/power** (德).
If Water and Fire inflict harm upon humans,
this is called **theft** (贼).
Thus, this is the **second method**.

Heaven cannot bring calamity,
Earth cannot cause disaster.
**Note:** When the mind excludes the **nature of Water and Fire**,
Heaven cannot harm, Earth cannot ruin—
the body is at peace.

**Second Method:** The body and mind are **Earth-locked**, **sealing the essence** (土镇锁津).
**Note:** This metaphorically refers to **ascending immortals** (身上仙者) preserving their **vital essence** (精).
Those who practice **chambered cultivation** (行房帷之事),
must **seal their essence** (闭精不泄).
If it leaks, the **spirit is diminished** (损神),
and **vital essence exhaustion ruins the body** (少津败身).
If one can **store and return it to the spirit** (存归神),
and **excess essence moistens the body** (溢津润身),
then **longevity’s pulse flows abundantly** (通多).
Moreover, **practice must not be stagnant** (行不陈),
and there are **precepts within the Dao** (自有经旨),
thus attaining **Celestial Truth** (天真).

**Third Method:** **Conquer Metal and regulate Fire** (制金理火).
**Note:** The **root destiny day** (本命日) begins with one **step of the Yu’s tread** (地纪一遍),
then transforms into **Yu’s tread** (禹步),
and the **Metal talisman** (捻金诀) is performed.
On the **left hand’s fingernail**, the **Fire talisman** (甲为火) is manipulated,
and the **five fingers point to the Metal star** (指金星) three times.
Upon completion, one recites the **Metal-Wood talisman** (金木咒),
invoking the **conquest of Metal and Wood** (金木相克), saying thus:
*"The seven stars shine resplendent,
the **Metal talisman** is most formidable."*

**Fourth Method:** **Conquer Wood and regulate Metal** (制木理金).
**Note:** The **root destiny day** (本命日) begins with one **step of the Heavenly Tread** (天纲一遍),
then transforms into **Yu’s tread** (禹步),
and the **Wood talisman** (捻木诀) is performed.
On the **left hand**, one forms the **Metal Axe** (金斧),
and points to the **Wood star** (指木星) three times.
Upon completion, one **treads three times** (蹑三度),
and recites the **Five Phases invocation** (五行祝),
saying: *"The **Heavenly Tread talisman** (天纲中咒),
Metal, Water, Wood, Fire, Earth—
Metal and Wood mutually push aside,
the seven stars shine resplendent,
the **Heavenly Tread talisman** is most formidable."*

The **four methods above** are means to **dispel the Three Realms’ calamities** (消三界之灾害)
and **harmonize the Five Phases’ mutual conquest** (五行之相人於难克).
If one follows these methods,
within a year, the **five torments** (五苦), **eight hardships** (八难),
**nine adversities** (九厄), and **hundred diseases** (百病) in the body
shall naturally be eliminated.
This is called **alignment** (顺).
The original **teacher treads the Earthly Tread** (履地纪),
**steps on the Dipper** (蹑斗),
and upon **receiving transmission and guidance** (传度时受讫),
now practices the **root destiny day** (本命日) for **cultivation of the truth** (修真),
the methods to escape the Three Realms and Five Phases.

**Note:** According to *The Secret Precepts of Inner Perfection from the Great Peace Scripture* (《太平经□内品修真秘诀》),
the **Uppermost Pure Immortal** (上清大真人) before ascending to Heaven
each took their **root destiny day** (本命),
and practiced the **four talismanic methods** (四等法诀).
Later, they **trod the Dipper star** (步履斗星),
**grasped the Earthly Tread** (镊地纪),
and ascended through the **Heavenly Gate** (升登天门).
They then entered the **Golden Threshold and Jade Terrace** (金阙玉台),
becoming the **Posterior Sage Sovereign** (后圣君).

**Fifth Method:** **Comprehensively conquer the Five Phases** (总制五行),
**transcending them from the body’s exterior** (於身之外).
**Note:** The **Posterior Sage Sovereign** said:
*"The **talisman given to the Heavenly Master** (授天师诀),
the method to **comprehensively conquer the Five Phases from the body’s exterior** (制五行於身之外法)."*

The **Six Celestial Stems** (六甲) encompass **six periods** (六旬),
and within each **six periods** (旬),
there is a **root destiny day** (本命日).
First, one **treads the Earthly Tread** (蹑地纪),
then **treads the Three Platforms** (蹑三台),
which is **treading the Five Stars** (履五星),
each requiring **five repetitions** (各须五遍).
One recites the **Five Phases talismans** (五行咒) **eighteen times** (十八篇),
and *The Rolling Pearl* (《流珠》) **upper scroll** (上卷) contains the precepts.

Then, one **treads the Fire Tread** (步火纲) three times,
and performs **three repetitions of forward, backward, and inverted steps** (顺、倒、反三遍).
One also recites the **three talismans of forward, backward, and inverted** (顺倒、反三等咒).

Upon completion, one stands at the **eastern-southern earthly gate** (东南地户上立),
facing the **western-northern** direction,
**storing thoughts of generals and soldiers** (存思将军吏兵).
First, one **stores the Three Generals of Middle Element** (先存中元三将军),
leading **soldiers and officials** (领吏兵) as per the diagram.
**Middle Element** oversees the **host** (主人).
Next, one **stores the Three Generals of Lower Element** (次下元三将军),
leading **soldiers and officials** (领吏兵),
**overseeing Earth** (主地).
**The Palace** (宫) **declares the body’s merit** (奏身有功),
and **cultivation is never incomplete** (修行不阙).
Then, one **stores the Three Generals of Upper Element** (次上元三将军),
leading **historians and soldiers** (领史兵) to descend and welcome.

「Next, one **stores the Five Virtue Generals** (次五德将军),
then the **Heavenly Sovereign and Thunder General** (天公雷公等将军),
each leading **myriad armies of soldiers and horses** (兵马百千万众),
as **five clouds soar through the void** (五云飞空),
while the **Golden Just Strength-Soldiers** (金刚力士) **guide the body** (引身),
ascending to pay homage to the **Emperor of the Great Peace Golden Threshold** (太平金阙帝) **and the Holy Sovereign of the Morning Court** (晨后圣君).

**Store them as per the diagram of the Three Element Generals** (存之如三元将军图),
wearing **official headdress and sash** (具冠简),
in **purple robes** (紫衣),
with **all attendants following as prescribed** (如法诸卫从),
according to the **three diagrams of Han Hong** (如含弘等三图).
**Store them only after donning the prescribed attire and headdress** (存之，唯加具衣冠简).

**The Six Methods** (六法),
are to be performed on the **fixed hour of Regal Monkey** (庚申初夜),
*[Note: the first watch is Regal Monkey]* (注：初夜一更是).
On **Earthly Horse’s initial night** (己未日初夜),
enter the **fifth watch** (入五更是).
**Regal Monkey’s day is set for this** (庚申日定之也).
When **storing thoughts** (思存出),
follow the **Han Hong diagram** (如含弘图).

This is to **sever and cut off calamities of the Three Realms** (断截三界灾厄),
**the Three Corpses and Six Demons** (三尸六魔),
**the Three Officials and Nine Earths** (三官九地),
**root out sinful causes** (落灭罪根),
**augment life longevity** (添益寿算),
**remove the death ledgers of the Three Officials** (落除三官死簿),
and **inscribe the True Spirit’s celestial register of birth** (注上生历神真之位).

Upon completion, **knock the teeth thirty-six times** (毕，叩齿三十六通).
**Hold firm** (握固),
then **twirl the talisman of one’s own life span and sovereign fate** (即捻本身司命诀),
and **ingest the talisman dispelling the Three Corpses** (服去三尸之符).
*[Note: the talisman is found in *The Sacred Scriptures of the Fifty Generals* (符在《五十将军灵书》中).]*

Upon completion, **lie down in repose** (即任安卧).
**Awake before and after the second watch of Earthly Horse** (卧起五更二点前后).
**Again store thoughts** (又思存),
as before.

After **one cycle** (一度讫),
**swallow the talisman** (吞符).
**Practice this twelve times** (行之一十二度),
and the **Three Corpses demons will depart forever** (三尸虫永去),
**even in death, they dare not return** (死亦不敢来),
thus becoming **a person of the Highest True** (上真之人),
**worthy of honor and protection** (可贵可保).

This method is **subtle and profound** (微妙),
**unfit for reckless transmission to the unworthy** (不可妄传非人),
lest calamity befalls the **seven ancestral masters** (殃及七祖矣).

---

**The Complete and True Great Immortal Sovereign Master Zhang Fangping, Founder of the Daoist Tradition, Zhao Sheng, King of the Celestial Command, Li Zhongfu, and Master Mao Ying, Xu Yufu, and Others—Transmitted Across Generations**

**Master Li Chunfeng, the Daoist Sage of the Han, Annotated**

**The Supreme Mysteries of the Six Jia: The Yin Function**

The **Six Jia** are the offspring of the Five Phases.
*Annotation:* The Dao gives birth to primordial *qi*; one generates two—Yin and Yang.
Two generates three—the Three Primordials.
Three generates four—the Four Seasons.
Four generates five—the Five Phases.
The Five Phases generate the Six Jia: *Jiazi, Jiaxu, Jia Shen, Jia Wu, Jia Chen, Jia Yin.*

The Six Jia generate the Seven Stars,
The Seven Stars generate the Nine Essences,
The Nine Essences generate the Ten Celestial Stems,
The Ten Celestial Stems generate the Twelve Earthly Branches,
The Twelve Earthly Branches generate the Twenty-Eight Constellations.
The Twenty-Eight Constellations generate the Thirty-Five Divine Officers,
The Thirty-Five Divine Officers generate the Forty-Nine Stars,
The Forty-Nine Stars generate the Sixty-Four Coalescent Stars,
The Sixty-Four Coalescent Stars generate the Eighty-One Extremity Stars.
The stars are measured in Yin and Yang,
Thus they are called the **Ultimate of the Small Numbers**,
And are known as the **Ancient Method**,
With eighty-one as their extreme limit.
Now, these eighty-one generate the myriad phenomena of the revolving heavens—
A number beyond comprehension.

There are three grades.

**The Highest Grade:** The talismans enter the **Upper Primordial**,
*Annotation:* Known as the **Lord Lao’s Six Jia Talismans**—those used today.
Called the **Lord Lao’s Inner Secrets: Three Talismans, Six Jia Scriptures.**
When mortals encounter them,
With sincere devotion and diligent practice,
They are freed from a hundred ailments,
And the Six Spirits arrive.
*Annotation:* The Six Spirits are:
1. The Six Jia Generals,
2. The Six Jia Day Officials,
3. The Six Jia Jade Boys and Jade Girls,
4. The Day Official Attendants,
5. The Direct Talisman,
6. The Talisman Clerks—six in total.
They capture evil and inspect the essences—
None are without spiritual efficacy.
For those who tread the Daoist path,
None can succeed without them.
If there are those with sincere devotion and joy in the Dao,
They must first master the talismans,
Stabilize the soul and calm the spirit,
Anchor the essence and solidify the form,
And forever secure the root of longevity,
The gateway to attaining the Dao.
The seals of invocation are opened—
Whatever is summoned, stored, or employed,
This is the **Chief Messenger of Announcement**,
The **Commander-in-Chief of the Three Officials**.

The **Preface to the Lord Lao’s Six Jia Talismans** states:
*"All the myriad gods of Heaven and Earth are the subordinates of the Six Jia."*
*Annotation:* Within the vast cosmos,
There are myriad gods and spirits,
Ten thousand evils and myriad essences,
All recorded and commanded by the Six Jia,
And all are the servants of the Six Jia.
Thus, mortals who know this
Receive the Six Jia Scriptures,
Serve the Six Jia Talismans,
And wear the **Six Jia Direct Spirit Plaques**—
This is to measure the depth of their merit,
To drive the myriad spirits,
And to aid the nation and save the people.

In the ancient past, all who cultivated the Dao
Attained it through the Six Jia.
*Annotation:* The Six Jia are the foremost of the **Six Primordial Methods**—
The sacred path of the **Ancient Sage Lord Lao** and the **Later Sage Jade Emperor**,
The gateway and the thoroughfare of cultivation.

**The Middle Grade:** The Six Jia are called **Lingfei**,
Commanding **1,360 Jade Boys** and **2,440 Jade Girls.**

The **Lord Lao’s Secret Six Jia Talismans** include:
Eleven Great Generals,
1,200 Attendants,
970 Jade Boys, Jade Girls, and Talisman Clerks,
And countless soldiers, beasts, and messengers—
Sufficient to field **120,000 troops** for the Highest Grade.

The **Most High Lord Lao** established the **Six Jia of Heaven and Earth**,
With six camps, each divided into four divisions.
One division resides within the human body—
*[Note: Further annotations to follow.]*

chunks.original_text: 灵飞为中等， 入上清数。 五行六甲为下等，此名三等六甲也。 其三等六甲，学道之人皆须修奉。 注：上中二等，每日服之，一十四年登仙。 下等六甲，推身出厄，算衰王之事也。 后圣君告方诸童君夫人：欲修身长生者，先修服六甲神符。 前圣所秘重，世号之老君六甲秘符。 服之法，每诵直官名，呼符吏旬将，及玉女名字。 呼之必诵前圣长生咒两遍，即吞符。 吞符三年，即服灵飞六甲符，同吞前吞老君六甲符。 讫，次即吞灵飞六甲符。 符皆记神直官符吏玉女等名，一一呼之。 师曰：诀曰：六甲神多有重名重姓，不能一一记得。 以竹木为小牌子，书其神名将吏玉女名，一一记之。 记带行住坐，皆记神名。 防急疾事呼吹驱使，救人制鬼，收邪去兵，唇齿厄出牌子，便呼之，立应验也。 唯夜卧若入女室，即挂之安静处壁上柱上，即得。 莫挂安门户上，门户神恐畏，使彼不安。 须以心记之。 应急驱使，如手应心，如心制口， 注：上古大仙直心制口，语有失错之事也。 故心许即是口许，未真，此仙人之所行也。 呼唤立到。 须以记名姓，及闲时长存之。 急呼唤时，即征验也。 并及吃食饮酒之处，先须心呼，存直日旬将玉女等，同臣则玄甘飨，吃某食某饮酒果等。 常以日日存思之，同甘食饮之。 后存用，大验。 善摄兵害，伏天魔。 注：昔山中道者李伯药，常修六甲之法服符，在山中不出得五年。 一旦，忽见一人，着青衣，乘豹，送一小瓶子。 云：是大丹伯药，汝合道成，形神枯朽，汝须服此大药，即得长生。 吾今故来授子之药，是真大还丹。 以金瓶子与李伯药看，瓶子是真金丹，丸紫金色。 谓弟子言曰：吾今得道，仙使送太丹，吾当受服而去世上升。 汝须依吾修行，志心莫退，必当亦应得此丹药。 去世之日，来天上寻吾。 弟子韦祥未得对师言，唯闻林中有似数百人声相似，其中亦有女人声。 须臾之间，闻一人处分云：捉来。 即有十余人着朱衣，捉乘豹使者，抛头着地，化作老龙，豹化作老虎，杖二十下。 叱之曰：李君学成功，虽未成名，早已着仙籍，安敢为祟，欲毒药害命。 伯药知其非真人，即问其故。 甲申玉女对曰：天魔毒鬼，化作老龙虎，以害君。 君若修六甲不勤，必中毒而死。 须臾之间，龙虎毒总化为鬼而死。 非六甲神之功，伯药不得救，而被天魔进药而死。 今具此记之行世。 世之人但不应不受不服，他自收药，拜而自伏去。 更不敢犯人，往往有此。 令人着功得道。

「Lingfei is of the Middle Grade, included in the count of the **Upper Pure** (上清).

The Five Phases and Six Jia form the **Lower Grade**, hence this is called the **Three Grades of Six Jia**.

Those who practice the Dao must all cultivate and revere the **Three Grades of Six Jia**.

*Annotation:* The Upper and Middle Grades—
Taking them daily for **fourteen years** grants ascension to the Dao.

The **Lower Grade Six Jia** expel misfortune from the body,
And are used in calculations for **decrepit kings** (算衰王).

The **Later Sage Lord Lao** instructed the **Jade Boys and Ladies of the Rectangular Array** (方诸童君夫人):
*"For those who wish to cultivate the body and prolong life,
First, they must cultivate and ingest the divine talismans of the Six Jia.
This was the most sacred method of the **Earlier Sage**,
Commonly known as the **Lord Lao’s Secret Six Jia Talismans**.
The method of ingestion is as follows:
Each time one recites the names of the **Divine Officials** (神直官),
One summons the **Talisman Clerks of the Decade** (旬将),
And the names of the **Jade Girls**.

Upon summoning, one must recite the **Earlier Sage’s Long-Life Incantation** (前圣长生咒) twice,
Then swallow the talisman.

After **three years** of swallowing the talisman,
One then ingests the **Lingfei Six Jia Talismans**,
Swallowing them in the same manner as the **Lord Lao’s Secret Six Jia Talismans**.
Once finished, proceed to swallow the **Lingfei Six Jia Talismans**.

The talismans must all be inscribed with the names of the **Divine Officials**, **Talisman Clerks**, and **Jade Girls**.
One must call upon each by name.

The Master says:
*"The secret lies in this:
The Six Jia deities have many repeated names and surnames,
And one cannot remember them all.
Thus, small wooden or bamboo plaques are made,
Upon which the names of the deities, generals, clerks, and jade girls are inscribed,
And each is recorded accordingly.
Whether standing, walking, sitting, or reclining,
One must always bear their names in mind.
In urgent matters, one must blow upon and invoke the talismans,
To rescue people, subdue ghosts, expel evil, and repel harm.
If one’s life is in peril, the plaques should be taken out,
And the names invoked immediately—
The response will be instantaneous.

However, when sleeping at night or entering a woman’s chamber,
One must hang them in a secure place on the wall or pillar,
And they will still be effective.
Do not hang them on the doorframe,
For the **Doorframe Deities** (门户神) may fear them,
Causing unrest.

One must commit their names to memory.
When urgently invoking them,
It must be done as swiftly as **hand responds to heart** (手应心),
And as decisively as **heart commands the mouth** (心制口).
*Annotation:* In the **Upper Ancient** (上古) era, great Daoists practiced **direct heart-mouth control** (直心制口),
Where their words were never misspoken.
Thus, a heart’s vow is the same as a mouth’s vow—
It must be genuine.
This is the practice of the **Dao Immortals** (仙人).

The talismans will arrive immediately upon invocation.
One must remember their names and surnames,
And keep them in mind during leisure hours.
When urgently invoked,
Their power will manifest instantly.
Moreover, before eating or drinking,
One must first mentally invoke them,
And maintain the presence of the **Divine Officials**, **Talisman Clerks of the Decade**, and **Jade Girls** throughout the day.
If one shares food and drink with them as subjects,
They will bestow the **Mysterious Sweet Offerings** (玄甘飨).
When consuming various foods, drinks, or fruits,
One must always mentally invoke them daily,
And share in the same food and drink.
This practice, when consistently applied,
Will yield great efficacy.

They can also suppress **army disasters** (兵害) and subdue **heavenly demons** (天魔).
*Annotation:* In antiquity, a Daoist in the mountains named **Li Boyao** (李伯药),
Often cultivated the **Six Jia Method** and ingested the talismans.
He stayed in the mountains for five years without emerging.

One day, suddenly, he saw a man in green robes,
Riding a leopard, offering a small bottle.
The man said:
*"This is the **Great Elixir Master Boyao** (大丹伯药).
You have nearly attained the Dao,
But your form and spirit are withering.
You must ingest this elixir,
And you will achieve long life.
I have come today to bestow this medicine upon you—
This is the **True Great Reversion Elixir** (真大还丹).
Here is a golden bottle.
Look, the bottle contains the **True Golden Elixir** (真金丹),
With pills of a **purple-gold hue** (紫金色).
I tell you, my disciples:
I have now attained the Dao.
The **Daoist Messengers** (仙使) have brought me the **Great Elixir** (太丹).
I will take it and ascend to the heavens.
You must follow my practice,
And never waver in your resolve—
You will surely also obtain this elixir.
On the day of my departure,
Come to the heavens to seek me out."

Li Boyao’s disciple, **Wei Xiang** (韦祥), did not yet understand,
And only heard voices in the forest,
As if from hundreds of people,
Including the sounds of women.

In a short while, one voice issued orders:
*"Seize him!"*
Immediately, over ten men in red robes,
Clad as **leopard-riding messengers** (乘豹使者),
Captured and threw the man to the ground.
He transformed into an **Old Dragon** (老龙),
And the leopard into an **Old Tiger** (老虎).
They struck him with twenty blows.

With a stern command, they declared:
*"Li Boyao has attained the Dao,
Though he has not yet gained renown—
He has long been inscribed in the **Daoist Register** (仙籍).
How dare he act as a **malevolent ghost** (为祟),
Seeking to harm with poisonous elixir!"*

Li Boyao knew this was not a true person,
And questioned them about their origins.
The **Jade Girl of Jia-Shen** (甲申玉女) responded:
*"The **Heavenly Demon Poison Ghosts** (天魔毒鬼),
Transformed into an Old Dragon and Old Tiger,
To harm you.
If you do not diligently cultivate the Six Jia,
You will surely fall to their poison and die."*

In a short while, the **Dragon and Tiger Poison Ghosts** (龙虎毒) all dissolved into ghosts and perished.
Were it not for the **Six Jia Deities’ power** (六甲神之功),
Li Boyao would not have been saved,
And would have been poisoned by the **Heavenly Demon’s elixir** (天魔进药) and died.

Now, this account is recorded for the world.
People should not presume to refuse or neglect them—
The **Heavenly Demon** will take back the elixir,
And depart in submission after bowing.
They will no longer dare to harm others,
And such instances often occur.
This allows one to earn merit and attain the Dao.»

chunks.original_text: 卿於诸教告有心，令先修功三元六甲，久自通神。 此法微妙，不可妄传非人。 老君曰：此法有六通神力。 一能通入大道之门，善假道威，伏神使鬼，制灭精妖，斩断凶祟。 二能通天，感使天神天龙，诛魔伏祆。 收云摄雨，逆横祆恶之炁，甚能摄除之。 三则通地，感使地神地龙，风云雷公，电师雨师风师，五岳四镇， 注：四镇谓之四渎，水官之镇山也。 九州千邦万国，土地山川神灵，社庙城隍， 注：城隍神，是后圣君许地府置之。 苏吴纪纪云：吴王苪是。 左社右稷神官。 使令助国，护身家，济人物。 四则通水，感使水神水龙，水中君官，将军灵吏，鱼鳞兽等。 令佐道护身，助家国，济人物。 五则通感卫於人。 人能久修服，使身家出於五行，永。 除五苦八难九厄，百病自消。 超出三界，得入长生，驱使天地水三官神灵，立到分明。 六则能通感使七星北斗君，神妃后女 注：北斗中有一正后，三妃，二夫人，并二娇女，皆为北斗之七君位号也。 等，以主世人之死簿。 世人知之，以多取六甲日作图，先步地纪。 次天纲，次禹步。 三等 注：三等主三元数也。 世人步纲，以地纪为上元。 仙人步纲，以天纲为上元也。 尹寿子曰：世人身未出三界，步地纪为先，则为上元。 仙人身出水火三界，即步天纲为先，则为上元。 且步纲法，须终三等足，谓之步纲数也。 谓之天地人，是应出三界三灾之法，身入神仙，长生不死之道。 有诀在《流珠上引》中。 注：诀上引第一卷中。 世人学道者，可明此一条，足知六甲六通，得离水火三界之法，去七宿之灾害。 注：夫泄人不论贵贱大小，生则南斗所主王炁，令早得生荣长年，愿人不死。 死则北斗所主衰炁，令早得疾病，病极而死。 后圣君大恶之，故以前后易身出世，告命灵符秘法，演《金锁流珠》新名，改易金箓旧语，明出天纲地纪步蹑之道，以制伏北斗中六阴之神灾害炁，永出长生仙道，得离北斗之下。 世人遇者，皆知修行，行而有功，北斗中六阴宫神君妃后娇女等，畏而受使，使之为衣，随手指转天关，摄天魔地祆皆伏，此是后圣君大传中言。 令人得道，上升云天。 太上老君叙六甲秘符文曰：吾服六甲符，初先师令服授文，为之六十日，始渐知。 一百二十日，百病退。 二百四十日，百病消除。

「You, among the various teachings, have shown true earnestness.
Thus, you must first diligently cultivate the **Three Elements** (三元) and **Six Jia** (六甲),
And over time, you will naturally attain communion with the gods.
This method is subtle and profound,
And should not be carelessly transmitted to those unworthy.

**Laozi** (老君) said:
*"This method possesses six divine powers (六通神力).
First, it grants passage into the **Great Dao’s Gate** (大道之门),
Skillfully leveraging the **Dao’s authority** (假道威),
Subduing gods and enslaving ghosts,
Quelling and annihilating malevolent spirits and **Jiao-demons** (精妖),
Severing and dispelling **Feng-spirits** (凶祟).

Second, it allows communion with the **Heavenly Realm** (通天),
Inspiring the **Heavenly Gods** (天神) and **Heavenly Dragons** (天龙)
To exterminate demons and subdue **Heavenly Conflicts** (祆).
It can gather clouds and summon rains,
Countering the **obstructive and malevolent qi of rebellious spirits** (逆横祆恶之炁),
And effectively dispel such calamities.

Third, it grants communion with the **Earthly Realm** (通地),
Inspiring the **Earthly Gods** (地神) and **Earthly Dragons** (地龙),
As well as the **Wind and Cloud Lords** (风云雷公),
**Lightning, Rain, and Wind Officials** (电师雨师风师),
The **Five Sacred Mountains** (五岳) and **Four Celestial Constraints** (四镇).
*Note: The Four Celestial Constraints are also called the Four Rivers (四渎), the official waters that constrain the mountains.*
The **Nine Regions and Ten Thousand States, Myriad Countries** (九州千邦万国),
And all **terrestrial deities** (土地山川神灵),
**Ancestral shrines and city gods** (社庙城隍),
*Note: City God (城隍神) is a deity appointed by the later Sage Emperor (后圣君) to oversee the Underworld (地府).*
As recorded in the **Sū Brū** (苏吴纪纪云): *"King Fú of Wú"* (吴王苪是).
The **Left Ancestral and Right Harvest Deities** (左社右稷神官).
They will assist the realm,
Protect your person and family,
And aid all living beings.

Fourth, it grants communion with the **Watery Realm** (通水),
Inspiring the **Water Gods** (水神) and **Water Dragons** (水龙),
As well as the **Water Officials** (水中君官),
**Generals and Spirit Ministers** (将军灵吏),
And all **fish, scales, and beasts** (鱼鳞兽等).
They will assist the **Dao** and protect your person,
Help your family and realm,
And aid all living beings.

Fifth, it grants communion to **guard and shield** (通感卫) the person.
If one persistently cultivates and practices it,
One’s body and family will transcend the **Five Phases** (五行),
And achieve eternal harmony.
It removes the **Five Sufferings** (五苦),
**Eight Hardships** (八难),
And **Nine Calamities** (九厄),
And all diseases will naturally vanish.
One will rise above the **Three Realms** (三界),
Attain **Long Life** (长生),
And command the **Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water** (天地水三官神灵),
With distinct and clear results.

Sixth, it grants communion to **command the Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper** (七星北斗君),
**Divine Consorts and Ladies** (神妃后女),
*Note: Within the Northern Dipper (北斗), there is one Principal Lady (正后),
Three Consorts (三妃),
Two Ladies-in-Waiting (二夫人),
And two Delicate Damsels (并二娇女),
All holding titles as the Seven Officials of the Northern Dipper (北斗之七君位号).*
And others, to oversee the **register of human deaths** (主世人之死簿).
When people learn of this,
They often take **Six Jia Days** (六甲日) to create diagrams,
First following the **Earthly Measure** (地纪),
Then the **Heavenly Measure** (天纲),
And finally the **Yǔ Steps** (禹步).
*Note: The Three Measures (三等) correspond to the Three Elements (三元数).*
Common folk follow the **Heavenly Measure** (步纲),
Using the **Earthly Measure** (地纪) as the **Upper Element** (上元).
Immortals follow the **Heavenly Measure** (步纲),
Using the **Heavenly Measure** (天纲) as the **Upper Element** (上元).
As **Yǐn Shòu** (尹寿子) said:
*"For common folk, whose bodies have not yet transcended the Three Realms (三界),
They follow the Earthly Measure (地纪) first,
Thus making it the Upper Element (上元).
For Immortals, whose bodies have transcended the Three Realms of Water, Fire, and Earth (水火三界),
They follow the Heavenly Measure (天纲) first,
Thus making it the Upper Element (上元).
Moreover, the practice of the Heavenly Measure (步纲法),
Must be completed in three full sets of steps,
Called the Heavenly Measure Steps (步纲数).
This is referred to as the **Heavenly, Earthly, and Human** (天地人),
Which corresponds to the method of transcending the Three Realms and Three Calamities (三界三灾),
And entering the path of **Divine Immortality** (神仙),
The **Dao of Long Life and Non-Death** (长生不死之道).
There is a secret formula within the *Líu Zhū Shàng Yǐn* (流珠上引).
*Note: The formula is found in the first volume of the *Líu Zhū Shàng Yǐn* (流珠上引).*
All who learn the **Dao** (学道者),
Should understand this principle,
And thus know the **Six Jia’s Six Powers** (六甲六通),
To transcend the Three Realms of Water and Fire (离水火三界之法),
And avoid the calamities of the **Seven Mansions** (去七宿之灾害).
*Note: The Southern Dipper (南斗) oversees the vital qi (王炁) of all people,
Causing them to attain early birth, longevity, and prosperity (早得生荣长年),
And wishes that people do not die.
The Northern Dipper (北斗) oversees the declining qi (衰炁) of all people,
Causing them to fall ill early and die from severe disease (早得疾病，病极而死).
The later Sage Emperor (后圣君) greatly abhorred this,
Thus he reversed the roles of the Northern and Southern Dippers (前后易身出世),
And revealed the **Divine Talismans and Secret Dao** (告命灵符秘法),
Interpreting the *Jīn Suǒ Líu Zhū* (金锁流珠) as a new name,
Changing the old terminology of *Jīn Luó* (金箓),
Clarifying the method of following the Heavenly and Earthly Measures (明出天纲地纪步蹑之道),
To subdue and control the **six yin deities of the Northern Dipper** (制伏北斗中六阴之神灾害炁),
Eternally attaining the **Dao of Long Life and Divine Immortality** (永出长生仙道),
And avoiding the influence of the Northern Dipper (得离北斗之下).
When common folk encounter this,
They all know to practice and cultivate it.
If they do so with sincerity and achieve results,
The six yin deities of the Northern Dipper—
The **Consorts, Ladies, and Delicate Damsels** (神君妃后娇女等)—
Will fear and submit to their commands,
Using them as **divine garments** (为衣),
And following their hand gestures to open the **Heavenly Gate** (转天关),
Subduing all **Heavenly Demons and Earthly Conflicts** (摄天魔地祆).
This is what the later Sage Emperor (后圣君) taught in his great transmission.
It allows one to attain the Dao (得道),
And ascend to the heavens (上升云天).

**Laozi, the Most High Sage** (太上老君),
Explained the **Secret Talismans of the Six Jia** (六甲秘符文) as follows:
*"I practiced the Six Jia Talismans (服六甲符),
First receiving the **Preceptor’s Instructions** (先师令服授文).
For sixty days (六十日),
I gradually began to understand.
After one hundred and twenty days (一百二十日),
All hundred diseases retreated (百病退).
After two hundred and forty days (二百四十日),
All hundred diseases were eliminated (百病消除)."*」

Were it not for the **Six Jia Deities’ power** (六甲神之功),
Li Boyao would not have been saved,
And would have been poisoned by the **Heavenly Demon’s elixir** (天魔进药) and died.

Now, this account is recorded for the world.

chunks.original_text: 三百六十日，玉女来侍卫魂魄，往往梦中如见。 千日，玉女当直日分，直神直官。 注：往往有灵瑞征验事，不在言之限。 二千日，行符神验，身入神仙，直神如人，往往来见。 但言之自当身不多见，冲近人也。 注：按此说老君不用人多言，见於直符兵吏玉童玉女等，恐世人疑言，相谤为妖，毁斥正真。 故以代代相授，今正一心直，入无为之道，无惑无邪，无非无失，得一者也。 三千日，六甲玉女常多见身。 一十四年，上升天，入摇光，低昂北斗。 注：夫人行步纲得道，须令登北斗后，即上入天宫。 故北斗须迎此人，故谓入摇光，低昂北斗是也。 北斗一为低，摇光之下迎。 老君曰：若欲步七星，六甲先成。 注：为人魂魄皆畏北斗，故吞符服六甲，能生於人，故魂魄不畏北斗也。 故六甲能生於人，故魂不畏，常畏北斗。 所以代代圣人，意取为纲步之一，令魂魄不畏。 二伏北斗，为之衣，使之如从仆，敬之如兄妹。 欲步九迹，六甲先积。 注：积，服符修行积也。 皆六甲功也。 其六甲有三等军，亦有三等府院。 注：府院如三军营，亦有三府也。 上等者，上元太一府，六甲军也。 注：在太极之中，谓之天上，六甲军营府也。 有三官将以管，将军从官玉童玉女，名具《老君六甲秘符箓》中。 兵士三百六十万人众，以制阴阳五行之逆炁也。 故在上太一之府，上真中官，中镇河源，下镇人世，使四时行令不失，五行变化得时者也。 以太一使者主之一军，上镇天宫，制魔保举得道之人。 太一使者，每一年三奏太上道君及后圣君也。 天师曰：今上等老君六甲一君，佐卫在太平金阙后圣玉皇上道君殿左阶下立。 注：如世天子，会立正朝之卿也，亦有左右。 每一年三大朝，立仙真旗仗旌节，命魔威神制鬼之心，令以道威，正肃天地人神，龙鬼制魔，保举有道，消伏愆过也。 一年之中，三朝会礼也。 注：每年上元一会，正月十五日是。 中元一会，七月十五日是。 下元一会，十月十五日是。 一年有此三日，天地水三元五行六甲等，神人真仙官兵将玉童玉女等，皆一一随天真大仙，佐卫朝於玉皇上道君殿前，明检十天之内，驱分左右，点记有心，前言成道之真人，见在未来其数，后检生民。 十天之内，善恶功过，俱一一奏闻玉皇。 玉皇面勑三官，各令制伏凶恶，令部生死，托受巡内贤愚，分判罪善，允其平等，列记十天。 勿令死心屈於生死世界，明付司命也。 中等灵飞六甲一军，佐卫在太平金阙后圣君玉皇上道君殿右阶下立。 注：俱同左会日月也。 下等阴阳六甲，在人世记配金木水火土，得人之命，相生相克之候，候吉凶而相匹配也。 注：此言在世人夫妻水火相刑相克之事，我行大道，自消此相克也。 右些二等六甲，世学之人，知此三等六甲之法，六功修服步蹑，万事应心，自消阴速於水火，阴取长生，疾於步蹑。 注：言阴取长生者，言双行服老君六甲符，及灵飞六甲符，功着更着，更行步蹑天纲地纪之功着，疾成於步摄。 是知上中二等修服之功，一等以命运匹配，相扶相生相顺之功，志人善行， 注：下等别自有引，在上巷中言五行。 立入长生。 第二等者，灵飞六甲上元正一府也，谓之灵飞六甲军。 右营营中官将，一同左府具，
chunks.translated_text:
「Three hundred and sixty days,
The **Celestial Maiden** (玉女) attends and guards the **soul and vital essence** (魂魄),
Often appearing in dreams as if in person.

At one thousand days,
The Celestial Maiden will manifest during the day,
Guarding both the **Divine Essence** (神) and the **Divine Officials** (官).
*Note: There are often signs of spiritual efficacy and verification (灵瑞征验事), which are not limited to this account.*

At two thousand days,
The talisman’s efficacy manifests—
The body enters the realm of the **Immortal Deities** (神仙),
And the Divine Essence appears as a human being,
Often seen in person.

But the spoken words (言) are only for the self;
The body does not often appear.
The **Polarity** (冲) is near to humanity.
*Note: According to this, Laozi does not often appear in human form,
But is seen through the talismans of soldiers, officials, and Celestial Maidens (玉童玉女等).
Fearful that people might doubt his words,
And slander him as a demon (妖), destroying the true Dao,
Hence the transmission through generations.*

Thus, the **Direct Transmission of the Single Mind** (正一心直) is passed down,
Entering the **Way of Non-Action** (无为之道),
Free from confusion and perversity (无惑无邪),
Free from error and loss (无非无失),
Attaining **Oneness** (得一者也).

At three thousand days,
The Six Jia Celestial Maidens (六甲玉女) often appear in person.

After fourteen years,
One ascends to the heavens (上升天),
Entering the **Shaking Light** (摇光),
And bowing to the **Big Dipper** (北斗).
*Note: When a person’s steps align with the Dao (步纲得道),
They must first ascend to the Big Dipper’s realm (北斗),
Then enter the heavenly palaces (天宫).
Hence, the Big Dipper must welcome this person,
And the phrase "entering the Shaking Light, bowing to the Big Dipper" (入摇光，低昂北斗) is used.*

The Big Dipper **lowers once** (北斗一为低),
And the Shaking Light **welcomes below** (摇光之下迎).

Laozi says:
*"If one wishes to tread the **Seven Stars** (步七星),
The Six Jia must first be perfected."*

*Note: For humans, the soul and vital essence (魂魄) all fear the Big Dipper (北斗).
Thus, those who swallow talismans and practice the Six Jia (吞符服六甲)
Can be reborn in humanity,
And the soul and vital essence no longer fear the Big Dipper.
Hence, the Six Jia can bring rebirth in humanity (生於人),
And the soul no longer fears it,
Yet still fears the Big Dipper.
Therefore, the Sage Emperors of each generation (代代圣人)
Intended this as a means to align with the Dao (为纲步之一),
So that the soul and vital essence do not fear it.*

To **subdue the Big Dipper** (伏北斗),
Use them as **divine garments** (为之衣),
And command them as if they were obedient servants (如从仆),
Respecting them like kin (敬之如兄妹).

To tread the **Nine Steps** (步九迹),
The Six Jia must first be **accumulated** (先积).
*Note: "Accumulated" (积) refers to the practice of swallowing talismans and cultivating (服符修行积).
All are functions of the Six Jia.*

The Six Jia have three ranks of **Divine Armies** (三等军),
And also three ranks of **Divine Offices** (三等府院).
*Note: The Divine Offices (府院) resemble the three ranks of armies (三军营),
And there are also three ranks of offices.*

The highest rank is the **Supreme Unity Office of the Upper Element** (上元太一府),
The Six Jia **Divine Army** (六甲军).
*Note: Within the Supreme Ultimate (太极),
This is called the Heavenly Upper (天上),
The Six Jia Divine Army’s encampment and office (六甲军营府).*

With three **Divine Generals** (三官将) overseeing,
The generals and their subordinates—Celestial Maidens and Maidens (玉童玉女)—
Are named as recorded in *Laozi’s Secret Talismans of the Six Jia* (《老君六甲秘符箓》).

The **soldiers** (兵士) number **three million six hundred thousand** (三百六十万人众),
To subdue the **inverted forces of Yin-Yang and the Five Phases** (阴阳五行之逆炁).
Hence, they are stationed in the Supreme Unity Office (上太一之府),
The **Upper Divine Official of the True Middle** (上真中官),
The **Middle Divine Official of the River Source** (中镇河源),
And the **Lower Divine Official of Humanity** (下镇人世),
So that the four seasons follow their commands without error (四时行令不失),
And the Five Phases transform in accordance with their due times (五行变化得时).

The **Supreme Unity Messenger** (太一使者) commands one army,
The **Upper Divine Official of the Heavenly Palace** (上镇天宫),
To subdue demons and protect those who attain the Dao (保举得道之人).

The Supreme Unity Messenger (太一使者)
Each year presents **three offerings** (三奏) to the **Supreme Daoist Sovereign** (太上道君)
And the **Later Sage Emperor** (后圣君).

The **Heavenly Master** (天师) says:
*"The highest rank of Laozi’s Six Jia (上等老君六甲) is one Sovereign (一君),
Assisting and guarding at the **Golden Threshold of the Later Sage Emperor** (太平金阙后圣玉皇上道君殿)
On the left staircase below (左阶下立).*
*Note: Like the worldly sovereign (世天子),
They stand in the proper court assemblies (会立正朝之卿),
With left and right distinctions.*

Each year, they hold **three great assemblies** (三大朝),
Raising the **flags and banners of the Immortal Deities** (仙真旗仗旌节),
Commanding the **Divine Forces of Demons** (魔威神) to restrain the hearts of ghosts (制鬼之心),
So that they submit to the **Daoic威** (道威),
And the **Ten Heavens** (十天) are properly revered by gods, humans, and deities (天地人神),
The **Dragons and Ghosts** (龙鬼) subdue demons (制魔),
And protect those who attain the Dao (保举有道),
Eliminating faults and transgressions (消伏愆过).

Within one year,
There are three assemblies of reverence and offering.
*Note: The first assembly (上元) is on the fifteenth day of the first month (正月十五日).
The second assembly (中元) is on the fifteenth day of the seventh month (七月十五日).
The third assembly (下元) is on the fifteenth day of the tenth month (十月十五日).
In one year, these three days (三日)
Are when the gods of the Ten Heavens, the Five Phases, the Six Jia (十天之内，三元五行六甲等),
And the Immortal Deities’ officers and soldiers (神人真仙官兵将玉童玉女等)
All, one by one, follow the **Heavenly True Immortal Sovereign** (天真大仙),
Assisting and guarding in the assemblies before the **Later Sage Emperor’s Heavenly Palace** (玉皇上道君殿前),
To inspect the Ten Heavens (明检十天),
Driving and dividing left and right (驱分左右),
Marking those with intent (点记有心),
And before them, the true cultivators who have attained the Dao (前言成道之真人),
Their number seen in the present and future,
And afterward, they inspect the living populace (后检生民).

Within the Ten Heavens,
All good and evil deeds and merits are reported to the Jade Emperor (玉皇).
The Jade Emperor then commands the **Three Officials** (三官),
Each to subdue the wicked and evil (制伏凶恶),
To record the fate of life and death (令部生死),
To entrust the inspection of the virtuous and foolish (托受巡内贤愚),
To judge and classify crimes and goodness (分判罪善),
And to maintain fairness and equality (允其平等),
Listing their records in the Ten Heavens (列记十天).

Do not allow the **rebellious hearts** (死心) to submit to the world of life and death (屈於生死世界),
And clearly entrust them to the **Divine Official of Fate** (司命).

The middle rank is the **Six Jia of the Soul’s Flight** (灵飞六甲),
Assisting and guarding at the **Golden Threshold of the Later Sage Emperor** (太平金阙后圣君玉皇上道君殿)
On the right staircase below (右阶下立).
*Note: The same as the left, in terms of timing and month.*

The lower rank is the **Yin-Yang Six Jia** (阴阳六甲),
Assigned to human life according to the **Five Phases’ correspondences** (金木水火土),
To match the **life-giving and life-subduing cycles** (得人之命),
And to correspond with the **auspicious and inauspicious timing** (相生相克之候),
Judging fortune and misfortune (候吉凶) and matching accordingly (而相匹配).
*Note: This refers to the affairs of Yin-Yang correspondence in humanity (世人夫妻水火相刑相克之事).
In practicing the Great Dao (行大道),
One naturally dissolves this cycle of subjugation (自消此相克).*

The latter two ranks of the Six Jia (右些二等六甲),
For those who study in the world (世学之人),
Knowing the methods of these three ranks of the Six Jia (三等六甲之法),
The **Six Functions of Practice and Cultivation** (六功修服步蹑)
Make all matters align with intent (万事应心),
Naturally dissolving the **Yin’s rapidity in Water and Fire** (自消阴速於水火),
And the **Yin’s attainment of longevity** (阴取长生),
Swiftly accomplished through the **Nine Steps** (疾於步蹑).
*Note: Those who speak of the Yin attaining longevity (阴取长生)
Refer to practicing the Six Jia talismans of Laozi (服老君六甲符),
And the Six Jia talismans of the Soul’s Flight (灵飞六甲符),
Accumulating their efficacy (功着更着),
And further practicing the Nine Steps to align with the Dao (步蹑天纲地纪之功着),
Swiftly achieving the **subduing of the Nine Steps** (疾成於步摄).

Thus, the highest and middle ranks of practice and cultivation (上中二等修服之功),
The first rank’s function of matching fate and destiny (一等以命运匹配),
Mutually supporting, generating, and following (相扶相生相顺),
Encourages humans to act virtuously (志人善行),
*Note: The lower rank has its own distinct function,
As mentioned earlier in the passage regarding the Five Phases (下等别自有引，在上巷中言五行).*

And to establish the **Way of Longevity** (立入长生).

The second rank is the **Six Jia of the Soul’s Flight, Supreme Unity Office of the Upper Element** (灵飞六甲上元正一府),
Called the **Six Jia Divine Army of the Soul’s Flight** (灵飞六甲军).

The **encampment and its officers** (右营营中官将),
Are the same as those of the left office (一同左府具),」

chunks.original_text: 中华总真大仙宰王方平张道陵赵升王长司命李仲甫茅盈许玉斧等系代撰述 中华仙人李淳风注 六甲阴功上之上 太上老君常敕左右军，修举其功过。 注：言功满三千者，可迁仙位。 过犯三十条者，退仙一阶。 敕三官，故常令甲子日言奏文状。 在於六甲君官将吏等，多以取甲子日言功。 功是阴功也。 其阴功有六， 注：一每日心礼天尊前圣、后圣太上大道君、天帝三尊、三元等君。 言此功自在师口诀，受法之时，须口一一上问记取，莫忘此是口言功，为第一秘法。 夫修行人不得此法，存礼百无有通。 不知次第而行功，天曹并不言录事。 须一一得师口诀以传　授，身心俱受。 毕，便吞符，功可上天记录。 一一与子，言其多少也。 闻奏不绝也。 今具列言阴功阴德，阳功阳德，各具在。 有七条墨书，是前圣虚皇上帝大道君，授合仙之人。 骨命不合仙不授。 注：前圣，太上老君是也。 朱书是后圣玉皇上帝上道君，授合真之人。 不合真不授。 注：夫为师传法，皆须细试弟子，察其情性。 若多阳功，不须妄授。 内阴功有三，前圣授三皇君及四十九　真人。 俱得仙。 一则身授道后，内以直心阴修，救度人物疾病，自身常服。 二等六甲，计日言功，前修老君六甲，三年服符，道炁镇神，安心炁治，五藏光明，神力有济， 注：济者，以符试救人疾厄，得差度者，谓之神力通。 济人之难，得神之力，上感道恩。 德合天心，功救得一人一物命，谓之功济也。 即添服灵飞六甲符，便以计修年月日修行之功，谓之第一阴功也。 后圣君告东海青童君，及诸天诸方合为 注：合为者，是告此法之时，未得为仙真之位，犹是志心求修人。 未得成道，受此法后，皆十年、十五年、十四年、八年、九年得道，成大真人。 后圣君知其识性，合为真人，故言合为大真人也。 大真人曰：夫志人识性，真心修求大道，皆须内着阴功阳德，即积此功德，而为真人。 注：阴功阳德，具后注说。 非从宿因前业，所种生命，骨体合道， 注：宿因说生合官职，所种即合，有少许来由，若说求真，情性俱失。 此名身外种植福田。 资给来生，得受人中之因，不关身中得道之事。 夫求真者，真人之情性，即得也。 即得为真人，此是妄言也。 吾今一一具说此法，於《六甲引书》之内，而作三等阴功，三等阳德，授传识性， 注：识性者，识道之性而无妄。 常行阴德阴功不休，故世人龙神鬼畏而敬之，谓之识真也。 继代为真人。 第一等阴功，六甲中修行，出五行三界之法。 注：法中服符祭醮奏章步纲等法，各各自有经传流行世。 世虽有本，而无真者言功也。 第二等阴功，七星中步蹑地纪天纲，降九精，使九灵，衣七斗，消五毒，度三灾，入真境之法。 注：此法各自有经文，此言修行用功之科，具在《金锁流珠》中有也。 第三等阴功，变三五七九， 注：三是三元，五是五行，七是七星，天纲地纪。 九是九真，上大道君九祖君。 内说步纲之法，驱役万神之要诀。 禹步之要。 注：三是三元，即行九迹禹步。 五是五行，上元三五禹步法，或十二迹，或十五迹。 皆变天纲地纪之步，而多是受之於务犹子，之下后方变　为禹步。 右三等阴功，皆合墨书，为前圣曾授上盘古三皇，中古黄帝、夏禹，权代不绝。

The **Sovereign Celestial Master** of the **Great Perfected** of **Zhonghua**, **Zaiwang Fangping Zhang Daoling**, **Zhao Shengwang**, **Chang Sishiming**, **Li Zhongfu**, **Mao Ying**, **Xu Yufu**, and others, compiled and transmitted across generations.
**Li Chunfeng**, the Daoist Immortal, annotated.

**Supreme Lord Laozi** eternally commands the **Left and Right Armies**, recording their merits and transgressions.
*Note:* Those whose merits reach **three thousand** may ascend to a **Daoist rank**. Those with **thirty offenses** are demoted one rank.
Thus, the **Three Officials** are perpetually ordered to report on **Jiazi days** in written petitions.

Among the **Six Jia officers, generals, and officials**, many falsely claim merits on **Jiazi days**.
These merits are **hidden merits** (*yīn gōng*).
There are **six hidden merits**:
*Note:*
1. Each day, **reverentially recite** before the **Celestial Worthy, Forebear Saints, the Supreme Dao Lord, the Heavenly Emperor, and the Three Sovereigns**.
   These merits are **spoken**—when receiving the **precepts**, one must **verbally inquire** and **memorize** them from the Master’s **oral instructions**. Do not forget—this is the **first secret method**.
   Without this method, even **hundreds of rituals** are meaningless.
   If one does not follow the proper order, the **Heavenly Tribunals** will not record their deeds.
   One must **receive the Master’s oral instructions** and **embody them** in both **mind and body**.
   Upon completion, **swallow the talisman**, and the merits will be **recorded in Heaven**.

   Each merit is **counted individually**, and their **reports never cease**.
   Now, I enumerate the **hidden merits and hidden virtues**, as well as the **manifest merits and manifest virtues**, all clearly laid out.

   There are **seven墨书 (*mòshū*)**—granted by the **Forebear Saint, the Supreme Emperor of the Great Dao**, to those **whose fate aligns with Dao**.
   *Note:* The **Forebear Saint** refers to **Supreme Lord Laozi**.
   **朱书 (*zhūshū*)** are granted by the **Later Saint, the Jade Emperor of the Supreme Dao**, to those **whose fate aligns with Truth**.
   *Note:* When a Master transmits the **precepts**, one must **carefully test the disciple**, observing their **nature and disposition**.
   If they possess **excessive manifest merits**, they should not be **recklessly granted** the **precepts**.

   Among the **hidden merits**, there are **three**:
   The **Forebear Saint** granted them to the **Three Sovereigns** and the **Forty-Nine True Persons**, all attaining **Daoist immortality**.
   The first is: **After receiving the Dao**, internally cultivate with **sincere heart**, healing the **suffering of all beings**, while **personally ingesting** the remedies.
   The second: **Six Jia officers** calculate daily merits—**prior cultivation** under **Lord Laozi’s Six Jia**, **three years of talisman ingestion**, **Dao-qi subduing the spirit**, **calming the heart-qi**, **illuminating the five viscera**, and **manifesting divine efficacy**.
   *Note:* **"Efficacy"** refers to using talismans to **test and heal** others’ calamities—those who recover are said to have **divine efficacy**. **Rescuing lives and things** counts as **meritorious efficacy**, **adding to the service of the *Lingfei Six Jia* talismans**, and **calculating the years, months, and days of cultivation**—this is the **first hidden merit**.

   The **Later Saint Lord** instructed the **Eastern Sea Qingtong Lord** and all **Heavenly and Earthly beings** to **align with** (*héwéi*).
   *Note:* **"Align with"** refers to those who, at the time of receiving this method, **had not yet attained Daoist immortality** but **aspired to cultivate**. After receiving the precepts, they **attain Dao in ten, fifteen, fourteen, eight, or nine years**, becoming **Great True Persons**.
   The **Later Saint Lord**, knowing their **nature and disposition**, grants them the title of **Great True Person**.

   The **Great True Person** says:
   *"Those who sincerely seek the Great Dao must internally cultivate **hidden merits and manifest virtues**, accumulating these **merits and virtues** to become **True Persons**.*
   *Note:* **Hidden merits and manifest virtues** are fully explained in the later annotations.
   Those who seek **Truth** must have **nature and disposition aligned with Dao**—this is not from **past karmic causes** or **pre-planted life forces**, nor is it **merely a matter of fate**.
   *Note:* **Past karmic causes** determine **official rank in life**, while **pre-planted** implies **some connection**, but if one speaks of **seeking Truth**, their **nature and disposition are lost**.
   This is called **external planting of merit-fields**, benefiting **future lives**, receiving **human rebirth**, but unrelated to **attaining Dao in this life**.
   Those who truly seek **Truth** must have **nature and disposition of a True Person**—this is **not mere speech**.
   Now, I **delineate this method** within the *Six Jia Induction Scripture*, establishing **three grades of hidden merits** and **three grades of manifest virtues**, transmitting to those of **recognized nature**.
   *Note:* **"Recognized nature"** means **knowing the Dao’s essence without delusion**, perpetually practicing **hidden virtues and hidden merits**, thus **dragons, spirits, and ghosts** fear and revere them—this is called **recognizing Truth**, succeeding as **True Persons** across generations.

   **First-grade hidden merits**: Cultivation within the **Six Jia**, practicing the **Five Phases and Three Realms’ methods**.
   *Note:* These include **talisman ingestion, sacrificial rites, petitions, and step-alignment**—each has its own **scriptures and transmitted traditions**. Though the world has these texts, none truly **record merits**.

   **Second-grade hidden merits**: Within the **Seven Stars**, **treading the Earthly Measures and Heavenly Rites**, descending the **Nine Essences**, commanding the **Nine Spirits**, donning the **Seven Battles**, dispelling the **Five Toxins**, averting the **Three Calamities**, and entering the **True Realm’s methods**.
   *Note:* Each method has its own **scriptures**; these are the **cultivation practices** detailed in the *Golden Lock, Flowing Pearl*.

   **Third-grade hidden merits**: Transforming **three, five, seven, nine**—
   *Note:* **Three** refers to the **Three Sovereigns**, **five** to the **Five Phases**, **seven** to the **Seven Stars** (Heavenly Rites and Earthly Measures), and **nine** to the **Nine True Ones**, the **Nine Ancestral Lords of the Supreme Dao Lord**.
   Internally, it explains the **step-alignment method**, the **essential key to commanding ten thousand spirits**.
   The **essential key to the *Yǔ-bù* (Turtle Steps)**.
   *Note:* **Three** refers to the **Three Sovereigns**, performing the **nine-track *Yǔ-bù***.
   **Five** refers to the **Five Phases**, using the **upper *Yǔ-bù* of the Three Fives**, or **twelve tracks**, or **fifteen tracks**—all varying the **Heavenly Rites and Earthly Measures**, primarily transmitted from **Mù Yóu’s descendants**, later refined into the *Yǔ-bù*.

   These **three grades of hidden merits** are all **granted in墨书 (*mòshū*)**, originally bestowed by the **Forebear Saint** upon **Upper Swangnu, the Three Sovereigns**, **Middle Swangnu, the Yellow Emperor and Xia Yu**, and **transmitted uninterrupted across ages**.

chunks.original_text: 后圣方再授东海青童小君，一及诸天诸方大真者，即朱书也。 第一等阴功，有十条。 老君曰：第一条阴功，可以修服六甲服之，从甲子日始，终於癸亥又周而复始。 於甲子，每至旬满，逢甲日辄有三大符， 注：一玉女符，一是甲直日符，一甲州日将符三符并吞之。 并吞之。 即每日存呼神将旬将，旬玉女，六丁玉女，直日某神姓名， 注：假令甲子日即呼王文卿。 从官人数，符吏姓名等。 即诵前圣太上老君长生咒一遍，方始咒曰： 令则玄发白反黑，齿落更生。 神仙度准，心开月明。 出入行来一万神见营。 所求皆得，所愿皆成。 既、却百鬼，又辟五兵。 除某死籍，着则玄仙名。 乘云驾龙，上升天庭。 急急如律令。 祝讫，便服符。 日月年数，数一服不休。 此是论一日功，一年三百六十，功亦三百六十也。 年年行之不休，不论年月，身自坚牢，如金之体，百病不入，永无教坏之期。 此之阴功上条第一也。 此太上老君，教三皇条之上上条 第二条阴功，常以慈心，救人济物。 注：人有疾病在身，被鬼祟所害，以符药术救之，令人得疾。 差鬼得轻放，使人鬼相离，不为冤对。 此为大柚功於人，大恩赦鬼，各得相一去离，不为患害，名曰大功於人鬼者也。 解敌释对，阴行止谏之心。 常以得前一人言之定。 讫於夜后，阴与某人解某怨对，令其二人各自退悔其过，不相谋恨。 即须禹步，专大山隔断二魂神，不相恨念，毒炁各自消散。 后日月稍多，自能彼此消恶。 如此之功微妙，为上上妙极。 注：老君喻此阴功者，本是一人知有道，能制解江舌怨对，而法师领一人之言，便解谏，而人不相对怨，此名无上功德。 步天纲图，蹑地纪图，顺、倒、反三遍。 讫言曰：今有某州县乡里某官人， 百姓止言百姓某乙。

「The **Later Saint** then bestowed this upon the **Eastern Sea Blue Boy** and the **Lesser Lord**, and upon all the **Heavenly Lords and Great Truths** of every realm—this is the **Red Scripture**.

   The **first-grade hidden merit** has **ten conditions**.

   On the **Jiazi day**, whenever the **decade is complete**, upon encountering a **Jia day**, three great talismans shall appear.

   along with the **official ranks**, the **names of the talisman scribes**, and so forth.

   *"May your hair turn black from white, and your fallen teeth regrow.

   Ten thousand spirits shall witness your comings and goings.
   All your requests shall be granted, all your wishes fulfilled.
   You shall **ward off a hundred demons**, **dodge the Five Armies** (of calamity).
   Remove the record of your death, and inscribe you as **Dark Immortal**.
   Riding the clouds, harnessing the dragon, you shall ascend to the **Celestial Court**.

   Count the **days, months, and years**—each talisman is worn without ceasing.
   This is the **daily merit**; in one year of **three hundred sixty days**, the merit shall also be **three hundred sixty**.
   Practice this merit year after year without pause, regardless of month or day—your body shall grow **unyieldingly strong**, like **gold**, impervious to all **hundred diseases**, and you shall **forever avoid decay and ruin**.

   **Dissolving enmity and releasing grudges**, one must act with **the resolve to halt such deeds in darkness**.
   Always **determine the words of the prior person** (to be saved).
   After nightfall, **in darkness, resolve the grudge** between the person and the ghost—command them both to **retreat and repent their wrongs**, no longer plotting **vengeance or hatred**.
   Then, **perform the Yǔ-bù (Turtle Steps)**, **specialize in the Great Mountain Isolation** to sever the **two souls and spirits**, so they no longer harbor **resentment or malice**, and their **poisonous qi** shall each disperse.
   As the days and months pass, they shall naturally **dissipate their ill will**.
   Such a merit is **exquisitely subtle**, the **supreme subtlety**.
   *Note:* **Lao Jun** metaphorically describes this hidden merit—when one person knows the **Dao/Way**, they can **mediate and resolve** the **grudges and enmity of the two parties**; yet the **Dharma Master** takes the words of that person and **immediately resolves the dispute**, so that the two no longer harbor grudges—this is called **supreme merit and virtue**.
   **Trace the Heavenly Rites Diagram**, **step upon the Earthly Measures Diagram**, and perform **three cycles**—**forward, backward, and reversed**.
   Conclude with the words: *"Now, there is in **State County Village** a certain **official**, or among the **common folk**, a certain **person**."*
